loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport produce to market

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a funny and enthusiastic smallholder farmer from a rural home in the South Rift area of Kenya. Dairy farming to David is not only a source of income, but also a livelihood. He has been a dairy farmer for years and he is still committed to the growth of his farm.

David is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. He plans to spend a small part of the loan on the cow’s insurance as a risk-mitigating measure to protect his family from slipping further into debt or poverty in the event the cow dies. The impact this loan will have on David and his family includes financial inclusion, business growth, capital accumulation and increase in income. David's ultimate goal is to elevate his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Las Orquideas Group

texts.es:
Ines es una mujer de 37 años de edad, vie con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 8, 13, 15 y 17 años y su negocio es la alfarería.
Ella es buena madre, independiente y muy emprendedora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Cotoca’ área rural que acopia toda la producción para comercializarla en la ciudad. 
Ines es de piel morena, baja estatura y físico robusto. Su lengua materna e3s el guaraní y habla español (la primera de la derecha viste chompa negra y cartera negra). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la agricultura y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera que sólo cuenta con energía eléctrica, no tiene agua potable ni alcantarillado. Las ganas de mejorar su negocio la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de semillas, venta de carne, venta de verduras, tejido de sombreros de sao, agricultura, comercio de pollos y venta de ropa de segunda mano. Su negocio es la fabricación de ollas de barro, estas se fabrican a partir de cerámica y le da forma mediante técnicas de alfarería, “en los días de frio trabajar con piezas grandes te sube la temperatura, Amasar, centrar y subir varios kilos de barro te ponen en acción…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas por mayor, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de tierra para hornear más ollas. Su sueño es tener más clientes y conseguir un ayudante, ella desea comprar tierra y combustible para fabricar ollas de barro. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ines solicita un préstamo para la compra de tierra para fabricar ollas de barro.
texts.en:
Ines is a 37 year old woman. She lives with her partner and has four children aged 8, 13, 15 y 17 years old. Her business is making pottery.

She is a good mother, independent and very enterprising. She does her business in the 'Cotoca’ area which is a rural zone that gathers all the produce for sale in the city.

Ines is dark-skinned, short in stature and physically robust. Her native language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish. (In the photo she is the first on the right wearing the black sweater and a black purse). She shares her life with her partner who works in agriculture and her children who study at school. They live in their own house made of wood that only has electricity. It has no running water or sewage.

Her desire to improve her business led her to form a group of people with businesses such as: the sale of seeds, selling meat, selling vegetables, weaving straw hats, agriculture, a chicken business and selling second hand clothing.

Her business is making clay pots. She makes them from ceramic and forms them with pottery techniques."On cold days working with big pieces warms you up. Kneading, centering and lifting a few kilograms of clay gets you going" she commented. The advantage of her business is her wholesale sales and her disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy earth to fire more pots. Her dream is to have more clients and get an assistant. This is her first loan with the institution in the 10 years she has been in business.

For these reasons she is requesting a loan to buy clay to make clay pots.

loans.use: to buy clay to make clay pots.

loans.name: Ziphorah

texts.en:
Ziphorah is 47 years old. She is very clear about what she wants for her life and she is determined to become a respected farmer in her village. Ziphorah is a married mother of five children. She conducts dairy and horticulture farming on her one acre piece of land. To earn a better income, she engages in cereal brokering, which involves arranging the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. Over the eight years that she has been in the business, she has made an effort to build strong relationships because in this business, success depends on reputation.

Given that Ziphorah can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. Your loan will help Ziphorah’s clients to focus on production, rather than sales. Ziphorah’s family also stands to benefit greatly from the improved incomes and elevated livelihood.

Ziphorah has hopes of being able to progress as a farmer and hopes to have a more stable income. She thanks all the people who are able to contribute to her dream.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to pull through, overcoming different obstacles that have arisen in her life. She is a mother of three from Nandihills, a remote town in the Rift valley province of Kenya. She has spent the past 7 years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Lily is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, dairy farming is closest to her heart.

Lily wants to diversify and start a cereal-selling business. She is requesting a loan to buy cereals for resale. The Nandihills area has a ready market for cereals, but the problem is that there are no cereal suppliers. With your loan, Lily will be able to sell cereals to the local market and to her neighbors. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money.

Lily is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from cereal selling will go to pay their school fees. She dreams of a secure future for her children.

Lily awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Farming is one of the most difficult jobs today due to the great effort that one must put forth in order to progress.

Hello Kiva lenders! The above picture presents Martha, a small-scale farmer who lives in the remote village of Kabore in the Nandihills area of Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with one lovely angelic-looking child. For the last ten years, Martha has been engaged in mixed farming and has never looked back; she really likes what she does. Her primary sources of income have been sales of milk, eggs and crops as well as some personal business in which she engages to make ends meet.

Martha finds farming very fulfilling and agrees with the notion that farming is a very profitable business venture. However, she constantly faces the challenge of poor productivity on her farm owing to a lack of farm inputs. She is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as quality seeds and fertilizer that will increase her production levels, which will immediately translate into increased income levels.

Martha is a very hard-working woman who believes that, through hard work and honest sweat, her living conditions will permanently change. She will use the extra income she will receive to repay the loan and increase her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as quality seeds.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka lives in a humble home in the town of Kitale, along with her husband and their 4 children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education. She has been doing agriculture for 7 years now. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her and also poor productivity.

Milka is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Milka and her family.

Support a smallholder farmer who's hungry to improve and get ahead with her determination.
Kindly loan to her today!

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as good quality fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Zipora

texts.en:
Hello, world! This is Zipora, a woman with grand aspirations. She is both humble and grateful and lives in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya, renowned for its rolling hills carpeted in manicured tea plantations.

Zipora is the mother of 5 lovely children, and she has been in the agriculture business for 15 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and vegetables.

Zipora has been relying on agriculture to provide all of her income. However, the rising costs of farming inputs (such as fertilizers) and fluctuations in market prices are some of the serious challenges that are cutting farmers' profits significantly.

Despite these tough conditions, Zipora remains positive and passionate about her economic activity. She is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This will enable her to expand the section of business least affected by harsh external conditions. Poultry farming is cheaper to run and the demand for chicken products is always high.

With this loan, Zipora will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business and earn more profits. An increase in income for her will be timely since it will enable her to tackle high farm-related costs next season. This will greatly improve the quality of her work since the cost of every input will be adequately met. As a result, she will realize better quality produce and more yields.

This loan will support Zipora’s economic activity, and will improve her family’s living standards as well.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Godofredo Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Carlos pertenece al banco comunal NUEVO AMANECER DEL CUSCO, el socio sigue dedicándose a trabajar en una entidad del estado en el área administrativa, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de víveres para su hogar como azúcar,leche,arroz entre otros.
El socio agradece a los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Carlos belongs to the NUEVO AMANECER communal bank. He continues to work in the administrative department of a government agency. He has been in this job for a long time, and he is doing very well because of the effort he puts into his work every day. He hopes to be able to continue working in this way to keep providing for his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy food supplies for his home such as sugar, milk, and rice, among other products.

He is grateful to the lenders for their support and is committed to making his repayments responsibly and on time.

loans.use: to buy food supplies for his home such as sugar, milk, and rice, among other products.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia Sabina se dedica al negocio de artesania, la socia es una persona muy trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesania. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sabina’s line of work is a handicrafts business.  She is a very hardworking person who, through her business, is getting her family ahead.  Her dream is to expand her business selling handicrafts.  She is asking for this loan to buy woven textiles, sweaters, and looms.

She is happy because of this loan and is committed to making her established payments.

loans.use: to buy woven textiles, sweaters, and looms

loans.name: Newton

texts.en:
Both tall and dark, Newton is a hardworking rural smallholder farmer. From a tender age, he has been involved in livestock and crop farming for both food and income. His main sources of income are milk and cereal produce.

Newton is seeking a loan in order to purchase important farm inputs. Having inputs - such as seeds, manure, herbicides, and pesticides - will improve soil fertility, control weeds and pests, and improve the farm's productivity.

A successful harvest would lead to an increase in food supply and income for Newton's family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a rural smallholder farmer based in Central Kenya. As a husband and a father, he relies on livestock and crop farming to generate the income needed for feeding, clothing, and sheltering his family.

Joseph is known to be very hands-on, and the key lesson that he has learnt over the years is that it is important not to compromise on the quality of inputs because it inevitably determines the outcome.

Joseph is seeking a loan to buy agriculture inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer in preparation for a successful harvest. A successful harvest would lead to both improved food security and income for his family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Progresando Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PROGRESANDO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jacoba ella es soltera y tiene 57 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganadería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “PROGRESANDO” communal bank. It is located in the district of Santa Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Jacoba. She is 57 years old, single and has 3 children. She works in her business selling cereals. She sells corn, wheat and quinoa. She works from 8 am until 5 pm. She has been in the business for four years and things are going well. Her dream is to have a shop to sell her cereals. She is requesting the loan to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

The other members work in businesses: selling animals, raising animals, a grocery store and a restaurant.

The member thanks those who form part of this dream through the loan and promises to comply with the payment of her installments in the established time.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a rural smallholder crop farmer in the Eldoret area of Kenya. He is married and has 2 children. 

Besides crop farming, Henry also does dairy and poultry farming for extra food and income. The key lesson he has taken away from 5 years of being in crop farming is predicting weather patterns.

Henry is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity. With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase Henry’s chances for a successful harvest, which would lead to his family having adequate food and income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is happily married and is blessed with one child. Nearly all the people in the Kitale area are farmers and Faith is one of them. Faith is a mixed farmer based in Wekhonye, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. Faith describes her upbringing as challenging, so she is doing everything in her power to provide a good foundation for her child and to help secure her future.

Faith is seeking a loan to purchase farm inputs. With the KES 20,000 (Kenya shillings) loan, she is going to pay for a truckload of manure and also pay for seedlings. She is going to use your loan investment and the years of experience she has gathered, to make this expansion a success. Money gathered from this investment will enable Faith to contribute to her family's general expenses, her child's education, and medical needs.

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Tarus

texts.en:
Tarus is a rural smallholder crop farmer in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Besides crop farming, Tarus also does dairy farming for extra food and income. The key lesson he has taken away from years of farming is being able to plan and prepare in advance.

Tarus is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity.

With your loan, purchasing quality agricultural inputs will increase Tarus’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is an experienced 41-year-old woman. She is based in Kapsowar, which is a small rural town in the north rift of Kenya. Veronica and her husband have been blessed with a lovely family.

For 10 years Veronica has been a mixed farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows maize, among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening. In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet the least exclusive hobby for women. You really don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden. Veronica, however, is taking this a little step further. Veronica is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticultural farming. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah who is a smallholder farmer and lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, where she has been practicing farming for the past ten years. Dairy goat farming has helped her not only survive but become an entrepreneur. She is committed, honest, responsible, and works really hard to see her farming business become successful.

Fridah is a very hardworking woman who enjoys farming. Through all the years she has been farming, she has gained much experience and is one of the most respected farmers in her village. Fridah offers extension services to other farmers who are new in the business. Being a caring and loving mother, Fridah has been able to take care of her family and support them through the profits she has earned from farming.

Although Fridah reaps much profit from farming, one challenge that she is facing that is lack of enough land to farm. For this reason, Fridah is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 to be able to buy a piece of land and expand her farming activities. Having so much experience in farming, Fridah is sure that she will make good use of the land and double her profit levels. Through the profits, she would be able to repay the loan and improve her living conditions.

Fridah has gone through the repayment schedule and amount and is comfortable with the plan. Support the project of an enterprising Kenyan woman!

loans.use: to buy more land and expand her farming.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen, a very hardworking mother who is 42 years of age. She is a small holder farmer from Kitheo, a remote village in the fertile Nkubu area of Kenya.

This charming mother of two has been engaged in mixed farming for the past five years. She commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers in her village. Her main source of income has been eggs, milk, and a variety of food crops that she plants. Taking care of her farm is an activity she finds very enjoyable.

Hellen has good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market. However, the demand of banana is so high. Being a visionary woman, she has always wanted to buy seeds for banana farming. She is seeking a loan to buy seeds for banana farming.

Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women like Hellen will achieve their dreams and goals.

Nkubu area has a ready market for bananas and through this loan she will be able to satisfy the demand that is there, and hence improve her income. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.
Support an smallholder farmer who's hungry to improve and get ahead with her determination.

loans.use: To buy seeds for banana farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Decla

texts.en:
55-year-old Decla has never set foot in any higher learning institution, but she is an accomplished farmer from the Nandihills area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. She is happily married and, together with her handsome husband, is blessed with three adorable children.

For the past ten years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, farmers from their village seek technical advice from her on the best dairy farming techniques.

Decla is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard so that her children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals.

That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals.

Kenya's Nandihills area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Decla could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Decla, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing.

Decla believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will bring about a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Decla to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a youthful 41-year-old farmer from Kiamugunda, a remote village in the Kerugoya area of Kenya where people live in shanties made from whatever materials they can find, usually sheets of corrugated tin. According to residents, the people of Kiamugunda are forgotten or ignored by the county government of Kerugoya. But within the remote village of Kiamugunda Nancy is working hard to pull herself out of the dismal conditions.

Most small-holder farmers view Nancy as a role model and a mentor because of the resilience that she has despite personal challenges, and her passion to support her two children as a primary caregiver. Nancy started farming in 2007 after the country suffered post-election violence.

With the unstinting support of her husband, who dedicated his one acre, she has grown the business dramatically. She has acquired numerous income-generating assets, including farm machines. She keeps dairy cattle and grows subsistence and commercial crops, such as maize and vegetables. She takes pride in being independent and being involved in a sector that feeds the population.

Nancy is seeking a loan to purchase more land. Her operations are growing consistently, eating up the available space. With your funding, Nancy will have more space to expand her business output. The money from the investment will be ploughed back into the business, to finance even more growth. The additional income will also enable her to repay the loan, buy food for her family, and pay fees for her two children who are in public schools.

She feels blessed to have the support of her husband through all her undertakings. Make a $25 loan, and push Nancy's dream closer to reality. Nancy can buy more land and succeed with your help!

You can help Nancy accomplish all her dreams and let her get closer to achieving her goals; a loan will do that for her.

loans.use: To buy more land

loans.name: Diphina

texts.en:
Diphina is a married mother of two children. She keeps cattle and poultry for milk, eggs, and meat respectively. On her two-acre piece of land, you will also find a granary, cereals, and over 100 trees.

To make better income, Diphina engages in cereal brokering, which involves arranging the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. Over the ten years that she has been in the business, she has made an effort to build strong relationships because in this business, success depends on reputation.

Since she can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, Diphina prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to build her inventory by aggregating more produce from local farmers at competitive prices. She will use her understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell later at a profit.

Your loan will help local farmers selling to Diphina to focus on production, rather than sales. Diphina’s family also stands to benefit greatly from the improved income and elevated livelihood.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Chepngetich

texts.en:
Chepngetich, at the age of 56, is a charismatic and helpful woman who works in her own small farm that she began due to the need to generate income to support her family. In spite of all the obstacles, she had the strength and the determination to pick herself up and keep on going, and thanks to this she's been doing farming for the past twenty years. She works every day for 10 hours by herself.

Chepngetich is seeking a loan to construct a dairy shed. This will provide shelter for her favorite animal. The thing she enjoys most about dairy farming is selling milk. However, in order for a dairy cow to be more productive, the farmer needs to be good at dairy management. Your loan will help Chepngetich construct a cowshed that will help very much with dairy management. The shelter will enable her to prepare feed rations and feed the cow. The shed will also ensure the cow is always in a clean and hygienic environment.

Your loan will bring untold benefits to Chepngetich. She is projecting a significant increase in milk production. The extra money will go to loan repayment and her children’s education. Her dream is for her children to live a better life with fulfilled basic needs. Help her out!

loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Mercy, 25 years of age, a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Kipsuter, a remote village in Siongiroi. She is happily married and is blessed with four adorable children.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business.

The Siongiroi area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.”

Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level.

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a humble mother who wakes up every morning at 5 o’clock to work on her farm. Doreen resides in the Nkubu area of Kenya which is a remote town with harsh living conditions because of the bad terrain in the region. She is happily married and, together with her husband, has a lovely family. Doreen’s primary sources of income are milk and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. Doreen has managed to take care of her family with her income from selling different varieties of food crops. The Nkubu area has conditions that favor crop farming.

Doreen has always wanted to start banana farming but the lack of capital has prevented her. With this loan she will be able to harvest more bananas and hence satisfy the ready market in her region. Demand for bananas in the Nkubu area is high but the supply is low. So, through this loan, Doreen is going to comfortably meet the demand.

Her increased income will allow Doreen to provide a secure future for her school-going children by paying their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. Her vision is to be a leading supplier of bananas in major hotels and households in her region. Help her out!

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand her banana farming.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is an experienced 31-year-old woman. She is a person who has battled to get ahead throughout her life. She is based in Nkubu, which is a small rural town in the central province of Kenya. Beatrice and her husband have been blessed with a lovely family.

For 10 years Beatrice has been a mixed farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows maize among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening. You really don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden; any woman with a homestead and a few square feet of earth is doing her best to make her little corner of the world more gracious and beautiful.

Beatrice is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticultural farming. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike for speedy delivery of her farm produce to market

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a dedicated, determined and honest mother of a lovely family. She is based in Nkubu, Kenya. The rich soil of this area makes it one of the nation’s biggest banana growing regions, lending it the nickname of “the banana region”.

For the past 10 years, Everlyne has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. These ventures have allowed her to earn a decent income.

Everlyne passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is the lack of funds. However, this challenge has not made her give up. She mobilized other enterprising women like her in her village.

Everlyne is requesting a loan to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farming. Having gone through training on loan management, she is educated on how to utilize the loan and save more money. Through this loan, Everlyne will generate enough income to take care of the farming costs and expand her horticulture business to international markets.

If there is someone you should consider lending to, then that person is Everlyne!

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farming.

loans.name: Veronica Blanca

texts.es:
Verónica continúa con su negocio de confección y venta de tejidos. El préstamo que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de material de confección. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo vender toda su producción. Actualmente Su negocio es el tejido de gorros de lana e hilo; ella compra lana e hilos de diferentes colores por mayor, para tejer a máquina gorros de diferentes diseños para bebé, “la venta la realizo ambulantemente en ferias y lugares comerciales…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son constantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de lana por mayor para aumentar la mercadería. Su sueño es abrir una tienda para vender sus tejidos, ella desea comprar lana e hilo por mayor para aumentar la mercadería. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 13 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Veronica solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana e hilos para aumentar la producción de tejidos.
texts.en:
Veronica is continuing her business making and selling knit goods. She invested the loan she obtained in buying production materials. The payment installments were punctual because she was able to sell all of her production. Currently, her business is knitting caps with wool and thread. She buys multicolored wool and thread in bulk to knit caps with different baby designs by machine.

"I conduct mobile sales at fairs and commercial places," she says. The advantage of her business is that the sales are constant; the disadvantage is that she lacks the capital to buy wool in bulk to increase her merchandise.

Her dream is to open a store to sell her knit products; she desires to buy wool and thread in bulk to increase her merchandise.

This is the second sequence of loans from this institution that she has fulfilled for her business. It is because of these motives that Veronica is requesting a loan to buy wool and thread to increase the production of knit goods.

loans.use: to buy wool and thread to increase the production of knit goods.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
With children to raise, water to fetch, and food to cook, Theresa, who is an ever-smiling woman of character and goodwill has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs and some personal business that she engages in.

Theresa is seeking a loan worth 80,000 KES from Kiva lenders to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily-rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector.

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with KIVA to give Theresa access to a loan that will aid her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increasing employment opportunities, and bringing about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Theresa’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. Lenders, if there is someone you should consider lending to, then that person is Theresa!

loans.use: to buy seeds and grow her horticulture farming business.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a responsible and diligent smallholder farmer from Kenyenya village who is involved in dairy farming. Teresia is married and has 3 children.

Teresia is seeking a loan to construct a cow shed to shelter her cows against harsh weather conditions. Besides providing shelter, the cowshed will also help control herd movement and allow for confined grazing, which is known to lead to higher productivity. This intervention will result in improved health and dairy management, both keys to having a highly productive dairy farm.
Improved animal welfare and increased income, as a result of the intervention, will go a long way in improving the lives and livelihood of the members of Teresia's family.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 47-year-old farmer from a rural village in Central Kenya. She does commercial poultry farming, as seen on the profile picture with her loan officer holding one hen. Her work brings home an important source of income. Jane is married and has 5 children. 
Jane applied for a loan because she wants to start a dairy farm. She will buy a cow with the borrowed money. As a dairy farmer, she will derive income from selling milk, meat and calves. The investment will give her regular income that she'll use to meet her family's upkeep and service her loan obligation.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Harun

texts.en:
Harun is a rural smallholder crop farmer in Nkubu area of Kenya. He is married and has three children.

Besides crop farming, Harun also does dairy, poultry, and goat farming for extra food and income. The key lesson he has taken away from eight years of being in crop farming is predicting weather patterns.

Harun is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity.

With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase Harun’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen, who is 29 years old, is a charismatic young woman and a strong example of hard work. She works untiringly every day of the week, from Monday to Sunday, to give her family a comfortable life.

She is based in Marima village, found in the Central Rift region of Kenya. The secondary-educated entrepreneur runs a mixed-farm where she keeps poultry and a fairly-productive dairy cow that produce milk for both consumption and sale.

Doreen started farming four years ago. She farms on a one acre piece of land that belongs to her husband, whose professional activities have very little to do with agriculture. She was farming for subsistence but recently switched it up for commercial produce. The income she made from this transition greatly improved her income status to enable her to afford a better private school education for her child.

Doreen is seeking a loan to purchase a chaff cutter. In her dairy business, she places more importance on animal health and nutrition than other factors. The chaff cutter is handy during feed preparation to ensure that the hay is evenly cut into appropriately small pieces that cows will enjoy and easily digest.

Returns from this investment will enable Doreen to pay for her child’s education expenses. She wants nothing but the best foundation for her child’s future.

loans.use: To buy a chaffcutter

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a married mother of 3 from Central Kenya. Her husband too is a farmer. Purity's main income source is milk. To ensure continued productivity, as a dairy farmer, she is keen on animal husbandry practices and feed management.

Purity is seeking a loan to buy a chaff-cutting machine in order to turn hay into chaff, which animals prefer for their color and fresh aroma. The other benefit that the chaff-cutting machine will bring is the ease of handling feeds in bulk.
From your loan investment in her business, Purity anticipates to see an improvement in animal health and milk production

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher is a 50-year-old farmer from a rural village in North Rift Kenya who does dairy farming to make a living. Her work brings home an important source of income. Janepher is married and has 6 children. The children help her with the work. 
Janepher applied for a loan because she wants to grow her dairy farm. She will buy an additional cow with the borrowed money. The cow financed by Kiva lenders will increase the quantity of milk she takes to the market and boost her monthly income.  
Janepher needs more income to take care of her increasing family expenses and that is why this loan is important to her.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: St. John Bosco School

texts.en:
This is John. He is the Director of John Bosco Junior School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Kitebi in Kampala with 350 students. Canan Modern Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

St. John Bosco School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. John ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 31-year-old married mum with a beautiful family. They all live in a town called Nandihills. Nandihills doesn’t offer the best opportunities, but this honest mum has learned to deal with that. The rich soil of this area makes it one of the nation’s biggest tea-growing regions, lending it the nickname “tea region of Kenya.”

For the past 10 years, Martha has been involved in mixed farming. Her primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. These ventures have allowed her to earn a decent income. Martha passionately loves poultry farming. The biggest challenge she faces is the lack of funds. However, this challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family and children,” she said.

She mobilized other enterprising women like her in her village, and they have joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists small-scale farmers by giving out loans and training. Martha is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to buy additional poultry. Having gone through training on loan management, she is educated on how to utilize the loan and save more money.

Through this loan, Martha will generate enough income to take care of the farming costs and expand her poultry business. Help Martha make her dreams come true; this loan can change her life.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Mrs. Hien is 39 years old, married and has four children, all of them are in school. She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially her children but lacks capital. The loan can help her to build a sanitary latrine and she is able to repay the loan from cultivation, small business and selling chicken from her garden.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis comes from a remote village found in the Kitale area of Kenya. He practices dairy and crop farming to make a living and uses most of his income to meet his family’s basic needs. He is determined to grow his business and improve his family’s income so as to elevate their standards of living.

Francis is seeking a loan to buy poultry to produce eggs, chicks and meat for consumption and sale. He intends to use this loan to buy traditional breeds of chicken because they are well-adapted to local conditions. With your loan investment into his business, Francis will make the best out of the increased demand for poultry products in the market. This economic opportunity, once seized, will improve his livelihood and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a dedicated, loving, tender and committed mother. She hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile. Beatrice is 28 years old and a proud mother of six children whom she really adores and cherishes.

Beatrice is a very hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past six years and has gained so much experience through those years of farming. Beatrice grows maize and keeps dairy cows and, through these, she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. She really enjoys taking care of her animals. Although Beatrice has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious woman. Her farm has not been producing as much harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases.

That is why she is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES to be able to buy farm implements. Through the loan, Beatrice will be assured of a bumper harvest and this will translate to more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, Beatrice will reap more, which will assure her of comfortably taking care of her family and repaying the loan. Beatrice’s plan is to be able to increase her farming and to be able to save more money so that she can buy more land for farming.
Beatrice has big dreams that especially regard her children, because she wants to see them grow up as good people that can do great things for them and other people. You can help this devoted mother to accomplish her dreams with a loan.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice, aged 25,is a mother of five children that she really adores so much and will always do anything good so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs. Eunice hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Eunice never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white collar job but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life. Eunice started farming and has been doing farming for the past 3 years. Through those years she has gathered so much experience and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips. Eunice practices mixed farming on her farm and through the profits she has managed to take care of her family's needs and also give her children a good education because she believes that education is the only “key to success”.

Eunice is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 to start horticulture farming on her farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Eunice wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits. She hopes that through the loan she will improve her living conditions. Eunice's dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time. Eunice is not a selfish woman and will also want to impact positively on society that is why she will employ people to work for her on her horticulture farm.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Yesu Nti Group

texts.en:
Francisca, 44, is the featured borrower of Yesu nti. She is the one standing at the far left in the photograph. She sells mouth wash and personal supplies at the market and works hard to meet the needs of her family.

Unfortunately, her finances could not meet customers demand so therefore she is applying for this loan to buy more mouth wash and personal supplies to supply her customers. She will use her profit to reinvest into her business and also take care of her child, since she is a single mother responsible for the up-bringing of her child who is in high school level. She will also use part of the profit margin to increase her saving with ID-Ghana.

Therefore, Francisca, along with her group members, is asking for a loan amount of GHS 6,000 to better their business.

loans.use: to buy more mouth wash and personal items to supply to her customers.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is the age of 44 and a mother of three children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her son engages in embroidery to earn an income. Her son started his embroidery business 7 years ago because he wanted to help his father support the family and meet the other expenses.

Kousar’s son buys embroidery raw materials such as Hand- Embroidery kit, ribbons, needles and embroidery machines from the market. Another person handles his transactions with his customers. He has decided that he would like to sell his embroidery items directly in the market, so that he can earn better profit for his family. He has become an expert in embroidery business.

Kousar demanded a loan so she will be able to buy embroidery raw materials from the market for her son.
Kousar will be thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw embroidery material for her son.

loans.name: Naef

texts.en:
Naef is a 23-year-old, married man from Khan younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house and he is the only breadwinner for his family, so they depend on him for support.

Naef has a stall for selling accessories and makeup in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of latest conflict. Naef took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's accessories and makeup to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's accessories and makeup to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice, 29 years of age, is a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Mateitei, a remote village in Kitale. She is happily married and is blessed with three children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last eight years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. The Kitale area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Shefaa

texts.en:
After five years of home business Shefaa decide to move her salon from her house to a regular salon shop next door, in her district. She thought of that step after her house get crowded with customers. She has a great reputation.

She applied for a loan to give her a hand and motivate her with new ladies saloon and give her new space that can fit all her customers and she will use the loan to buy more tools and hair dryers for her salon.

She will be happy and thankful if she gets the chance to growth her income.

loans.use: to buy more tools and hair dryers for her salon.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Ruth is one of the most hardworking women on earth. She is 23 years of age and a go-getter. She hails from Kimose, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin, but Jane has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past three years. Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. Jane passionately loves farming and has even nicknamed one of her cows and whenever she is milking her cow, she feels proud. Jane is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her parents of a decent meal. The Kitale area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming and that is why she is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. Jane is very disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children .

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel comes from a remote village found in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. He practices dairy farming to make a living and uses most of his income to meet his family’s basic needs. Samuel is married and has five children. He is determined to grow his business and improve his family’s income.

Samuel is seeking a loan to buy poultry to produce eggs, chicks, and meat for consumption and sale. He intends to use this loan to buy traditional breeds of chicken because they are well-adapted to local conditions. With your loan investment into his business, Samuel will make the best out of the increased demand for poultry products in the market. This economic opportunity, once seized, will improve his livelihood and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: St. Jude Namugoona School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Mathius. He is an administrator at St. Jude Primary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Kampala with 400 students. St. Jude Namugoona School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Jude Namugoona School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Mathius ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Phuc

texts.en: Mrs. Phuc is 46 years old. She is married and has five children, so she works very hard to provide for them.  Animal husbandry and small business are the main income of her family. With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve her family living standard as well as environmental protection.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Asenal Group

texts.en:
Fortunatha is in her late 30's and is married with two children who are still in school. She has been selling clothes for five years now. She works from 09 am to 04 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This is her fifth credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania, to be apportioned among Asenal, three members group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. She used the previous loans, paid back in fully, to improve her business with new type of clothes. She is happy with Kiva support and believe to further improve her business to the level of selling more types.

With this credit, she will use to buy up to date styles to meet her customers' requirement. She dreams to open a shop for her business.

loans.use: to buy up to date styles to meet her customers' requirement.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid is a 21-year-old, Married man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house where he is the only breadwinner for his family and they depend on him for support.

Khalid has a stall for selling clothes in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of latest conflict. Khalid took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to get married.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall

loans.name: Barbys Group

texts.es:
Lidia continúa con su negocio de panadería tradicional. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de harina por quintal e insumos de cocina. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su negocio funciono con normalidad. Actualmente continúa liderando la banca de emprendimiento (la cuarta de la izquiera viste pantalon jean y polera manga larga a rayas blancas y naranja). Su negocio pudo generar mejores ingresos e incursionó en el rubro de la venta de ropa de segunda mano, “una forma de mejorar mis ingresos es crear otro negocio…”comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que ambas actividades son independientes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de ropa y harina para amas actividades. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa y expandir su panadería, ella desea comprar ropa de segunda mano y variedades de harinas para sus 2 actividades. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Lidia solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano y variedades de harinas para continuar con sus 2 negocios.
texts.en:
Lidia continues with her business of a traditional bakery. The previous loan that she was given was invested in buying 100lbs of flour and kitchen supplies. She regularly made her payments because her business was running normally.
Currently she continues to lead the entrepreneurship bank, she is the fourth from the left in the photo wearing jeans and a white and orange long-sleeved shirt.
Her business was able to generate better revenue and she entered into the business of selling second hand clothing. "A way to improve my income is to create another business" she comments.
The advantage of her business is that both activities are independent, the disadvantage is that she lacks the funds to buy clothing and flour for both activities.
Her dream is to open a clothing store and to expand her bakery. She would like to buy second had clothing and a variety of flour for her two activities. This is the second loan that she has gotten from the institution in the three years that she has been doing these activities.
It is for these reasons that Lidia is requesting a loan: to buy second hand clothing and a variety of flour to continue her two businesses.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing and a variety of flour to continue her two businesses.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene es una mujer de 23 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la panadería.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente  y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad caracterizada por su exuberante vegetación con enormes extensiones de selva y praderas.
Irene es de piel morena, cabello largo negro y físico delgado. Su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la panadería y su especialidad los cuñapés, estos se preparan a base de almidón de yuca con queso, “el pan más tradicional es el cuñapé, se sirve en el desayuno y a la hora del té…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de un horno industrial e insumos de cocina como harinas y otros. Su sueño es tener una panadería en su casa propia, ella desea comprar un horno industrial y variedades de harinas para hornear pan. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Irene solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno industrial y variedades de harinas para hornear pan.
texts.en:
Irene is a woman of 23, single, with no children. and her business is a bakery.

She is enterprising, independent and very hard-working. She runs her business in the southern area of the city, known for its exhuberant vegetation, with enormous areas of jungle and meadows.

Irene is dark-skinned, with long black hair and a slender build. Her mother tongue is guaraní and she speaks Spanish. She lives in the home of her parents who work. It is their own home, constructed of brick, and has all the basic services.

Her business is the bakery and her specialty is "cuñapés." These are made of yuca flour and cheese, “the most traditional bread is cuñapé, served at breakfast and at tea-time," she says.

The advantage of her business is that she sells every day; the disadvantage is the lack of working capital to buy an industrial oven and ingredients such as flour and other items. Her dream is to have a bakery in her own home. She wishes to buy an industrial oven and a variety of flours for baking bread. This is her first loan with the institution in the year she has had her business.

Those are the reasons why Irene is requesting a loan to buy an industrial oven and a variety of flours for baking bread.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven and a variety of flours for baking bread.

loans.name: Nicasio

texts.en: Nicasio is a resident of Calape, Bohol. He is married and a father of four adult children. He has been engaged in driving “habal-habal” (term used most in Visayas region for a motorcycle with extended seat to accommodate more passengers) business to earn a living. He has been doing this for two years. Nicasio works hard to provide the needs of his family. He is asking a loan for motorcycle maintenance and to buy a horse. Perhaps, he was thinking of other business to improve their livelihood. In the future, he wishes to send all his children to college and finish a degree.

loans.use: for motorcycle maintenance and to buy a horse

loans.name: Rosario Alicia

texts.es:
Rosario es una mujer de 51 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene una hija de 26 años, y su negocio es la venta de papa.
Ella es paciente, optimista y muy considerada. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘el tejar’ caracterizada por encontrarse los hornos donde se fabrican las tejas del techo de las casas.
Rosario es morena de cabello trenzado y vestir tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera) su vida la comparte con su esposo que es carpintero y con su hija que estudia en la universidad. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de papa de diferentes variedades como; papa lisa (dulce especial para sopas), papa oca (larga y dulce, se sirve como acompañamiento, y otras, “trabajo desde hace 30 años en este lugar, quiero mejorar mi negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con experiencia, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de diferentes tipos de papa por mayor. Su sueño es vender papa por mayor a los mercados, ella desea comprar papa por mayor para aumentar la oferta. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 30 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rosario solicita un préstamo para la compra de papa por mayor para mejorar la oferta.
texts.en:
Rosario is a 51-year-old woman; she lives with her partner; she has a 26-year-old daughter; and her business is selling potatoes.

She is patient, optimistic, and very considerate. Her business is in the "El Tejar" or "Tile Factory" neighborhood, which where you can find the kilns where roofing tiles are made.

Rosario is dark skinned with braided hair and she wears traditional clothing (hat, blanket, and skirt). She shares her life with her husband, who is a carpenter, and with her daughter, who is a university student. They live in their own home made of brick, which has all the basic utilities. Her business is selling different varieties of potatoes, such as lisa potatoes (sweet, especially for soups), oca potatoes (long and sweet, they are served as a side dish), and others: "I have worked in this area for 30 years and I want to improve my business," she tells us. The good thing about her business is that she has experience; the problem is a lack of capital to buy different kinds of potatoes wholesale. Her dream is to sell potatoes wholesale to the markets; she wants to buy wholesale to increase her sales. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in her 30 years of doing business.

For these reasons Rosario is requesting a loan to buy potatoes wholesale to improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy potatoes wholesale to improve her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with 7 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells soda, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of products.

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of soda, bread and other items. Her business goal is to own a supermarket within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soda, bread and other items.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells tyres. He has been involved in this business for 14 years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

He will use the Kes 95,000 loan to pay school fees for his children. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will live a good life. This is fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Shomaila

texts.en:
Shomaila is the age of 25 living with her spouse in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is a driver by profession. He provides transportation services using his loading rickshaw and has been driving a rickshaw 4 years to meet the family’s expenses.

Today her husband wants to buy new loading rickshaw for proper transportation services but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to buy the loading rickshaw. Therefore Shomaila has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Shomaila’s husband can purchase the loading rickshaw and provides the proper transportation services to earn an income.

Shomaila and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy loading rickshaw for  her husband

loans.name: Arpita

texts.en:
Arpita is an 18-year-old inhabitant of Khagrabari in Coochbehar districts. She is married. Her husband is a private tutor and runs his coaching classes for their livelihood. There is no other means of income generation for their family and the income is barely enough to pay the educational fees of his wife Arpita for her bachelor' degree education.

Arpita has completed her school education with a high percentage of marks and now she has enrolled herself in a Bachelor's degree course in B.T. and Evening College with an aim to be an efficient teacher in the future. She is a very bright student, diligent in her studies and has big dreams of becoming a respectable teacher. Her husband always supports her to achieve her goal but his meager income is the main hindrance to paying for her education costs and fulfilling her dream.

So Arpita is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to pay her educational fees and buy educational materials and stationery items so that she can complete her education smoothly.

She and her husband (shown in the picture) are thankful to Kiva and BJS for the financial assistance.

loans.use: to pay the educational cost for her three-year bachelor degree.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is 36 years old, married and has got one child who is in school. For 2 and half years now, she has been running a shop selling cereals. She also has another business selling building materials. Neema works from 08.am to 08.pm per working day and is able to make a very good profit each month.

From Tujijenge, This is her third credit request, all of her previous being paid back in fully. She will hold herself to pay back this loan as per schedule. She used the previous loans to buy shop stocks of maize,beans and rice and extra stock to his next shop. She is so happier with Kiva support. In the coming years, she would like to build her own house and expand her businesses. 
Neema will use this loan to buy business stocks; cereals to resell.

loans.use: to buy business stocks; cereals to resell

loans.name: Las Solidarias Group

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer de 31 años de edad, soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 4, 7 y 10 años, y su negocio es la venta de cotillón.
Ella es amistosa, generosa y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Cotoca’ que está formada por agricultores que habitaban las praderas de la zona, en donde como puntos blancos en medio de la llanura surgen pueblitos y caseríos.
Sonia es morena de baja estatura y cabello negro largo. Su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español (de pie al centro izquierdo, viste chompa negra). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela viven en una casa propia construida de madera que solo cuenta con energía eléctrica. La necesidad por mejorar su negocio la llevó a formar una banca de emprendimiento con negocios como; venta de comida, venta de verduras, servicio de limpieza, venta de refrescos, tejido de sombreros de sao, tienda de barrio y venta de medicina natural. Su negocio es la venta de cotillón, estos son adornos y objetos divertidos que suelen usarse para decorar fiestas, se fabrican de todo color según el evento, “en las fiestas venideras de fin de año las plazas se adornan con artículos de broma, cotillones para el árbol o figuritas de belén…" comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con temporadas altas, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de material de trabajo como, cartulinas, papeles de colores, cintas, pegamento, y otros. Su sueño es mejorar sus ventas, ella desea comprar material de trabajo para fabricar cotillones y adornar muchas fiestas en fin de año. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que lleva en esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Sonia solicita un préstamo para comprar material de trabajo para fabricar cotillones y adornar las fiestas que vienen.
texts.en:
Sonia is a woman of 31. She is single and has three children, ages 4, 7, and 10. Her business is selling party favors.

She is friendly, generous, and very responsible. Her business is done in the Coloca area, which is formed by farmers who were living in the meadows of the area, where little towns and hamlets stand out as white points in the middle of the plain.

Sonia is dark, of short stature, with long black hair. Her native language is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish. (She is standing in the center left, wearing a black sweater.) She shares her life with her children, who go to school. They live in their own house made of wood, which [of the basic services] has only electricity. The need to improve her business led her to form a bank for business ventures with [people having] businesses such as selling food, selling vegetables, cleaning service, selling soft drinks, weaving palm frond hats, neighborhood store, and selling natural medicines. Her business is selling party favors. These are decorations and entertaining objects that are usually used to decorate for parties. They are made of every color according to the event. "For the approaching holidays at the end of the year, the places are decorated with joke items, favors for the tree, or little nativity figures," she comments. The advantage of her business is that she has busy seasons. The problem is the lack of capital for the purchase of work materials such as poster board, colored paper, ribbons, glue, and other items. Her dream is to improve her sales. She wants to buy work materials to make party favors and decorate many parties at the end of the year. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the three years that she has been doing this work.

It is for these reasons that Sonia is applying for a loan to purchase work materials to make party favors and decorate for the parties that are coming.

loans.use: to buy work materials to make party favors and decorations for the coming holidays

loans.name: Elen Angelica

texts.es:
La socia Elen Angelica  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza y tambien la socia ahora esta vendiedno ropa como pantalones,casacas y chompas, la socia es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar casacas,polos,chompas y pantalones.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Group member Elen Angelica still has her business selling beauty products and she is also now selling clothing, such as pants, coats, and sweaters. She is a hardworking and entrepreneurial person who is providing for her family with this business. She is requesting a loan to buy coats, t-shirts, sweaters, and pants.

She is happy with her loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy coats, t-shirts, sweaters, and pants.

loans.name: Eureka

texts.en:
As a widow, Eureka, is considered a survivor. She was able to guide and support the needs of her children as they grow up. Now that her children have their own families already, Eureka continues to work for herself as long as she can. She feels confident and productive as she earns a living by running her variety store located in Buhangin, Davao City.

Eureka’s income varies from time to time as it is usually affected by the competition within the area. Consumers are inclined to buy from a store that has wide variety of items and merchandise. She hopes to expand her business by adding to selection of supplies in order to meet the demands of consumers. With that method, she would be able to boost her income that she can use in her everyday needs. She can also save some money for emergency purposes. She humbly seeks your help through PhP 20,000 loan. Here’s praying that you have the kind heart to extend support to a widow like her, and help her enjoy a more comfortable life that God wants all of His children to have. 

Eureka meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for her store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be competition. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
For ten years, Laura has shown her dedication as a member of CCT Credit Cooperative in Buhangin, Davao City. She receives tips on how to manage her variety store and gets inspiration from sharing of experiences among her co-fellowship* members. 

Her store sells various commodities such as toiletries, canned goods, snack items, condiments, beverages, and many others. Simultaneously she buys sacks of charcoal, repacks it per kilo, then sells it by customer order or as part of her store inventory.
