She also owns one unit of Piso Net, a coin-operated internet PC which is appealing to students due to its affordability.

Laura works hard in order to supplement her family’s financial resources. Her husband, Juanito, is working as installer but his salary doesn’t suffice for their growing expenses. This is why she aims to expand her variety store business. She wants to purchase additional dry goods, grocery items, cases of softdrinks, and sacks of charcoal for her store. A loan worth 50,000 PHP would be very helpful. She hopes that your kind support will bring positive steps towards her dream of having a successful and stable business. In due time, she plans to buy a piece of land for her family, because she considers it as a good investment that increases in value as time passes by. 

She meets weekly with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry goods, grocery items, cases of softdrinks, and sacks of charcoal for her store

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Nandihills, Kenya has a beautiful landscape made up of endless rolling hills and valleys stretching as far as the eye can see. In her small but clean mud house Ruth has been able to raise six children who give her the determination to keep pushing on even when things get rough.

Thanks to practicing mixed farming Ruth can see a bright future. Each morning at 5:00 a.m. she arises to go to her farm in the remote village of Kipkotet. She passionately loves dairy farming and has nicknames for her cows. Because of her great knowledge of farming, farmers from her village view her as a mentor.

However, the biggest challenge Ruth faces is satisfying the overwhelming demand for milk in her village. She is seeking a 30,000 KES loan to buy another dairy cow of good quality. She believes that another cow will enable her to sell more milk, improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children.
Having gone through training with Juhudi Kilimo, Ruth is confident that the skills she acquired will help her increase her business, and she will be able to pay back the loan.

Ruth is very motivated by this plan because it could be the tipping point for a bright future for her family. Triumph in her efforts to elevate the family’s life will do her proud.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow of good quality.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married mother of four children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For over four years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Waed

texts.en:
21 years old young married lady her name is Waed, lives in a sector in Jordan called Rusaifeh.

Waed`s husband is work with a low income and she is working hard to help him in the household expenses, so she started her own business which is selling blankets. And because the high of standards of living and the winter season is will come soon she decided to expand her business and take a loan to help her buy more blankets to sell.
If she gets that chance she will be thankful and start having born to help her in new business life.

loans.use: to buy more blankets to sell.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is married man with four children. He is 41 years old live with his family in Zarqaa.
Khaled is a very ambitious man he has been working for many years ago in car repair shop, when he could not complete his education because of the financial situation for his family he decided to work and depends on himself to insure a good future. He has started his work in a shop for maintenance and repair cars for many years and after he took a good experience in this field and got married he decided to open his own shop.

Now he is facing difficulties to buy what he needs for his shop. Because of that he is requesting a loan for the purchase of more raw materials used in maintenance and car oil to increase the quality of his work to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: for the purchase of more raw materials used in maintenance and car oil.

loans.name: Sayara

texts.en:
A middle-aged lady, Sayara lives with her three daughters and husband in a rural village named Takagach in Coochbehar district. She is 39 years old and a very hardworking woman. After managing all the household work, she involves herself in Bidi binding work to earn more money to support the family. All of her three daughters go to school. Sayara’s husband is involved in construction work.

Sayara’s elder daughter, Aripa, is 18 years old and reads in grade 12 in Rajarhat Bidya Bhaban High School. She is studying very hard to get a good result. Her father is involved in centering work. Sayara and her husband want to provide a good education to their three daughters. But their income is not sufficient to bear the household expenses for the five member family, so education becomes a luxury for them. Looking at Aripa’s dedication to her studies, Sayara became eager to help her. Thus Sayara applied for an educational loan from Kiva via BJS.

Sayara will purchase books and other supportive study material and pay the educational fees and exam fees and enroll her daughter in a good coaching class with the help of this loan.

Sayara and her daughter Aripa (shown in the photo) are very much thankful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to bear the overall expenses of grade 12 for her daughter.

loans.name: Katwe United School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Saul. He is an administrator at Katwe United Primary School, a mixed school in the Rural  area of Katwe in Kampala with 550 students. Katwe United School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Katwe United School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Saul ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
Tamir is a 20-year-old, Single man from, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house he is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support.

Tamir has a stall for selling fruit and vegetables in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of latest conflict. Tamir took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of fruit and vegetables to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to get married.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of fruit and vegetables to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth es una mujer de 40 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 10 años, y su negocio es la venta de huevo.
Ella es buena madre, conversadora y muy fuerte. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘pacajes’ área recientemente urbanizada, los pobladores en su mayoría son migrantes del campo a la ciudad.
Ruth es morena de cabello negro y físico delgado. Su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja en construcción y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de huevo, ella compra huevos por mayor y los vende al menudeo en su tienda de barrio, “no existen tiendas por el lugar, y el huevo es un alimento que se adecúa casi a cualquier comida, por eso tengo buenas ventas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas frecuentes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para comprar huevo por mayor. Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes, ella desea comprar huevo por mayor para vender por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ruth solicita un préstamo para comprar huevo por mayor para vender por mayor.
texts.en:
Ruth is a 40 year old woman, who lives with her partner and has two children, ages 7 and 10. Her business is selling eggs.
She is a good mother, friendly and very strong. Her business is located in the zone "Pacajes", an area that has recently been developed. The majority of the people there have migrated from the country to the city.
Ruth is brown, with black hair and a slender build. Her mother tongue is Aymará and she also speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her partner who works in construction and with her children who study in school. They live in their own family home that is built of bricks and has the basic services.
Her business is selling eggs, she buys them wholesale and sells them at retail from her neighbourhood store. "There are no stores in this area and eggs are a food that adapt to almost any food, and so I have good sales" she comments. The advantage of her business is that she makes frequent sales, the disadvantage is that she lacks the funds to buy eggs wholesale.
Her dream is to have a grocery store. She would like to buy eggs wholesale to sell them wholesale. This is the first loan that she has received from the institution in the 2 years that she has been doing this activity.
It is for these reasons that Ruth is requesting a loan: to buy eggs wholesale to sell them wholesale.

loans.use: to buy eggs wholesale to sell them wholesale.

loans.name: Katia Lina

texts.es:
La socia Katia Lina se dedica al negocio de internet, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es tener otro negocio de internet. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar una computadora.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Group member Katia Lina has an Internet cafe business. She is an entrepreneurial woman who supports her family with this business. Her dream is to have another Internet cafe business. She is requesting this loan to buy a computer.

She is happy with her loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
El socio Lucio se dedica al negocio de transporte, el socio es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a su familia. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas y parabrisas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Group member Lucio has a transportation business. He is an entrepreneurial and hardworking person who supports his family with this business. He is requesting this loan to buy tires and a windshield for his car.

He is happy with his loan and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy tires and a windshield for his car.

loans.name: Lonah

texts.en:
Lonah is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her 4 children. Kiva lenders! Meet Lonah, one of the most hardworking women on planet earth. She is 42 years of age, very hardworking and a go-getter. She hails from Bwake, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin, but Lonah has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past ten years.

Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. Lonah is contented with the farming way of life. Lonah is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal education or formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her children and family of a decent meal. The Kitale area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. Being an elderly woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Lonah feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her.

Lonah is well disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children who are in college. Please help Lonah so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: to start horticulture farming and provide a better income for her 4 children.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a very hardworking mother who is 36 years of age. She is a small holder farmer from Kitheo, a remote village in the fertile Nkubu area of Kenya.

This charming mother of four has been engaged in mixed farming for the past five years. Her main source of income has been goat and cow farming, milk, and a variety of food crops that she plants. Taking care of her farm is an activity she finds very enjoyable.

Florence has good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market. However, the demand of banana is so high. Being a visionary woman, she has always wanted to buy seeds for banana farming. She is seeking a loan to buy seeds for banana farming.

Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women like Florence will achieve their dreams and goals. Florence believes that the key to increased banana production is proper taking care of her farm.

Nkubu area has a ready market for bananas and through this loan she will be able to satisfy the demand that is there, and hence improve her income. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds for banana farming.

loans.name: Anjali

texts.en:
Anjali is a hardworking woman of 46 years who lives with her family in a small village in Khagrabari in the Coochbehar district. Besides being the mother of two children, Anjali is also involved in a clothing business. Her husband is a daily laborer. Her elder son is involved in a fruit business.

Anjali’s daughter Pratima is very studious and a hardworking student. She is pursuing her Bachelor's degree in Accountancy from IGNU University. With all the economic barriers, she wants to get a higher education to get a job in a bank, so that she will be able to give economic support to her family. But her family income is too low to bear her education expenses after managing the household expenses. But now Pratima badly needs some books and the help of a private tutor to score good marks in her examination. So her mother Anjali wants to help her and came to BJS with hopes of an education loan for Pratima.

Pratima will use the loan amount to purchase books and other study materials, pay college fees, exam fees and private coaching fees etc.
Anjali and Pratima (shown in the photo) thank Kiva and BJS for their kind support.

loans.use: to bear the educational expenses for a Bachelor's degree for her daughter.

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Namita is a rural housewife who lives with her three children (two sons and one daughter) and husband in Purba Khagrabari village in Coochbehar district. All of her children are studying in different grades. Her husband is a vegetable vendor, selling vegetables in the market. He is the only breadwinner of the family.

Krishna is the second son of Namita. He is only 18 years old and a very hardworking and brilliant student. He is pursuing his Bachelor's degree in Bengali from B.T and Evening College. Namita tried her level best to provide an uninterrupted education to her children but the family income is too low to bear the education costs for three children. But they are very determined to give educational support to Krishna so that he can become a school teacher in the future. Thus, Namita came forward to Kiva's partner, BJS, with the hope of help and applied for a loan for her son.

This loan amount will be used for purchasing books and study materials, paying exam fees, college fees, and enrolling him in good private coaching classes.

Namita and her son Krishna (shown in the photo) are very grateful to their generous lenders.

loans.use: to bear the cost of a Bachelor's degree education for her son.

loans.name: Rubindi Preparatory School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Jotham. He is an administrator at Rubindi Preparatory School, a mixed school in the Rural  area of Rubindin in MMbarara with 750 students. Rubindi School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Rubindi School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Jotham ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary source of income has been selling eggs, milk, and some personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income. She has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans that farming is for the older generation; she passionately loves dairy and sheep farming, and taking care of her sheep gives her great joy.

Although this humble mother has been making profits by selling mutton and wool to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality wool and mutton meat.

Nancy is seeking a loan to buy a quality sheep that will produce wool that will be able to satisfy the demand. Through the loan she will buy a sheep that will produce more wool and when the sheep will be old enough produce mutton meat after being slaughtered. Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a field partner, she attended training sessions and was taught the best financial management skills. This will help her save more money to fully repay the loan and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a quality breed of sheep.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
34-year-old Eunice has never set foot in any higher learning institution, but she is an accomplished farmer from the Nandihills area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. She is happily married and is blessed with five children.

For the past ten years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, farmers from their village seek technical advice from her on the best dairy farming techniques.

Eunice is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard so that her children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals.

That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals.

Kenya's Nandihills area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Eunice, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with KIVA lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing.

Eunice believes that this loan will be of much help and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Eunice to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Pachacutec Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PACHACUTEC”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Guisela ella es casada y tiene 43 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de internet.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank Pachacutec. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

One of the members is Señora Guisela. She is married, is 43 years old, and has 2 children. She works in her restaurant business. She makes various dishes such as roasted chicken, soups, and saltados [meat stir-fried with potatoes]. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. She has already had this business for 8 years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She is applying for the loan to purchase cooking supplies such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

The photo attached to the group photo was taken after the meeting because the member asked permission [to be absent] for work reasons.

The other members work in businesses of selling food, selling clothing, grocery store, and internet business.

This member is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means, and she promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies such as rice, vegetables, and chicken

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es una mujer de 46 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 10 años, y su negocio es la confección de mantas.
Ella es buena madre, independiente y muy emprendedora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘pedregal’ área recientemente urbanizada ubicada en la ladera sur de la ciudad.
Elena es morena de cabello trenzado y forma de vestir tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que estudia en la escuela viven en una casa propia construida de adobe que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la confección de mantas de lana; ella compra lana de oveja, vicuña y alpaca para confeccionar mantas artesanalmente en telar, “inicie mi labor por el impuso de mis amigas que fueron mis primeros clientes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son continuas, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de lana por mayor. Su sueño es abrir un taller de tejido, ella desea comprar lana de diferentes variedades por mayor para confeccionar mantas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por eso0s motivos que Elena solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana de vicuña por mayor para confeccionar mantas.
texts.en:
Elena is 46, married, has one 10-year-old son, and her business is making blankets.

She is a good mother, independent, and very enterprising. Her business is in the recently developed "Pedregal" area on the south side of the city.

She is dark skinned with braided hair and she wears traditional clothing (hat, blanket, and skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymará and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her son, who is in school. They live in their own adobe home, which has all the basic utilities. Her business is making wool blankets; she buys sheep, llama, and alpaca wools to make artisanal loomed blankets: "I started this work because my friends encourage me to and they were my first customers," she tells us. The good thing about her business is that her sales are constant, the problem is a lack of capital to buy wool wholesale. Her dream is to open a weaving workshop. She wants to buy different kinds of wool wholesale to make blankets. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in her 8 years of doing business.

For these reasons Elena is requesting a loan to buy llama wool wholesale to make blankets.

loans.use: to buy llama wool wholesale to make blankets.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Meet Alice, a young farmer from Nandihills County in Kenya who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. She is the proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, and some variety of crops she plants.

Alice passionately loves farming, and she says that she got interested in farming out of a desire to be a solution to food security, which remains a thorn in the flesh for all the farmers in Nandihills, and Africa as a whole. From farming, she has been able to earn a decent income, and she attributes all this success to hard work and determination. Although she makes profits, she has always wanted to increase her farming and start a cereal-selling business. The main challenge she has been facing is lack of funds.

She is seeking a loan to buy cereals. Demand for cereals is overwhelming in Nandihills, and through your loan, she intends to buy different varieties of cereals and be able to satisfy the demand in her village and the local market. With your loan, Alice will improve her living conditions through increased profits from selling cereals. She believes that her cereal-selling business will increase by leaps and bounds.

There is no doubt that through your loan, Alice's life is permanently going to change, and she will ensure her school-going children have a secure future.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 44 years old and a proud mother of a lovely family that she really adores and cherishes. It is through Doris’s perseverance and courage that her family can have a respectable life. Doris is a hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past four years. Doris practices mixed farming. That is, she grows maize and keeps poultry, and through these activities, she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Although Doris has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum. Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases.

That is why she is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to be able to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, Doris will be assured of a bumper harvest and this will translate into more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, Doris will reap more, which will assure her of comfort taking care of her family and repaying the loan. Doris's plan is to be able to increase her farming and to be able to save more money so that she can buy more land for farming. Help her out!

loans.use: to buy farm implements which will increase her yield and enable her to buy more land.

loans.name: Banani

texts.en:
Twenty-eight-year-old Banani is a young rural married woman and a mother of one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Parangerpar village in Alipurduar district. Both of her children go to a local school. Banani wants to provide an uninterrupted education to her children.

Sonali is the elder daughter of Banani. She is 12 years old, reads in grade seven in Parangerpar Sishu Kalyan High School and is a very hardworking student. Banani’s husband Krishna is a blacksmith. He works very hard to cover the family expenses. But his income is insufficient for the daily needs and providing an education to their children became a dream for them. But they want to provide a good education to their children.

So as a responsible mother, Banani sought help from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for Sonali. Banani applied for an educational loan. This loan amount will help Banani to pay the school fees, exam fees, private coaching fees, fees for new books and school dress, etc. for her daughter. Sonali wants to become a nurse in the future and give support to her family.

Banani and her daughter Sonali (shown in the picture) thank Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to bear the educational costs of her daughter.

loans.name: Behruz

texts.ru: Бехруз молодой юноша из Яванского района. Ему 23 лет. Он живет с родителями, младшим братом и сестрой. Из-за финансовых проблем, Бехруз не смог поступить в Университет, однако он начал работать таксистом, чтобы обеспечивать свою семью и помогать родителям. Он стал профессиональным шофером и всегда разговаривает вежливо с пассажирами. У него много клиентов.  Сейчас он нуждается в кредите, чтобы отремонтировать свою автомашину. С помощью машины он зарабатывает на жизнь. Он не хочет потерять источник своего дохода. Бехруз верит в Вас и надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Behruz is a young man from Yavan.  He is 23 years old.  He lives with his parents and his younger brother and sister.  Because of financial difficulties, Behruz couldn't attend university, and so started to work as a taxi driver in order to support his family and help his parents.  He became a professional chauffeur and is always polite when talking to passengers.  He has many clients.  Right now he needs a loan in order to repair his car.  His car allows him to make a living and he does not want to lose the source of his income.  Behruz believes in you and is counting on your support.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Samialo

texts.ru: Он Самиало. Ему 31 лет. Самиало вместе с женой и детьми живет в районе Темурмалик. Самиало более 3 лет продвигает свою торговую деятельность. У нее не большой магазин, где продает товары первой необходимости. В ассортимент ее товара входят, сахар, масло, конфеты, печенье и другое. Другие полки магазина пустуют и Самиало необходимо привести новый товар. У Самиало нет денежных средств  на приобретения продукт питания и привозку, и Самиало обратился за заемными средствами. Самиало заранее благодарит за помощь и искреннее надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: This is Samialo - he is 31 years old and lives with his wife and children in Temurmalik.  For more than 3 years Samialo has been running his own business; he has a small store where he sells essential goods including sugar, butter, candy, cookies, and other products.  Other shelves in his store are empty, and so Samialo needs to purchase new goods.  Samialo doesn't have the financial resources to purchase and ship new wares, and so requested a loan.  Samialo is grateful in advance and is sincerely counting on your support.

loans.use: to purchase and ship food products

loans.name: Otabek

texts.ru: Отабек  начинающий предприниматель из Кабадиянского района. Ему 30 лет. Он хочет начать новую деятельность в сфере животноводства. Он не боится начать новый бизнес и смело идет к своей цели. Отабек хочет получить кредит и на заемные деньги приобретет несколько голов скота. В течение 30-35 дней их содержания и откорма, он намерен перепродать животных с наценкой. Таким способом он хочет начать бизнес, заработать на нем и тем самым обеспечить свою семью.
texts.en: Otabek is an aspiring entrepreneur from Qubadiyon.  He is 30 years old and wants to start a new business in animal husbandry.  He is not afraid to start a new business and is boldly moving toward his goal.  Otabek hopes to receive a loan and with the money purchase a few head of livestock.  After 30-35 days of caring for and fattening the animals, he plans to sell the livestock for a profit.  In this way he hopes to start his business, work at it, and thus provide for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a few head of livestock and start his business.

loans.name: Dahlia

texts.en: Dahlia is 35 years old from Jagna, Bohol. She is a general store owner and has two sons, ages 11 and 16. For 16 years now, she has been selling household basic commodities like candies, chips, canned food, seasoning, soft drinks, and eggs. She is hoping that she can improve her store's inventory by buying stock in bulk to maximize her profit. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock like eggs, noodles, bread, canned goods, soft drinks, beverages, and chips. Dahlia will then invest her profit in the same business, providing herself and her family a nutritious diet as well as save for possible business expansion. She will also support the education of her son to assist him in finishing his Information Technology course.

loans.use: to buy eggs, noodles, bread, canned goods, soft drinks, beverages and chips

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is a resident of Calape, Bohol. He is married and has five children. Three of these children are still school-aged, ages 18, 16 and seven years old. Ricardo and his wife work together in their food-vending business to earn a living. They sell food like rice cake, cassava cake, “biko” (sweetened steamed rice), “puto” (steamed muffins) and “shakoy” (fried dough sprinkled with sugar). They have been doing this business for almost 15 years. Thus, he is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as milled glutinous rice, cassava flour, flour, cooking oil, and sugar. 

In the future, he wishes to improve his business to have enough money to send all of his school-aged children to school and finish their degrees.

loans.use: to buy milled glutinous rice, cassava flour, flour, cooking oil, and sugar

loans.name: Kings Way S. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Josephat. He is an administrator at Kings Way S. School, a mixed school in the rural area of Kakamiro in Kibaale with 800 students. Kings Way S. School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1,000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kings Way S. School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Josephat ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students

loans.name: Vergilia

texts.en: Vergilia is a 59-year-old, married woman with two grown children. She is a rice farmer and a hog raiser. She would like to expand her farm but she spends her money on feed for her hogs. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to keep her crops healthy. She hopes to make her businesses more profitable and manage them well so they can bring back a good return on her investment. Her income will be for food, savings, and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Hikmatulo

texts.ru: Хикматуло хороший и доброжелательный человек. Он живет со своей семьей в районе Бохтар. Хикматуло работает таксистом. Таким образом, он зарабатывает на жизнь и обеспечивает семью. Его жена домохозяйка. Хикматуло единственный человек в доме, который зарабатывает. Сейчас он хочет получить кредит и отремонтировать свой дом, который очень старый. До этого момента он не мог отремонтировать жилье, но в этом году он решил сделать уютный дом для своей семьи. У Хикматуло есть свой капитал, но этого не достаточно. Он ждет Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Hikmatulo is a good and kind man.  He lives with his family in Bohtar.  Hikmatulo works as a taxi driver, which is how he makes a living for himself and supports his family.  His wife is a homemaker, and Hikmatulo is the only person in his home who works.  He is hoping to receive a loan to renovate his home, which is very old.  Until now he hasn't been able to renovate his home, but this year decided to make a comfortable home for his family.  Hikmatulo has his own savings, but they are insufficient.  He awaits your support.

loans.use: To renovate his home

loans.name: Khuroson

texts.ru: Хуросон жительница района Темурмалик. Ей 69 лет. Она замужем и имеет детей. Один сын и одна дочка. Ее муж занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Он выращивает скота у себя во дворе. Дети живут в городе Курган-Тюбе с тетей. Они занимается торговлей деятельности. Хуросон любит домашние животных, и по этой причине, она хочет заниматься животноводством и идти по стопам мужа. У Хуросон имеет свой собственный земельный участок, где она собирается выращивать домашних животных.  Она хочет купить молодых телят и откармливать их в течение нескольких месяцев и продавать их на скотном рынке. Хуросон принимает этот кредит, чтобы  приобрести себе несколько скота и корм для скота. Она ждет Вашу доброту. Хуросону очень важен запрашиваемый кредит.
texts.en: Khuroson is a resident of Temurmalik.  She is 69 years old, married, and has children - one son and one daughter.  Her husband works in agriculture - he raises cattle at their home.  Their children live in the city of Kurgan-Tyube with their aunt, and work in merchandise.  Khuroson loves domestic animals and for this reason hopes to work in animal husbandry, following in the footsteps of her husband.  Khuroson has her own plot of land where she plans to raise domestic animals.  She wants to purchase young calves, fatten them for several months, and sell them at the cattle market.  Khuroson is taking out this loan in order to purchase several head of cattle and feed for the cattle.  She awaits your charity.  It is very important to Khuroson to receive this loan.

loans.use: to purchase several head of cattle for her new business.

loans.name: Trifona

texts.en:
Trifona is a married woman from Calape, Bohol. She is 46 years old and a mother of two children, ages 16 and 10 years old. Her husband works hard as a security guard while Trifona is selling native products. She has been doing this for 15 years. Aside from this, she is also engaged in raising pigs. 

She is asking for a loan to buy materials of native products and to buy piglets and feed. In the future, she wishes to improve her business in order to increase her family's livelihood as well as assist her children in finishing their studies.

loans.use: to buy materials of native products and to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Lustrica

texts.en:
Lustrica has been a rice farmer for 31 years now. She also owns a sari-sari (general) store to earn a living. Her husband is also a farmer and they work together to sustain their needs. Lustrica has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer, canned food, soft drinks, chips, seasoning, condiments, and toiletries. 

She hopes that in the coming years, she will be able to live in comfort with her husband as a result of their hard work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, canned food, soft drinks, chips, seasoning, condiments, and toiletries

loans.name: Creator Of The Universe Group

texts.en: Agnes is a 32 year old woman. She is from Assin Homaho in the Assin South District in the Central Region of Ghana. Agnes is the representative of Creator of the Universe Group. She has 3 children. The children are all currently in school. Their ages are 4, 5 and 12. Agnes is a farmer and she has 10 years of farming experience. She usually cultivates maize and sells to the local market women. She owns a provision store in her neighborhood. With her hard work and the support of her husband, she is aiming at opening another branch at a nearby town. Agnes complained of deforestation, which is making their land infertile for crop production. After witnessing the exhibition of Elsa Clean Cook Stove in her village by the field officers, she chose to buy one, after realizing it can help to preserve the forest, and also as a safer and faster means of cooking. She thereby thanks all Kiva micro lenders for assisting her to purchase the stove.

loans.use: to buy a Clean Cook stove.

loans.name: Thanh Yen 11 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Gai, 66, lives with her husband, her son, her daughter and her grandchild in an old house. Her family relies mostly on agricultural production with several activities such as cultivating rice as well as raising buffalo, pigs, chickens, and ducks. Though she is at an advanced age, she works very hard to support her family and raise her grandchild well. She has been a farmer since she was a little girl, but she previously lacked access to credit to increase production. 

Thanks to the Anh Chi Em program, Mrs. Gai has enough capital and has gradually expanded her farming and animal breeding ventures. This is the fourth time she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy chicks and food for the chickens. With the good experience in agriculture, she believes that her investment will go well and bring good income for her family. 

Mrs. Gai dreams of a more abundant life for her family and a brighter future for her grandchildren. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy chicks and food for the chickens

loans.name: Awieye Nti Group

texts.en: Felicia is 28 years of age. She is the leader of Awieye Nti Group. Felicia is from Assin Homaho in the Assin South District of the Central Region of Ghana. She is married with 3 children. All her children are in schooling. Their ages are 5, 7 and 12. Felicia is a cocoa farmer and has been into it for the past 5 years. According to her, she started with half an acre and now has a large plantation of cocoa farm with the help of her husband, who is also a farmer. She has a vision to further expand her farm. Felicia sells her cocoa beans to the local purchasing clerks. Besides the farming, she is also into trading. Felicia has decided to purchase Elsa Clean Cook Stove but she needs micro loan support for the initial payment. She said it is an easier and faster way she can cook. Also smoke associated with using firewood will not be produced when cooking and above all, it will help eradicate the use of cocoa trees as firewood. Felicia thanks all Kiva micro lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to purchase an Elsa Clean Cook stove.

loans.name: Nyame Nhyira Group

texts.en:
Isaac is 25 years old. He comes from Homaho in the Assin South District of the Central Region of Ghana. He is the leader of Nyame Nhyira Group. Isaac is married with a 4-year-old child, who attends school. Isaac is a successful cocoa farmer and sells the cocoa beans to purchasing clerks. He also does bulk airtime vending to supplement his income. He has two employees who assist him in the farm. 

Isaac and his community members participated in community education on climate change, reducing deforestation, and improving indoor/outdoor air quality through the use of clean cook stoves by their field partner. He has difficulty getting access to fuel as most of the trees nearby have already been cut for firewood. Isaac was relieved after participating in the  community education on the use of Elsa stove for clean cooking. He needs a micro-loan to purchase an Elsa Stove for his family to improve their cooking. Isaac said that the loan will be used to buy one Elsa Stove as the fuel used for the stove is the most common and cheapest in his community. He expresses his appreciation to all his Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy an Elsa clean cook stove

loans.name: Onyame Bekyere Group

texts.en:
Edna is 24 years old. She comes from Homaho in the Assin South District of the Central Region of Ghana. Edna is a married woman with two children, ages 5 months and 2 years. One of her children attends school. She has been a cocoa farmer for three years now.  According to her, her parents were successful cocoa farmers that motivated her to also go into farming with the help of her husband. Edna now has a large cocoa farm. Edna’s husband is also a farmer. 

Her major challenge is the danger associated with using the local stove in cooking. Edna now wants to use the Elsa stove to eradicate the health hazard attached to the use of the local stove. Her challenge is the initial money to pay for the stove. Edna needs financial support in the form of a loan to be able to purchase the Elsa stove outright. Edna thanks all of her micro-lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: to purchase an Elsa clean cook stove

loans.name: Adwuma Wura Group

texts.en:
Isaac is a 38-year-old man from Homaho in the Assin South District of Central Region of Ghana. Isaac is the leader of Adwuma Wura group. He is married with 8 children with their ages from 2, 4, 8, 11, 14, 17 and 21 years; 7 of them attend school.

Isaac has been a successful cocoa farmer and purchasing clear for 10 years. Isaac took over from his father who was a great cocoa farmer and now he has a large cocoa plantation of his own. His community received information about an Elsa stove and he became interested in purchasing one. This will help him to minimize the cost of buying charcoal for cooking. Isaac needs financial support to purchase the stove. Isaac is very grateful to all his Kiva micro lenders.

loans.use: to purchase an Elsa clean cook stove.

loans.name: Adom Bi Keke Group

texts.en: Afia is 53 years old and comes from Homaho in the Assin South District in the Central Region of Ghana. Afia is the group representative of Adom Bi Keke Group. Afia is a divorced woman with 4 children. The ages of the children are 20, 28, 30 and 35.  Afia has been a cocoa farmer for the past 20 years. She sells her cocoa beans to the local cocoa purchasing clerks. Afia also sells tomatoes, cassava and plantain at the local market as another source of income. Afia was part of her community members who benefited from community education on the use of clean cook stove.  She highlighted the difficulties she faces in setting up a fire to prepare meals for the family.  Afia says that an Elsa Clean Cook Stove will help her to cook faster as compared to other sources of fuel for cooking. She needs financial assistance to purchase the Elsa Clean cook stove for her family.  Afia is grateful to all Kiva micro lenders.

loans.use: to purchase an Elsa clean cook stove.

loans.name: San Pedranas Activas Group

texts.en:
The nine women of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “San Pedranas Activas” or “Active Women of San Pedro” live in the Western Highlands of Guatemala in a rural mountainous community called San Pedro Sacatepéquez. These ladies are hard-working woman whose ages range from 25 to 62 years. They work in various businesses including food sales and traditional hand-made clothing and handicrafts. Another member of the Trust Bank has a small restaurant called a “comedor”.

Rosa is a 45-year-old woman who sells food out of her home. She also has a “tortilleria” or a shop where she sells tortillas and dairy products. She is requesting a loan to buy rice, pasta, vegetables and oil. She needs corn and firewood for her “tortilleria”. Rosa has five children, three live at home. She would not be able to sustain her household if it were not for the loans, thanks to the generosity of KIVA investors. She is very happy as she has seen her businesses grow and her earnings increase.

The women of the Trust Bank are together each month and Rosa shares that she is most appreciative of their support. Together, the ladies participate in educational trainings on interesting and relevant subjects like women’s health, empowerment and self-esteem as well as realizing dreams and setting goals.

It would be impossible for women like Rosa to walk into a bank in Guatemala to secure a much-needed loan. KIVA investors are held in very high regard by these women who are most appreciative. Thank you, KIVA investors!!!

loans.use: to buy rice, pastas, vegetables, and oil.

loans.name: Chuguexalense Group

texts.en:
The 8 ladies of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Chuguexalense” live in the community of
Chuguexa Chichicastenango that is located on the Panamerican Highway in the Highlands of Guatemala. At this time of the year, it is cloudy and cold in Chuguexa but the people of the community are a hearty sort and are used to it. They speak the Maya language of K’iche.

The ladies are involved in various businesses such as textile artists and small convenience stores. One woman raises pigs, cattle and chickens. Many of the women have children and a few were able to study until the 6th grade.

Martha is a 22 year old married member of the Trust Bank with two children. She is a textile artist and weaves and embroiders traditional blouses (huipiles), shawls and other articles of clothing. She has been with Friendship Bridge for two years and thankfully, her business has grown. She has three employees who assist her in the business and they are able to give support to their families. Martha is requesting a loan to buy many kinds of thread including 30 pounds of the best quality thread she can find in a variety of colors for her embroidery. Martha raises chickens and pigs to generate a little extra income that is quite useful.

The kindness and generosity of KIVA investors is felt by Martha and her friends in the Trust Bank. They will face a brighter future, benefitting themselves, their families and their community because of the “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge and the much-appreciated support of KIVA investors. Thank you!!!

loans.use: to buy 30 pounds of thread.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
When you look at Lilian, she is the true definition of a hard worker.

She is a farmer in Kerugoya and is involved in maize, poultry and dairy farming. She has milk and egg production for commercial purposes, as opposed to many rural farmers who produce for subsistence. Lilian also grows maize for food and sales. These commercial activities place her in a better position to engage in other agricultural businesses, which in fact she does.

Lilian is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to construct a cow shed. This will help significantly in managing the animals’ health and hygiene. She has been in the farming business for at least 10 years. She has no plans to quit in the future, as she finds farming to be not only fulfilling, but also lucrative. However, her biggest challenges are the poor road network and the lack of market.

With your loan, Lilian will construct a cow shed, which will later come in handy when she scales up and introduces zero-grazing. The long-term impact is an increase in productivity and improved animal health. The additional income from this development will go to her children’s education.

Kindly lend to a Kenyan farmer with great dreams!

loans.use: to build a modern dairy shed.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
For 10 years, Lucia has worked in agricultural production. This is a skill that she learned on her own and, little by little, has perfected her techniques and abilities in this field. She knows that many people consume her farm products, and because of this, she makes sure her products are pure and of good quality.

She is a 55-year-old farmer from Kiptabuk village, situated in the Rift valley province of Kenya. She lives with her family on a small piece of land where she keeps sheep and grows a wide variety of crops. For 10 years, her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and produce. Her biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs.

Sometime this month, she applied for a loan to buy seeds and expand her horticultural farm. This will enable her to expand her operations to increase the overall output. The additional income from the expansion will go to educating her children.

The cost of education in Kenya is increasingly becoming prohibitive to low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, kids are forced to drop out to start working to contribute their earnings to their families. With your loan, Lucia’s siblings will acquire quality education that will act as a strong foundation for their bright future.
Help this smallholder farmer to fulfill her dreams and to improve her horticulture farming! A loan will certainly push her one step closer to achieving her goals.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
This is Norah. She is a 36-year-old woman who lives in the area of Kitale. It is a thriving area full of people like Norah, who, with hard and honest work, make this town a very productive one.

Norah is a woman eager to get ahead. She is single and lives with her family. She is blessed with four children, who are her greatest motivation in life to persevere because she wants to give them a better future.

Norah herself was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. Norah always says, “I have always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in my blood.” Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows, and she is a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Through her dairy cows, she is able to get between 10 and 15 liters a day, and this helps her to support her family.

Norah also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements, and this is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will also be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence increased profit levels.

Norah is really visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Norah believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Norah’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a 46-year-old-married woman who lives with his husband in the municipality of Fredonia. A few years ago she decided to start her own business because she wanted to find a way to support her family and to help their economic needs. She has raised cattle since 2010.

The most important thing for her is to make her business last so that she can survive. She also wants to have more animals and requests a loan to buy food for the animals because it’s really expensive and she doesn’t have the money to buy it.

Patricia wants to make her farm bigger and better to provide her family with a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animal food.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.en:
Maria is a 53-year-old-married woman who lives in the municipality of Bello with her husband. She decided that it’s time to follow her dreams and create a bakery business because her husband is a very talented baker and has taught her everything about the business.

She expects that her business can get many clients, because she trusts in her good services and good work. She wants to have a successful business to provide for her family. She’s asking for a loan to start her bakery and buy an oven and tools.

Maria has many dreams, but she always has wanted to make her house beautiful, by repairing some things and buying furniture that give to her family comfort.

loans.use: to start her bakery and buy an oven and tools.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is 24 years old and lives in the municipality of Dabeiba. He inherited a business from his family and has the responsibility of continuing the business. He owns a farm to grow different kind of products.

He wants to increase the profits of his business so he can invest in it and makes it successful; he also would like to grow more crops. He’s asking for a loan to buy inputs, and pay administrative costs.

Gabriel has a big dream and it’s to give to his family a new house. He promised himself because he cares for his family and wants to give them a good quality of life.

loans.use: to  buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en: Gerardo is 22 years old and lives with his grandparents. He sews and  owns two sewing machines to make leather wallets. He needs a loan to buy leather and fabric. Gerardo is learning more and more about his business.

loans.use: to buy leather and fabric

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and a proud mother of a lovely family that she really adores and cherishes. Josephine is a hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past four years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming. Josephine practices mixed farming. That is, she grows maize and keeps pigs. She really enjoys taking care of her poultry. Although Josephine has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum. Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases.

That is why she is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to be able to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, Josephine will be assured of a bumper harvest and this will translate into more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, Josephine will reap more, which will assure her of comfort taking care of her family and repaying the loan. Josephine’s plan is to be able to increase her farming and to be able to save more money so that she can buy more land for farming. Help her out!

loans.use: to buy farm  implements which will increase her yield and enable her to buy more land.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is a small-scale farmer who lives in the remote village of soweto in the Molo area of Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with two children. For the last five years, Angeline has been engaged in mixed farming and has never looked back. Her primary sources of income have been sales of milk, eggs and crops as well as some personal business in which she engages to make ends meet. Angeline finds farming very fulfilling and agrees with the notion that farming is a very profitable business venture.

She is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as quality seeds and fertilizer that will increase her production levels, which will immediately translate into increased income levels. Angeline is a very hard-working woman who believes that, through hard work and honest sweat, her living conditions will permanently change. She will use the extra income she will receive to repay the loan and increase her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as quality seeds.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in a humble home in the town of Nkubu, along with her husband and two children. She is a rural farmer from an area known for producing long-distance runners who have broken major world records. Mary works with a great deal of determination, for many hours, on her farm, all to bring decent food to her home and be her family’s support. Mary has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years. On her farm, she grows maize and keeps a dairy cow and poultry.

Farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction despite the low earnings. Mary said, "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" Her biggest challenge, however, is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. To a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family.

Because of this challenge, Mary formed a group is seeking a new loan to buy another dairy cow and is planning to become a full-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Mary is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer.

Help out this humble smallholder farmer with a loan!

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a mother of 8 who takes very good care of her children. She has gone through a lot of adversity in her life, but she has always had the strength to get ahead and continue progressing with her family.

Magdaline is a smallholder farmer based in the Nkubu area of Kenya. She owns a small parcel of land that she uses to grow maize and keep goats. She has also planted trees on it for aesthetic appearances and environmental health. Magdaline is blessed to have eight children, with a husband to whom she has stayed married to for 25 years!

Magdaline is seeking a loan to purchase cereals. The demand for cereals in the Nkubu area, only a few kilometers from Magdaline's home, is up. Farmers in the area are rushing to grow more cereal crops. By placing herself in a position of supplying cereal seeds and still being a cereal farmer, she gets to enjoy profits from selling inputs and crop harvests. She is very pragmatic and considers herself more hardworking than others.

She strives to give her children a better life than the tough upbringing she grew up with. Kindly help out this woman who has great desire to succeed. Support the dream of Magdaline; be inspired; make a loan!

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Ten years ago, Susan started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Kerugoya, a remote town in Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs and a variety of crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Taking care of her poultry is an activity that she finds very enjoyable, and feeding her poultry is her hobby. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in the Kerugoya area. Susan has good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market where the demand is very high.

Being a visionary woman, she has always wanted to increase her poultry flock, so now she is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry.

Susan believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding and good care. By ensuring that the poultry are well fed, she is guaranteed to reap the benefits. In addition to selling eggs and poultry, she will also sell poultry feathers that are commonly used to make earrings. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women like Susan can achieve their dreams and goals. Kindly lend to Susan to keep her big smile!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 22 years old and lives in the municipality of Sonson. He’s been thinking of ways to work because there are not a lot of opportunities for young people without experience. He decided to start his own business to sell clothes.

It is very important to have a good number of clients and he will work really hard so that his business can last. He will use the loan to start his business and buy clothes and shoes to sell.

Alexander wants to help his family with their expenses and dreams of repairing the house.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is a very active who woman lives in a rural village of Coochbehar district with her two children and husband. She is 43 years old. Besides managing all the household chores, she helps her husband in a brash, copper utensil business. Their elder son is a graduate and working for a company.

Sanghita is the only daughter of Laxmi. She is only 20 years old and a very bright and intelligent student. She is pursuing her Bachelor's degree in geography from Thakur Panchanan Mahila College. Sanghita wants to become a school teacher in the future. So she is working hard to reach her dream. Laxmi and her family are trying their best to support Sanghita’s education but their earning is not enough to cover the family expenses and education costs simultaneously. Laxmi is so determined to provide an education for her daughter that she is seeking a loan from BJS.

Laxmi will use the loan amount to purchase books and other study materials, pay college fees, exam fees and private coaching fees etc. for her daughter.

Laxmi and Sanghita (shown in the photo) convey their heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to bear the cost of a three-year degree in education for her daughter.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.en:
Luis is a 49-year-old-married man who lives in the municipality of Sonson with his family; he has a daughter and a son. He has run his business for 14 years, which he inherited from his family; and learned the business from his father who was an expert in raising cattle.

The costs of the animals are really expensive and it is not easy to make his business grow for the amount of money he needs to do it. He works hard to increase the clients and to make his business successful. He found Interactuar and Kiva, and wants to get help so he can invest in his business. He will use the loan to buy two cows.

Luis wants to see his business grow and be recognized. He wants to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is fully dedicated to her farm work and thinks only of progressing. She resides in the Nkubu area of Kenya which is a remote town with harsh living conditions because of the bad terrain in the region. She is happily married and, together with her husband, has a lovely family. Margaret’s primary sources of income are milk and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. Margaret has managed to take care of her family with her income from selling different varieties of food crops.

Margaret has always wanted to start banana farming but the lack of capital has prevented her. She is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start banana farming. With this loan she will be able to harvest more bananas and hence satisfy the ready market in her region. Demand for bananas in the Nkubu area is high but the supply is low. So, through this loan, Margaret is going to comfortably meet the demand.

Her increased income will allow Margaret to provide a secure future for her school-going children by paying their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. Her vision is to be a leading supplier of bananas in major hotels and households in her region. Help her out!

loans.use: to buy seeds and start banana farming.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther 27 years old is very clear about what she wants in life and determined to get ahead and have a good life. Esther is a married mother of four children. She runs a 1-acre mixed farm. She has dairy cows, poultry, cash crops, and over 50 trees. With all these activities, however, Esther could not make enough income to meet her family's basic needs. Therefore, she started a cereal trading business. Basically, she arranges the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers.
The borrowed money will be used to aggregate more cereal produce from local farmers; the larger the stock, the more the income.

The impact of your loan will be felt by both her family and other farmers in her village. By using her better understanding of the market conditions and prices, she will be able to sell much easier, and this will free her supplies to focus more on production. Income from this trade will help Esther to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Elizabeth, a young farmer from Soy, a remote village in Nandihills, Kenya, who has defied the common thinking about most Kenyans that agriculture is for the older generation.

Elizabeth is happily married and together with her husband they are blessed with four children. Her primary source of income is milk and also she plants different varieties of food crops. She also engages in some personal business and has been able to earn a handsome profit from the venture.

Elizabeth practices agriculture with a difference, employing youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge from the many agricultural training classes she has been attending to broaden her skills. Although she earns handsome profits from farming, she faces one big challenge, and that is the high price of fertilizers, seedlings and inputs. This is a result of the monopoly that is enjoyed by the only Agrovet shop in her area.

She is therefore requesting a loan to start an Agrovet shop. Soy area has only one agro dealer, which is catering to thousands of smallholder farmers who depend solely on that dealer for agricultural inputs. The agro dealer has been making a killing from farmers by charging them higher prices because they are the only agro dealer and have a monopoly. Elizabeth wants to change this and seize the business opportunity, and through your loan she will start an Agrovet shop and tap into the potential agricultural market. She will also help the smallholder farmers in her area, who have long been having a serious problem accessing affordable farm inputs.

Through your loan, Elizabeth will change from the peasant farmer she is right now to a certified agro dealer. Through increased income from the loan, she will improve her living conditions, and her future plans are to purchase a truck which will be used to engage farmers in output marketing activities.

Elizabeth believes that there is no doubt that youths like her can find rewarding employment in farming. She patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to start an Agrovet shop.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a responsible, hard- working and enterprising man from the Kitale area of Kenya. He is 29 years old, married and the father of 2. He makes a living doing farming and masonry. He gets help with his work from his family members.

Currently, he is trying to gather capital to secure more land to cultivate and produce more food that will give his family decent diets and better income.

He loves to feed people and that is why he finds his business fulfilling. Your loan will help him elevate his livelihood by producing more food for his family and others in the community.

His business is in line with Juhudi Kilimo’s mission to fight poverty and increase food security in Kenya.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders, meet Risper, a practical woman. She has no higher education or work experience, only her wits and her desire to succeed in life. She is a very hardworking, progressive, and honest farmer from a very remote village in Sengera in the Kenyenya area of Kenya. This area is very fertile, with favorable weather patterns that support farming activities.

Risper is happily married and the proud mother, and together with her family they live on a small piece of land that she really treasures. Her primary sources of income are eggs, milk. Although this humble and industrious mother makes a profit, she faces the challenge of not being able to produce enough to meet the ready market that is available. Therefore, she is seeking funds from the wonderful Kiva lenders to buy farm inputs like good fertilizer and good-quality seeds.

Through this loan, she will double her production, and this will translate into increased income. She then intends to save more money in the future so that she can develop her farming. This loan will help Risper to realize her dream of getting out of poverty, and she will be able to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a rural smallholder crop farmer in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. He does livestock and crop farming for a living. He loves his cows and is thinking of adding sheep into his livestock portfolio. The problem is, he does not have the capital required to acquire sheep and buy farm inputs.

Michael is seeking a loan to buy sheep. With the money that remains, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity.

Your loan will help Michael generate more income from selling wool and lamps, and increase his chances for a successful harvest through quality inputs.

loans.use: to buy sheep and farm inputs

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married mother of six who lives and farms in the Nandihills area of Kenya. She makes good use of her two-acre farm to keep dairy and poultry animals, and grows bananas and trees.
To improve her income, Joyce is a broker in the cereals trade. Her job is to arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to its buyers. With over ten years of experience in farming, Joyce is well-connected and well-equipped to make this brokerage business a success.
What Joyce needs is to secure a large stock of cereals which will make the investment worthwhile. She is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo to pay for more from local farmers.
This loan investment not only benefits Joyce and her family, but also local farmers. By buying their produce at competitive prices, Joyce enables the local farmers to focus on what they are good at, which is production rather than sales.
Be inspired, and make a loan!

loans.use: to buy more cereals so as to expand her brokerage in this commodity.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Meet Faith, an ambitious woman who always seeks her horizon. Since she was little, she showed a strong passion for independent work, but when she became pregnant, she left behind many of her dreams to focus completely on taking care of her little ones.

Since her children are at a good age, she wants to take up her dreams again and create work to maintain herself, since she doesn't know when her husband might be lacking or when they would go through a very complicated situation. Her primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for ten years, and throughout she has never regretted going into farming.
She is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for resale and thus improve her income.

Faith's upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements, and she believes that through your loan she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Faith has received training and proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Faith is quite a visionary and, with her accumulated profits, she hopes she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en: Jenifer is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. She works untiringly every day of the week. She lives in Kapsowar, a remote town in Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with 7 children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained a great deal of experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops from her farmland.  She has cows, but she is expecting more heads of cattle in the near future. One of the biggest problems that Jenifer is dealing with today is the controlling of animal movement. Cows tend to naturally wander into crop farms, where they end up destroying grown plants. Jenifer is seeking a loan to construct a fence. Your investment will not only beef up security on Jenifer's property, but will also prevent her cows from moving beyond unrestricted grazing areas of the farm.

loans.use: to construct a fence.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a farmer from the Nkubu area of Kenya. He practices both livestock and crop farming for a living. To make extra income for his family, he engages in cereal trade as a middleman between farmers and buyers. For his cereal business to be worthwhile, John needs to aggregate a significant volume of cereal produce from farmers, which is very expensive for him since he is just starting out.

To do obtain what he needs for his cereal business, John is seeking a loan of KES 20,000. Your money will help him secure a sizable stock for sale in distant markets that offer better prices. Income generated from this activity will enable him to provide basics for his family and pay school fees for his 3 children.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
