Gita is a rural housewife who is involved in her daily household chores and takes care of her family. She is 45 year old and lives in Debibari village in Coochbehar district with her two daughter and husband. Her husband work as a mechanic. Her two daughters are studying in different grades.

Gita’s elder daughter Sweta is 19 years old. She is very serious about her studies. She is pursuing her Bachelor's degree from B.T And Evening College. Gita’s husband Shankar works very hard to give educational support to his daughters but the growing expenses for their daily needs makes him helpless. Now Sweta needs some study materials and the guidance of a private tutor to continue her Bachelor's degree. Gita doesn’t want to compromise with her daughter’s education. So she came forward to Kiva’s partner, BJS, to ask for a loan.

This educational loan will help to pay the college fees, exam fees, and private tuition fees, and to purchase the necessary books and other study materials for a needy student. Now Gita and her daughter (shown in the photo) are very happy and relaxed and convey their thanks to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to cover the cost of a Bachelor's degree education for her daughter.

loans.name: Wycliff

texts.en:
Wycliff is a smallholder farmer based in the Kitale area of Kenya. He is married with 4 children. He started farming 20 years ago when he had his first-born child. Today, he has focused on lumbering.

Wycliff is seeking a loan to buy a generator. Mabondeni village where he is from is off-the-grid, and the few areas with electricity experience regular power blackouts. A petrol-powered generator will mean as much to his business as an uninterrupted power supply (UPS) system is important to a person/organization using a desktop computer.

The reduced downtime brought about by the generator will improve his business' turnaround time and income in the long-term.

loans.use: to buy a power generator

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.en:
This is Eulogia’s variety store that contains inadequate stocks as you can see. As much as she want to improve her inventory, but her capital is quite limited. She has a lot of collectibles from her neighbors in Buhangin, Davao City who pay after several weeks or months for the goods they get from her store. She cannot force them because she understands that there are times when money is really difficult to earn. It’s a good thing that she has a child who works abroad and regularly sends financial support to her and her husband, Lucio, a retired worker.

Eulogia still aims to improve her variety store so it can earn enough to prepare for emergency purposes. Of course she can always rely from her child abroad but it would take some time before she gets hold of it. Therefore it’s always advisable that she has enough savings that she can use anytime. To attain this, she wants to avail herself of a loan worth 25,000 PHP. She will buy additional stocks of dry goods, grocery items, and cases of beverages. You can be the answer to her prayers through your generous support. Thank you so much in advance.

Eulogia is an enthusiastic member of CCT where she gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories of their life and businesses. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dry goods, grocery items, and cases of beverages

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married mother of 4 lovely children. To help her husband provide for the family, Beatrice ventured into farming 10 years ago. Currently, she keeps cows and poultry on her farm for milk, meat and eggs. She also makes extra money arranging the logistics of getting cereal produce from local farmers to their buyers. She understands that for this business to be successful, she needs to rely on two things: relationships and capital. She has been able to build strong relationships in the 10 years she has been farming, what she seems to be lacking is capital to secure cereal inventory.
Beatrice is seeking a loan of KES 10,000 to buy cereals. She plans to use the money to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. The impact of your loan will be twofold: Smallholder farmers selling to Beatrice will be relieved the burden of selling and that will only help them to focus more on production;

Her greatest dream is to improve the conditions of her home, since it has been many years since it was built and its current state is not the best. You can be part of this dream. Go for it, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals for sale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 27 years old and has two children. She resides in Nandi Hills, Kenya. She has been practicing farming for 5 years on her small plot, where she does dairy and crop farming. Gladys enjoys farming very much, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide them with their basic needs. 

Gladys has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to start the shop. With the loan, Gladys will be able to improve her income level and to take care of her family. 

Her projections are that, by the end of the first year, she would be able to open another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and husband.
Support a smallholder farmer who's hungry to improve and get ahead with her determination.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Managing a “sari-sari” (variety) store is not just a simple “wait and sell” practice as other people think. It is also a demanding task that Norma from Buhangin, Davao City has to wake up very early in the morning and goes to sleep late at night in order to meet the demands of customers. Sometimes a customer knocks at 4:30am to buy one sachet of coffee worth PhP 5. At times, she has to stay until 12 midnight to take the orders of a group drinking beer in front of her store. Norma needs to be patient indeed or else customers will brand her as unfriendly and they will patronize other stores. It’s a good thing that her husband, Cesar, takes turn in looking after the store. They share the task because its profit supports their usual everyday needs. They are old couple who was able to raise their children well, and now they still want to be productive through their variety store enterprise.  

But many debtors hinder the smooth operation of her store. It reduces her capital and affects their everyday sustenance. She aims to avail of a PHP 25,000 loan to cover some collectibles so she can buy more canned goods, snack items, toiletries, and beverages. She will also add vegetables to enhance her inventory. She dreams to acquire a car for her family if her savings suffices. She shares this aspiration with her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, snack items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is a married mother of three children, two of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither  has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Paul, a smallholder mixed-farmer based in the Bomet area of Kenya. He is married and has 5 children. He relies on livestock and crop farming to produce food and generate income. His future plans are dependent on the success of his dairy farm and that is why he joined a solidarity group called ‘Agape’ in order to secure financial services.

Paul is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. The newly acquired cow will increase the number of livestock on his farm and the quantity of milk that he supplies. However, the impact of your loan goes beyond direct food production to include multipurpose uses, such as skins, fiber, fertilizer and fuel, as well as capital accumulation.

Increased income generated from this loan investment will help Paul pay for his family’s basic needs as well as buy agricultural supplies, such as seed, fertilizers, pesticides, animal feeds and implements to ensure sustainability of his business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a married woman with four kids, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Sidi operates a grocery vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of seasonality and price fluctuations in her place of operation.


With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Hadeel

texts.en: Hadeel is now in her third year at the university majoring in chemistry. She is want hardly to graduate and find a good work to help her family and improved their standards of living, lately Hadeel`s father could not cover her university fees because of the financial crisis he is facing therefore she is now applying a loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees. Hadeel is eager to work in her study field after getting her Bachelors.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees for a BSc.in Chemistry

loans.name: Helan

texts.en:
Forty-five-year old Helan is a middle-aged housewife who lives with her only son and husband in a village named Takagach in Coochbehar district. Her husband is a driver by profession.

Helan’s son Prasenjit is 22 years old and pursuing his Bachelor's degree in Bengali from Netaji Subhash Open College. Though his father is doing his best effort to earn money for the family, it is insufficient to cover the educational cost of their son. Prasentjit is very determined to complete his Bachelor's degree with the aim of becoming a teacher in the future. Now Prasenjit needs some books and to pay his educational fees for his continuous education. So Helan sought a loan from Kiva via BJS.

Helan will use the loan amount to purchase books and other study materials, to pay college fees, exam fees and private coaching fees etc. for her son’s uninterrupted education.

Helan and Prasenjit (shown in the photo) convey their thanks to their lenders.

loans.use: to cover the cost of a Bachelor's degree education for her son.

loans.name: St. Andrew's School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Robert. He is an administrator at St. Andrew's Secondary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Mbarara with 500 students. St. Andrew's School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Andrew's School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Robert ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Thirty-seven-year-old Jayanti lives with her two sons and husband in a rural village named Banchukamari in Coochbehar district. To help her family financially, Jayanti is involved in plywood work. Her husband is engaged in a fast food business.

Jayanti’s elder son Raju is 19 years old and a very hardworking student. He is going to B.T And Evening College for his Bachelor's degree. Raju is very serious about his studies and he wants to become a school teacher in his future life. So he wants to take a higher degree. Now Raju wants some books and the help of a private tutor to score good marks in his upcoming examination. But Jayanti does not have sufficient money to cover the educational costs of her son. Thus, she seeks a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, for Raju’s continuous education.

The loan will help Jayanti to pay the college fees, engage a private tutor, and purchase the necessary books, other study materials, etc. for her son Raju.

Raju and Jayanti (shown in the photo) convey their heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of a Bachelor's degree education for her son.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a single man. He is living with his parents because he doesn't have money to pay rent by himself. He works as a barber but Jose knows how to cut women's hair as well.

Jose needs a loan to buy a hair washing machine for his barbershop. Jose hopes you can help him because he pays the rent of the place where his barbershop is.

loans.use: to buy a hair washing machine

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is a 38-year-old woman from Catigbian, Bohol. She is married with three children ages 21, 19 and eight years old. Gina and her husband owned a tricycle as their main source of income. They have been running this business for 10 years. Aside from this, Gina is also running a sari-sari a store business to help her husband in their daily expenses. They work together to provide the needs of their children. Thus, Gina is asking a loan for tricycle maintenance and to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, toiletries, chips, biscuits, candies, coffee, sugar, powdered milk and soft drinks. In the future, she wishes to upturn their tricycle business for sustainability.

loans.use: for tricycle maintenance and to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, toiletries, chips, biscuits, candies, coffee, sugar, powdered milk and soft drinks

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 35-year-old woman from Calape, Bohol. She is married with five children ages 18, 17, 12, six and two years old. She is engaged in sea shell craft business for house decorations. Aside from this, she also buys and sells dried fish for additional earnings. She has been doing this for almost 10 years. Thus, she is asking a loan to buy materials for sea shell craft like frame and nylon, and additional dried fish to sell. In the future, she wishes for business improvement to have a better means of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy frame and nylon; dried fish

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter 41 years old. He is married and has four children.  His business is farming and livestock keeping. He has been in this business for 15 years. He earns a monthly income of twenty thousand Kenya shillings. This is his third loan from VisionFund Kenya. 


He will use the loan to buy goats and animal feeds. He will use the profits from expanded business to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy goats and animal feeds.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married mother of six children. She keeps cattle and poultry for milk, eggs, and meat respectively. On her one-acre piece of land, you will also find a granary, cereals, and over 100 trees. 

To make better income, Gladys engages in cereal brokering, which involves arranging the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. Over the ten years that she has been in the business, she has made an effort to build strong relationships because in this business, success depends on reputation.

Since she can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, Gladys prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to build her inventory by aggregating more produce from local farmers at competitive prices. She will use her understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell later at a profit. 

Your loan will help local farmers selling to Gladys to focus on production, rather than sales. Gladys’s family also stands to benefit greatly from the improved income and elevated livelihood.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a 55-year-old woman from Calape, Bohol. She is a widow with three children ages 17, 15 and 12 years old. That means she needs to work hard to provide the needs of her three children.  She only earns a living by doing the sari-sari store business. She has been doing these for five years. Lydia wishes to improve her business, perhaps for their daily consumption. Thus, she is asking a loan to help her increase her earnings. She buys assorted goods such as biscuits, chips, bread, candies, canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, toiletries, coffee, sugar, powdered milk and soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, chips, bread, candies, canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, toiletries, coffee, sugar, powdered milk and soft drinks.

loans.name: Samang's Group

texts.en:
Sam Ang, who is a local farmer in Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Sam Ang is 49-year-old and a mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school. To struggle her living, she is growing paddy rice since she was 18 years old and she spend her free time to work for others for a fee to get supplement income. Her crop has been destroyed by insect pests so she cannot earn good income recently.

Due to lacking of working capital, Sam Ang decides to take a new loan with VisionFund and this is the second time for her. The past one loan, provided her family enough household consumption. As the group leader of this new loan, she will use her portion of loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer to enrich the crop with nutrients. She hopes to earn more income to expand her current business and upgrade her living standard.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer to enhance the crop that enable her to increase income to save for future needs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Tik

texts.en:
A 30-year-old married woman who is a resident in Tbaung Khmum district, Tik is a mother of five dependent children. One of them is in school while the other three are under the age of school. To make a living, she and her husband grows cassava for main income and work for others for fees for additional income. Having been involved in these businesses for twelve years, they earn about USD7 per day and can save approximately about USD3 each day. Low cassava is the challenge she faces.


This is the first time for Tik to apply for a loan from VisionFund. She will use some of her loan to buy organic pesticide and organic fertilizer to improve the crop yields and some will be used to pay for labor fees and buy school materials. She hopes to expand her cassava farming business and earn good income to keep her children in school until they graduate from high school.

loans.use: to buy organic pesticide and organic fertilizer to improve the crop yields and to buy school materials for her children.

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province, Kim is 56 years old and a married mother of four children, two of whom are still depending on her. Nowadays, she works for others for a fee to support her living for 37 years. She can earn income about 4USD per day. After expenses, she can save around 2USD each day. Due to lacking of working capital, she decides to get a new loan with VisionFund which is the second time for her.

The past loan, it helped her to have a better living condition. She is willing to manage her entire loan portion to buy a decent latrine. She hopes that all her family members are healthy and they can perform their jobs better than before to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine so to keep her family healthy and they can perform their jobs better than before.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sai Baba Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Hema is a mother of a 12-year-old child. She is a daily wage labourer. She is the one standing on the extreme right in the photograph. Her family is dependent on agriculture for a living.

Hema and her family do not have a toilet in their home. They have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private: in dense bushes or isolated fields. They often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves in private. She and her family are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

Hema understands the importance of having a toilet at home. She leads a group of three women who have come together to apply for a loan of 45,000 INR. They need the loan to build toilets in their respective homes. Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for these families. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. Your loan will provide these three families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Sai Baba Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Indu is a married lady standing on the extreme right in the photograph. She is a daily wage laborer. Her family is dependent on agriculture for a living.

Indu and her family do not have a toilet in their home. They have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private: in dense bushes or isolated fields. They often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves in private. She and her family are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

Indu understands the importance of having a toilet at home. She leads a group of three women who have come together to apply for a loan of 45,000 INR. They need the loan to build toilets and incorporate water pipes in their respective homes to increase their convenience. Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for these families. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. Your loan will provide these three families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: to build a toilet and incorporate water pipes.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny is a 32-year old college graduate who lives in Victorias City. She is married to Harrygere, who works as a Base manager in Manpower for advertising service agency for 5 years. They have 2 children aged 11 and 1. Their total monthly family income is only P12,000 ($261). Jenny wants to help her husband but didn't have the means until she learned about the 2-month training program of Bagosphere that could lead to a call center job. Now that she has passed Bagosphere's selection process, she needs your help to finance her tuition. Jenny dreams to have an adequate income and to become successful in her career. Once Jenny starts earning, she can provide for her family's basic needs and then save some money for her children's education. Your assistance in funding her loan will help Jenny reach her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose is 35 years old he is a single man. Jose works as a driver. He has his own minibus and he needs a loan to pay the repairment of his vehicle's engine. Jose would like to have another vehicle and to hire a driver. Jose lives with his parents and he helps them with the expenses

loans.use: to pay the repairment of his vehicle s engine

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is 46 years old, married and lives in San Vicente Bajo, oroquieta City. She is married to a fisherman. Her husband is small time fisherman whose income is not enough for their growing family needs. She sign up for membership with Paglaum MPC and access her initial capitalization for a motorized banca. Through this, she increased their income and had built additional unit of motorized banca. This time, she asks for a loan to buy new fishing net.

loans.use: to buy new fishing net

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is known in Villaflor, Oroquieta City as vegetbale growers. She has supported her family through this type of business activity. Irene wanted to make a house repair that she asks for a loan to purchase "amakan" (bamboo thatch), wood, nipa (nipa thatch for roofing), nails and payments for labor cost.

loans.use: to purchase "amakan" (bamboo thatch), wood, nipa (nipa thatch for roofing), nails and payments for labor cost

loans.name: Jeane

texts.en: Jeane is a hardworking mother from Caputol, Aloran. She is engaged into hog raising business and has been into this type of living for over 10 years. She's making good fortune out from it and had successfully pay her loans from Paglaum MPC where she is a MIGS member. In need of additional capital, she asks for a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is a farmer from Calube, Aloran. She is a corn grower that supplies corn in their town. In need of additional capital for her farming activities, she sign up for membership with Paglaum MPC and availed her first loan. She successfully pay her loan without records of default payments. Recently, she avails another loan to pay for land preparation like plowing, harrowing and purchase of high quality, good yielding corn seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing, harrowing and purchase of high quality, good yielding corn seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Gelita

texts.en: Gelita is 56 years old and lives in Mohon, Aloran. She is married and has adult age children. Gelita owns and operates a business providing transport to local community members for a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase a slightly used motorcycle. Gelita is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Gelita hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase a slightly used motorcycle

loans.name: Jocil

texts.en: Jocil has signed up her membership with PMPC and availed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time loaner like her. Jocil is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she availed a loan to restock store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to mount a descent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa is 65 years old and married. She lives in Manamong, Aloran. For the past twenty years, Josefa has been a farmer. She earns 3,500 PHP each month and is a new member of PMPC. Josefa is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Judith, 55, a very hardworking and honest farmer based in Kaptich, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. She is happily married, and together with her husband she is blessed with six lovely children.

For the past 10 years, Judith has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, and maize. She also engages in some personal business to supplement her meager income. She passionately loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of her cows. Waking up every day in the morning to milk her cow makes her feel very fulfilled and proud. The biggest challenge she faces is feeding her cows and satisfying the largely unsatisfied milk market, and therefore she is seeking a loan to start zero grazing (stall feeding her dairy cows).

Through the loan, she will be able to build a profitable business enterprise. Zero grazing will allow her make more money in selling milk, and she projects that milk will be selling at 45 KES (Kenyan shillings) per liter and KES 55 for fermented milk. An increase in income means she will be able to comfortably support her large household and secure her children's future.

Judith is also a mobilizer, and she has mobilized other women in her village and formed the “Top juu” self-help group, and together they have undergone training on technical and financial management. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women, she has ignited her keen entrepreneurial spirit.

loans.use: to start zero grazing (stall feeding her dairy cows).

loans.name: Regie Ma.

texts.en: Regie Ma. is a 19-year old high school graduate who lives in E.B. Magalona, Negros Occidental. He belongs to a family of 7. His father works as a farm laborer and his mother is a housewife. Regie Ma. is the 2nd child in the family. He has 1 older brother and 3 younger siblings who are still studying. The family's total monthly income of P8,400 ($183) is not enough to provide even for the family's basic needs. Regie Ma. needs to earn income that's why he applied in Bagosphere's 2-month training program. Regie wants to improve his communication skills, have a stable job and a high salary. Your generosity in funding his loan will help Regie Ma. have a better life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 38-year-old farmer. She is a mother who is hardworking, humble and responsible. Since she was a girl, she learned to do all of the tasks involved in farming, thanks to her parents' teaching. She is a smallholder farmer based in Kenyenya, Kenya, which is a town near the famous Lake Victoria. Rose and her husband are blessed with a lovely family.

Rose has been a farmer for more than ten years. She keeps poultry for eggs, cows for milk, and grows maize and vegetables for sale. She also engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path. Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Rose is very passionate and optimistic about the future of farming in Kenya.

Rose is seeking a loan to expand her farm. She intends to buy farm implements. This move is quite a big deal for her. With a loan, Rose seeks to continue growing a variety of crops, but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Kenyenya and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will negate the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently.

In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my children.”

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica has been characterized by her neighbours and farming friends as a friendly and charismatic 28-year-old woman. She dedicates herself to tending to the mixed farm that she began 5 years ago. This year, Monica celebrates her 8th year in marriage with Barnaba, the father of her children. To support Barnaba in providing for their family, Monica started farming. Today, her two-acre farm holds two dairy cows, heads of poultry, and a field of maize/corn. Monica is seeking a loan from KIVA lenders to purchase cereal grains. These grains will act as seeds during the planting season, food to Monica’s family, and a commodity for trade. Enterprising farmers usually aggregate cereal produce from local farmers and sell it in lucrative urban markets that offer better prices. This trade helps farmers, like Monica, to roll back cereal profits into the business and use the money to settle part of the high cost of inputs. Monica’s big family lives in a house that isn’t not comfortable for them, so she dreams of buying a big house where they all can live safe and with a better quality of life. You can help this hard worker mother to accomplish all her dreams, a loan will get her a lot closer to that.

loans.use: to buy cereals to use for planting and feeding her family.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Caroline, one of the most hardworking and dedicated women on planet earth. She is based in Kapchesewes, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She is happily married. For the past 10 years she has been engaging in mixed farming and through selling milk and a variety of food crops she has earned a decent income. Like many farmers in her village, she also plants trees on her farm to complement the region's natural forests. Although Caroline makes profits selling her farm produce at the market, the biggest challenge she faces is lack of water to irrigate her farm and water for home consumption. Caroline comes from an area where there is no water connection and she is always forced to walk for a long distance for this “precious commodity”. Because of her age, she faces challenges carrying water on her back.

Caroline is seeking a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes. Most of the farmers in Kenya depend on rain fed agriculture but Caroline wants to change that notion and start irrigation farming. Through the loan she intends to harvest rain water which always goes to waste and store it in the tanks. She intends to buy pipes that will be used to pump water from the river directly to her farm. With your loan Caroline will be saved the trouble of walking a long distance in search of water and she will have enough water for home consumption. Irrigating her farm will boast productivity since water is an important requirement in the germination of crops. Caroline is very excited about this project and hopes her dream will be achieved through the loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders. Increased productivity means increased income and this will translate to improved living standards. She will use the additional income to improve and secure the future of her children. Caroline’s hope for the future is to live a fulfilling life.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank to store rain water and water pipes and pump

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Meet Hellen who is a smallholder farmer and lives in the remote village of Meswo in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya, where she has been practicing farming for the past ten years. She is committed, honest, responsible, and works really hard to see her farming business become successful. Nandi Hills has good weather patterns that favor crop and dairy farming. Hellen has defied the common thinking about most Kenyans that agriculture is for the large scale farmers only. Hellen is happily married and together with her husband they are blessed with four children. Her primary source of income is milk and also she plants vegetables in her farm. Hellen practices agriculture with a difference employing youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge from the many agricultural training he has been attending to broaden her skills. Although she earns handsome profits from farming she faces one big challenge and that is high prices in fertilizers, seedlings and inputs and this is a result of the monopoly that is enjoyed by the only agro vet shop in her area.

She is requesting a loan to start an agro vet shop. Meswo area has only one agro dealer who is catering for thousands of smallholder farmers who solely depend on him for agricultural inputs. The agro dealer has been making a killing from farmers by charging them extra amounts since she is the only agro dealer and enjoys monopoly. Hellen wants to change this and seize the business opportunity and through your loan she will start an agro vet shop and tap into the potential agricultural market. Hellen will also help the smallholder farmers in her area who for a long time have been having a serious problem accessing affordable farm inputs. Through your loan Hellen will change from the peasant farmer she is right now to a certified agro dealer who will be depended on by nearly 9000 smallholder farmers in her area both for input, knowledge and information about improved inputs. Through increased income from the loan she will improve her living conditions and her future plans are to purchase a truck which will be used to engage farmers in output marketing activities. Hellen's dream is to provide a secure future for her children through paying tuition fees for them. Through your loan you will help him realize her dream. You can be part of Hellen's dream - make a loan!

loans.use: To start an agro vet

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Hello! Meet Martha (pictured above) from the Kenyenya area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile. Martha is 49 years old and a proud mother of children whom she really adores and cherishes. Martha is a very hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past five years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming. Martha practices mixed farming. That is, she grows maize and keeps dairy cows, and through these activities she has been able to earn a decent and honest income.  Although Martha has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum. Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm implements and buy seeds so as to expand her horticulture farm. Through the loan, Martha will be assured of a bumper harvest, and this will translate into more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, she will increase her profit margins.  She sees a lot of room for improvement and growth. What is lacking is the capital to drive the positive change. With your loan, Martha will make enough income to take care of her family and other farming expenses. She wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day to give her family a decent living and afford her children proper education.

loans.use: to buy farm implements and expand his horticulture business.

loans.name: Abel Sebastian

texts.es:
ABEL TIENE 47 AÑOS DE EDAD, CASADO CON 02 HIJOS LOS CUALES TRABAJAN EN LIMA,CONOCIDO EN EL MEDIO POR SU LABOR DE CONDUCTOR EN EMPRESA DE DISTRIBUCION. VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD HABITADA POR GENTE AMABLE, DEDICADA A LA AGRICULTURA, COMERCIO Y GANADERIA,CONOCIDA COMO EXCOOPERATIVA CAYALTI, QUE PERTENECE A LA PROVINCIA CHICLAYO, REGIO LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERU.

ABEL SE DEDICA A PRESTAR SERVICIO COMO CONDUCTOR,PARA UNA EMPRESA DE TRANSPORTES, DESDE HACE UN AÑO APROXIMADAMENTE,CON EL CRÉDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA PARA ESTABLECER UN NEGOCIO PROPIO.EL CREDITO A OTORGARLE LE FACILITARA OBTENER UN INGRESO ADICIONAL A SU UNIDAD FAMILIAR..
texts.en:
Abel is 47 years old and married with two children. They work in Lima. He's known for his work as a driver for a distribution company.

He lives in a community known as the Excooperativa Cayalti, in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru. The community is inhabited by friendly people, who work in agriculture, sales, and cattle ranching.

For approximately one year, Abel has been earning a living offering his services as a driver for a transport company.

With this loan he will buy goods to establish a proper business. The granted loan will enable him to make additional income for his household.

loans.use: to buy goods.

loans.name: Hermes

texts.es:
Hermes tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el Caserío de Viza, distrito de Santo Tomás que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Hermes se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 3 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Hermes espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Hermes is 36 years old and living together with his spouse and his two children in their own house made of rustic materials.

They live in Caserio de Viza, in the district of Santo Tomas, which is located in the province of Cutervo, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains in Peru. Life in this district is peaceful. The inhabitants mainly make a living in agriculture, sales and cattle ranching.

Hermes earns a living in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. He has three years of experience in this kind of work and a very good reputation in the area, both personally and professionally.

He will use this loan, once granted, to buy manure and fertilizer to adequately maintain his coffee farm, and also to hire workers for harvest season. This way, Hermes hopes to offer his customers a coffee of better quality, which will have a positive impact on his income and thus improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to adequately maintain his coffee farm.

loans.name: Cristo El Salvador Group

texts.es: La alcancía comunal “Cristo el salvador” está conformada por 5 mujeres responsables con deseos de triunfar en la vida, y en esta nueva etapa del grupo está representada por la Sra. Vilma de 50 años de edad, soltera con 4 hijos los cuales solo 1 aun depende de ella. Tiene como negocio la venta de todo tipo de comidas que ella misma prepara con mucho esmero para su público, es por ello que el préstamo lo utilizara para comprar y renovar los utensilios como ollas, cucharones, platos y cubiertos que necesita para poder atender y vender mejor. Es así como Vilma con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación genera sus propios ingresos para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. Ella tiene pensado más adelante realizar bufets para todo tipo de eventos ya que en eso ella es la mejor. En la foto grupal Vilma se encuentra de pie en medio de sus demás compañeras sentadas.
texts.en: The “Cristo el salvador” communal bank is made up of 5 responsible women who want to get ahead in life. In the new cycle the group is represented by Vilma, who is 50, single and has 4 children, 1 of whom still depends on her. She has a business selling all types of food that she prepares for her customers herself with a lot of hard work. That is why she will use the loan to buy an renew her utensils, such as pots, stirring spoons, plates and cutlery she needs to be able to serve and sell better. This is how  Vilma generates her own income with a lot of hard work and dedication, to offer her son a better quality of life. In future, she plans on doing buffets for all types of events, because she is the best at that. In the group photo, Vilma is standing among the other members, who are seated.

loans.use: to buy utensils for her food business.

loans.name: Mirian Leticia

texts.es:
Mirian es  una joven muy amable, sincera y disciplinada, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de la aldea Nahualá.
Mirian para obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa, se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes,  este negocio  lo tiene ella desde hace 5 años y se ubica en su casa de habitación, Mirian para obtener mejores ingresos trabaja en un centro de recreación, con estos dos ingresos Mirian a pesar de ser muy joven se ha superado.
Mirian con el deseo de brindarles a sus socios un mejor servicio ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para la remodelación de su tienda, con el préstamo comprara  materiales de construcción. Con esta remodelación Mirian espera darle a su tienda un mejor aspecto para llamar más la atención de los clientes.
El gran sueño de Mirian es graduarse en la universidad y seguir ayudando a su familia con los gastos de su casa.
texts.en:
Mirian is a very friendly, sincere and disciplined young woman. Sh is 21 years old, single and lives with her parents and siblings in a community in he town of Nahualá.

In order to obtain her own income and help her parents with the household expenses, Mirian buys and sells grocery items. She has had this business for 5 years and it is located in her home. in order to obtain better income, Mirian works in a recreation center. With these two incomes, Mirian has gotten ahead, despite being very young.

In order to offer her customers a better service, Mirian has decided to ask for a loan to remodel her store. With the loan, she will buy construction materials. With this remodel, Mirian hopes to give her store a better appearance to better get her customers' attention.

Mirian's big dream is to graduate from college and keep helping her family with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to remodel her store.

loans.name: Wily

texts.en:
Wily is 50 years old, married and lives at Calube, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood. The piglets' owners share in profits upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30, depending in their agreement.

With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. Through Pauglam PC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional feed. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband.

Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of feeds.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring for and harvesting crops to earning income as well. Rhoda has supported her husband doing this type of work.

Like a farmer, Rhoda has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the cooperative for her financial needs.

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds she hopes will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding crops. Someday, Rhoda hopes to purchase more rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds for a higher yield.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito tiene 54 años de edad, vive con su conyugey sus hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la Sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Benito se dedica a dar servicios de transporte publico en su taxi, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 15 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la reparacion y mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que se encuentra en mal estado. Con esto Benito espera ofrecer un mejor servicios a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Benito is 54 years old and lives with his spouse and children in a rural zone of Pucará district which is located in Jaén province, Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. The people of this district primarily work in agriculture, animal husbandry and trade.

Benito works providing transportation services to the public in his taxi. His business is located at his home. He has 15 years of experience in the business and has very good personal and work references in the zone. The loan that he is requesting will be used to repair and do maintenance on his vehicle since it is in bad condition. With this, Benito hopes to offer better service to his customers which will allow him to generate more income and, in the end, will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to repair and do maintenance on his vehicle since it is in bad condition.

loans.name: Elanie

texts.en:
Elanie is 33 years old, married and has two school-age children. She is from the village of Calube, Aloran.

In 2004, Elanie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

Elanie is engaged in food vending. She has been operating her business for five years and earns a monthly net income of 3,200 PHP. Elanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes.

Elanie is requesting her ninth loan -- for 8,000 PHP -- which will be used to buy bags of flour, white sugar, cheese, butter, cooking oil and other items.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, white sugar, cheese, butter, cooking oil.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is an entrepreneur operating on a 1.5-acre piece of land in the Kitale region of Kenya. She has been married for five years.

Beatrice keeps dairy cows and poultry, and a variety of other crops. At this point in her life, she is forced to work tirelessly to meet the family's growing needs. For example, her highest annual expense on her children's education alone is over USD $1,000.

To keep providing adequately for her family, she decided to think outside the box and came up with a good business plan with a favorable return on investment. She is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 to buy animal feeds. Her vision is for her dairy animals to produce more milk and hence increase her income. Beatrice is anticipating many milk customers, as there is little competition in the area.

A single loan from you to Beatrice is a big demonstration of your vote of confidence in the future of a great farmer with the strong mental fortitude of putting her family first and overcoming all other obstacles in her way to a better life.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds.

loans.name: Elena Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es una señora con 33 años de edad, tiende dos hijas con 10 y 15 años de edad, luego de quedarse sin empleo por varios meses, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logro montar su propio negocio, una pequeña tienda en el municipio de Fresno.
De allí se generan muy buenos ingresos, los cuales son invertidos en sus dos hijas y el alimento de su hogar.
Se encuentra solicitando préstamo con el fin de abastecer su negocio con productos de la canasta familiar y de aseo personal.
Su mayor sueño es tener casa propia, brindarle a sus hijas un mejor futuro y una mejor estabilidad económica.
La actividad que realiza esta mujer para sobrevivir con los suyos son dignas de aplausos y la hacen merecedora del beneficio de ayuda que solicita.
texts.en:
Patricia is a 33-year-old woman. She has two daughters, ages 10 and 15, and after finding herself without a job for several months, with a lot of effort and dedication she managed to establish her own business, a small store in the municipality of Fresno.

From there, she generates very good income, which is invested in her two daughters and food for the household.

She is asking for a loan with the end of stocking her business with basic pantry items and personal care products.

Her greatest dream is to have her own house, and to offer her daughters a better future and better economic stability.

The work that this woman does to survive with her loved ones is worthy of praise and makes her merit the benefit of the help she requests.

loans.use: to stock his business with basic pantry items and personal care products.

loans.name: Leticia Del Rosario

texts.es: Leticia es una comerciante de 65 años de edad que reside en Cartagena de Indias un municipio del departamento de Bolívar muy conocido por su historia asociada a numerosos ataques de piratas provenientes de Europa, que encontraron en esta ciudad un lugar adecuado para saquear en la época colonial; lo que la hizo convertirse en la ciudad más reforzada de América del sur y en la actualidad mantiene su arquitectura colonial que es uno de sus atractivos turísticos. Al atravesar una dura crisis de salud, dejó su empleo y emprendió su propio negocio de venta de mercancías varias con la que durante 23 años ha ofrecido bienestar a su familia al ser madre cabeza de hogar responsable de ocho hijos; diariamente promueve ventas a sus conocidos, familiares y amigos de artículos para el hogar como sábanas, edredones, almohadas, cortinas y también ofrece prendas de vestir y calzado para toda la familia.  Como su capital es insuficiente para la cantidad de pedidos que le han realizado sus clientes, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en tendidos de cama, cubrelechos, almohadas y cortinas.  Esta inversión será de mucho valor para su negocio al permitirle cubrir la demanda de clientes desatendidos a causa de su escases de capital. Su meta a futuro es fortalecer su gama y variedad de productos. Su meta familiar es realizarle adecuaciones a su vivienda que actualmente no tiene acabados.
texts.en:
Leticia is a 65-year-old business woman who lives in Cartagena de Indias, a municipality in the department of Bolívar, well-known for its history associated with numerous pirate attacks from Europe, who found in this city a suitable place to sack during the colonial era, which made it become the most fortified city in South America and currently it maintains its colonial architecture which is one of its tourist attractions.

After coming through a difficult health situation, she left her work and opened her own business selling a variety of merchandise with which for 23 years she has offered well-being to her family being the female head of household responsible for eight children. Daily, she promotes sales of household items such as sheets, bedspreads, pillows and curtains to her acquaintances, family members and friends and she also sells clothing and shoes for the whole family. Since her capital is insufficient for the amount of orders her customers have made, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the intermediary of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in bedding, quilts, pillows and curtains. This investment will be of great value for her business allowing her to meet her customers' demand without regard to her lack of capital. Her goal for the future is to strengthen the range and variety of her products. Her family goal is to make some changes to her house which currently doesn't have finishing touches.

loans.use: to invest in bedding, quilts, pillows and curtains.

loans.name: Maa Samalei Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Panchali lives with her husband and infant in Titlagarh, in rural Odisha. She is standing in the middle of the photograph. She is a daily wage labourer who manages the household expenses with her household monthly income of INR 8,500. She has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity.

Panchali's family is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Joining hands with two others whose families all face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, Panchali has formed a group and is hoping to address this issue.

Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, her family is at risk of infection and falls ill often. The women and daughters are exposed to the additional risk of molestation.

So, taking advantage of the awareness initiatives and opportunities offered, the group now seeks a loan of 45,000 INR to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help these three hardworking rural Indian families to access basic sanitation, and consequently, safety, improved health, medical savings and improved productivity.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Maa Samalei Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Rebati, 35, standing to the right, is  from Titlagarh, in rural Odisha. She has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Rebati, her husband and her three children are among the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Joining hands with two others whose families also face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, Rebati has formed a group and is hoping to address this issue. 

Without access to toilets, their families walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. This puts them at risk of infection, molestation or attack, and even insect or animal bites.

With toilets in their homes, they will be able to lead healthier lives and save the time they spent on walking long distances to relieve themselves. They seek a loan of 45,000 INR to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: to build toilets

loans.name: Maa Saraswati Shg A-1 Group

texts.en:
Mohini, 38, standing in the middle in the photograph, is from Titlagarh, in rural Odisha. She has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Mohini, her husband and her three children are among the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis.

Joining hands with two others whose families who also face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, Mohini has formed a group and is hoping to address this issue.

Without access to a toilet, their families walk long distances to relieve themselves, which hampers her privacy. This puts them at risk of infection, molestation or attack, and even insect or animal bites.

With toilets in their homes, they will be able to lead healthier lives and save the time they spent on walking long distances to relieve themselves.

They seek a loan of 45,000 INR to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is married and she is mother of three children. Cecilia is the owner of the family house. The house is made of adobe.

Cecilia sells milk and she has been in the dairy business since she was a child.

Cecilia wants to increase her milk production and she needs a loan to buy a milking cow. She hopes you can help her. Cecilia works hard. She is assisted by her husband and she is healthy.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Maa Saraswati Shg A-2 Group

texts.en:
Ahalya, 45, standing on the left, hails from Titlagarh, in rural Odisha. She has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Ahalya, her husband and her two children are among the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis.

Joining hands with two others whose families also face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, Ahalya has formed a group and is hoping to address this issue.

Without access to toilets, their families walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. This puts them at risk of infection, molestation or attack, and even insect or animal bites.

With toilets in their homes, they will be able to lead healthier lives and save the time they spent on walking long distances to relieve themselves. They seek a loan of 45,000 INR to build toilets and install a hand pump in their homes. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: to build a toilet and install a hand pump.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, brick, iron, sand and gravel to make improvements on his house.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a smallholder farmer who lives and works on a small farmland in the Kitale area of Kenya. She makes a living doing dairy and horticultural farming. She enjoys her job as a farmer because it provides food, income, and a livelihood for her family. In the area of Kenya where Naomi operates, there is a huge deficit in terms of access to financial products and services. For years, Naomi has had yields and incomes that are far below what they could be because she can't afford quality agricultural inputs. Juhudi Kilimo partnered with KIVA to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya. Through this partnership, financial services are now available to farmers like Naomi. She is seeking a loan to buy important agricultural inputs ahead of the planting season. These farm inputs include seeds, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides. Your loan will enable her to improve her production through use of quality farm inputs. This intervention will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, generate more income to repay the loan debt and elevate the quality of life for her family.
Her greatest dream is to improve the conditions of her home, since it has been many years since it was built and its current state is not the best. You can be part of this dream.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 63 and a very industrious, honest, and hardworking mother from the Kenyenya area of Kenya, near the famous Kisii area known for soap stone carvings.

Jane has been farming for the past 15 years. Over the years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops. Jane is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm.

Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by buying seeds so that she can plant them and sell them after harvesting. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy farm implements such as seeds. Kenya's Kenyenya area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for food. This means that Jane could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there.

She now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with the wonderful Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like him turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Jane believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for food.

She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Jane to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy farm implements such as seeds.

loans.name: Eusilah

texts.en:
Eusilah is a responsible, respectable, hard-working, honorable and honest woman who dedicates her life to raising her children, who mean everything to her. Eusilah is a very hard-working woman who enjoys farming, which she has been doing on her small piece of land for the past 10 years. Through all those years, she has gained much experience and is one of the most respected farmers in her village. Because of the immense knowledge that she has of farming, Eusilah offers extension services to other farmers who are new in the business. Being a caring and loving mum, Eusilah has been able to take care of her family and support them through the profits she has earned from farming.

Eusilah has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is requesting a loan for 25,000 KES, which she will use to start the shop.
Her projections are that, by the end of the first year, she would be able to open another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and husband.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Creselda

texts.en:
Creselda is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family.

Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of animal feed.

Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding more pigs for commercial sale. Someday, she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
In her small but clean mud house Joyce has been able to raise 3 children who give her the determination to keep pushing on even when things get rough.
Thanks to practicing mixed farming Joyce can see a bright future. She passionately loves dairy farming and has nicknames for her cows. Because of her great knowledge of farming, farmers from her village view her as a mentor.
However, the biggest challenge Joyce faces is satisfying the overwhelming demand for milk in her village. She is seeking a 100,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy another dairy cow of good quality. She believes that another cow will enable her to sell more milk, improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children.

Having gone through training with Juhudi Kilimo, Joyce is confident that the skills she acquired will help her increase her business, and she will be able to pay back the loan.
Joyce is very motivated by this plan because it could be the tipping point for a bright future for her family.
You can be part of this dream. Go for it, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy quality breeds of dairy cows.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, who is 39 years old, is a charismatic young woman and a strong example of hard work.

Nancy is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm she keeps cows and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Nancy makes a commission on sales for which she helps arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work.

Given that Nancy can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit. Your loan will help Nancy’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood.

Support her dream by giving Nancy a loan!

loans.use: To buy cereals from farmers to resell.

loans.name: Carren

texts.en:
Carren is from the Kericho area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile. She is 28 years old and a proud mother of three children whom she really adores and cherishes. Other than doing some small business, Carren is a very hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past five years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming. Carren practices mixed farming and through these activities she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. She really enjoys taking care of her cows. Although Carren has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum.

Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm implements and buy seeds so as to expand her horticulture farm. Through the loan, Carren will be assured of a bumper harvest, and this will translate into more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, she will increase her profit margins. What is lacking is the capital to drive the positive change. With your loan, Carren will make enough income to take care of her family and other farming expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm implements and expand her horticulture business.

loans.name: Kwibuka Group

texts.fr: Grâce au crédit lui octroyer dernièrement, Jules a réalisé un certain gain qui a concouru à la prise en charge des frais scolaires de ses enfants, les soins médicaux et l'achat d'une vache. Il s'est constitué une petite épargne et en a profité pour agrandir tant soit peu son activité. Il sollicite un autre crédit pour entretenir son champ et par la même occasion y attendre de résultats positifs.
texts.en: Thanks to the loan he has received, Jules has made a profit which has allowed him to pay for his children's school fees, medical care and the acquisition of a cow. He now has a small amount of savings and will be using it to grow his business. He is requesting a further loan to maintain his field and hopes to attain similar positive results.

loans.use: to maintain one coffee field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: yo buy cereals from farmers to resell.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is 37 years of age, and very passionate and diligent about farming. Having done mixed farming for the past eight years, she has gained much experience and offers free extension services to young upcoming farmers. Kipkoibon is a remote village in Nandihills area of Kenya where people live in shanties made from whatever materials they can find, usually sheets of corrugated tin. But within the remote village of Kipkoibon Evaline is working hard to pull herself out of the dismal conditions. Most small-holder farmers view Evaline as a role model and a mentor because of the resilience that she has despite personal challenges, and her passion to support her four children as a primary caregiver.

Evaline started farming in 2007 after the country suffered post-election violence. With the unstinting support of her husband, who dedicated his 2 acres, she has grown the business dramatically. She has acquired numerous income-generating assets, including farm machines. She keeps dairy cattle and grows subsistence and commercial crops, such as maize avacodos and tea. She takes pride in being independent and being involved in a sector that feeds the population.

Evaline is seeking a loan to purchase more land. Her operations are growing consistently, eating up the available space. The money from the investment will be ploughed back into the business, to finance even more growth. The additional income will also enable her to repay the loan, buy food for her family, and pay fees for her four children who are in public schools. Make a $25 loan, and push Evaline's dream closer to reality. Evaline can buy more land and succeed with your help!
Be inspired, and make a loan!

loans.use: to buy more land and expand her farming.

loans.name: Maria Flory

texts.en:
Love for her children is the primary reason for Maria Flory’s perseverance. Wanting to give them a better life in the future, she’s doing her best to enhance her variety store and food vending business. She dreams that all her children will finish schooling because she knows that it’s the first step to their success.

Maria Flory resides in Talisay City, Cebu with her husband Leoncio, a driver, and their five children. She is operating a variety store that sells various commodities like canned goods, repacked spices and condiments, toiletries, snack items, and many others. Once in a while, she also sells cooked viands and snacks to augment her income. The profit from her business covers her family’s daily expenses, but she is problematic about her children’s education. One of her children is studying in college, two are still in elementary level, while the other two are already working and settling their own lives.

She wants to gain more profit so she can better prepare for the educational needs of her youngest children. To improve her business, she is asking for PhP 50,000 loan which she will use to buy more stocks of items to sell. In the long run, she hopes to put up a grocery store with wide selection of supplies.

You’ll be a great blessing in advance. Thanks for your heartfelt generosity and goodness. 

Maria Flory meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally, who, with her partner, has become a very good smallholder farmer. They joined their hands in improving their farm to create financial strength for the home that they share. She is happily married and has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her 7 children, she has been selling eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland.

The Nandi Hills area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She stated that what she like best is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 60,000 KES to buy poultry. Being a woman, she finds that accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry sales to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children. Help this hardworking woman realize her dream!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a 28-year-old rural smallholder livestock farmer in the North Rift region of Kenya. His family's main income source is milk. Edwin aspires to grow and diversify his business in order to uplift his family's living standards.
He is seeking a KES 65,000 loan to buy sheep and farm inputs. By investing in sheep farming, he plans to derive income from selling wool, meat and lambs. He also plans to use high quality farm inputs to ensure the crops on his farm grow healthy and productive.
Through external financing, he hopes his business will move several steps closer to sustainable growth and diversity. His dream is a happy family which can afford to meet its basic human and financial needs

loans.use: to buy sheep and farm inputs

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a farmer and salesperson from Chuka area of Kenya. He practises livestock and crop farming to make a living. After his wife passed on, he was left with the responsibility of raising 3 children. His priority at the moment is taking care of his family and growing his business in order to generate enough income to provide for his family.
Patrick is seeking a loan to aggregates cereal produce from local farmers and sells to his network of buyers at a higher price. Since his experience as a middleman enables him to arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, he prefers to aggregate and stock large volume of cereal produce and sell at once. His business helps local farmers to focus on production, which is the part they are good at, and helps him generate additional income.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Famille  Mulyane Group

texts.fr: Bidugu renouvelle sa demande de crédit pour l'entretien de son espace cultural. Il admet que le précédent lui a été d'une utilité car il ne s'est pas endetté auprès de tierces personnes pour réaliser différents travaux qu'exigeaient son champ et a pu scolariser ses enfants, améliorer son habitat ainsi que la prise en charge des soins médicaux.
texts.en: Bidugu is making a fresh request for a loan so he can maintain his crop-growing land. He admits that the previous had been useful because he is no longer indebted to third parties to carry out different farming roles on his land. Now, he is able to send his children to school, improve his standard of living and also pay for his family's medical care.

loans.use: to maintain their coffee plants.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married mother of three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
