Mbodze is a married woman with four children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

Mbodze has operated a tailoring business for the past five years. She makes women suits and men suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Rwentojo S. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Laudel. He is an Administrator at Rwentojo S. School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Ibanda with 450 students. Rwentojo School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Rwentojo School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Laudel ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Famille Victor Group

texts.fr: Victor a non seulement acheté un champ grâce au crédit précédent mais aussi les revenus générés l'ont aidé dans la prise en charge de sa famille (alimentation, frais scolaires et épargne). Ce nouveau crédit sera pour lui le bienvenu car cela lui facilitera à réaliser plusieurs projets à partir des revenus qui y découleront.
texts.en: Victor was not only able to purchase a plot of land thanks to the previous loan, but he was able, with the income generated from his business, to support his family with their expenses (food, school feeds and savings). This new loan will be most welcome because it will allow him to carry out even more income-generating projects.

loans.use: to maintain their coffee plantation.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is a 32-year-old woman from Calape, Bohol. She is married with three children ages eight, six and four years old. Her husband works hard as a driver while Rachel buys and sells frozen foods. She has been doing this for 10 years to help her husband in their daily expenses. Thus, she is asking a loan to buy more frozen goods like hotdogs, chorizo, and “tocino” (sweetened pork). In the future, Rachel wishes to improve her business to upturn their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy hotdogs, chorizo, and “tocino” (sweetened pork).

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a 32years old single mother with three children. She is a hairdresser who also sells hair cream, wigs and shampoos. She has five years experience in the hairdressing business and operates her hairdressing business at her residence which is a compound house. Her children ages ranges between 15 years and 4 years.

Comfort usually purchase her goods from the main market in Accra and sells them in her shop. She needs the loan to purchase hair creams, wigs and shampoo to sell in her shop and also expand her shop. she will also use the profit from her business to cater for the needs of her three children and also improve on the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase hair creams, wigs and shampoo and expand her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers for his coffee

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es una mujer de 35 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 2 años, y su negocio es la venta de muebles de segunda mano. 
Ella es buena madre, optimista y muy generosa. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘alto lima’ caracterizado por el comercio informal en todas las áreas. 
Elena es morena de baja estatura y vestir tradicional (sombrero manta y pollera. Su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja y con su hijo que aún es un bebe, vive en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de muebles de segunda mano, ella compra muebles usados para acondicionarlos y venderlos a mejor precio, “inicie mi negocio porque trabajé como ayudante de carpintero, entonces compro los muebles y yo misma los arreglo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los muebles rotan continuamente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de muebles usados. Su sueño es abrir una tienda, ella desea comprar muebles usados para acondicionarlos y venderlos a mejor precio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Elena solicita un préstamo para comprar muebles usados para acondicionarlos y venderlos a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Elena, age 35, is married and has a two year old son. Her business is selling second-hand furniture. She is a good mother, optimistic, and very generous. She conducts her business in the 'Alto Lima' area, which is known for its informal trade in all areas. She has a dark complexion and is short. She wears traditional clothing (hat, shawl, and skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymará , and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband, who works, and with her son, who is still a baby. She lives in a brick house owned by the family, and they have all of the basic services.

Her business is selling second-hand furniture. She buys used furniture in order to refurbish it and sell it for a better price. "I started my business because I worked as a carpenter's assistant. Then, I bought furniture and fixed it myself," she says. The advantage of her business is that the furniture turns around continually. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy used furniture.

Her dream is to open a store.

She wishes to buy used furniture to refurbish and to sell for a better price. This is her first loan cycle with the institution is the five years that she has been engaged in this business activity. It is for these reasons that Elena is requesting a loan to buy used furniture to refurbish and to sell for a better price.

loans.use: to buy used furniture to renovate and sell for a better price.

loans.name: Happy Ayllu Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “HAPPY AYLLU”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vilma ella es casada y tiene 52 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su  negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora que por medio de ste negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, pantalones, chompas, polos y blusas.
Los socios que están pegados a la foto grupal pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de sabanas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de productos de belleza.
texts.en:
The members make up the communal bank "Happy Ayllu". This bank is located in the district of Wanchaq, in the province and department of Cusco.
The member is Vilma, she is married, is 52 years old and has two children. The member works selling clothing. She sells pants, blouses and polo shirts. The member is a entrepreneurial and determined woman who wants to provide for her family through her business.
The member is requesting a loan to buy shoes, polo shirts, pants, sweaters and blouses.
The members who are attached to the group photo asked permission to be absent for work reasons.
The other members work in businesses of selling clothing, bed sheets, groceries and beauty products.

loans.use: to buy shoes, polo shirts, pants, sweaters and blouses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plot of land so that she can build her own house, because she is currently living in her aunt's house as a caretaker. In this way, she will be able to start saving her income.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL ES UNA PERSONA MAYOR PENSIONADA, POR SU EDAD NO ESCUCHA BIEN Y TEME SALIR A LA CALLE YA QUE PUEDE SUFRIR ALGÚN ACCIDENTE POR SU FALTA DE AUDICIÓN. EL NECESITA UN APARATO AUDITIVO QUE LE PERMITA ESCUCHAR Y TENER UN NIVEL DE VIDA MEJOR. ES EL ÚNICO SUSTENTO DE SU ESPOSA. DESGRACIADAMENTE LA PENSIÓN NO LE ALCANZA PARA SOLVENTAR ESTE GASTO.
texts.en:
He is a retired person. Due to his age, he does not hear well. He is afraid to go out because he could have an accident due to his hearing loss.

He needs an auditory device that will allow him to hear and to have a better quality of life. He is his wife's only support. Unfortunately, his pension is not enough to cover this expense.

loans.use: to pay for auditory treatment.

loans.name: Kimunyu Memorial School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Ambrose. He is an Administrator at Kimumyu Memorial Primary School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Ibanda with 480 students. Kimunyu Memorial School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kimunyu Memorial School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Ambrose ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
La socia Agripina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa,la socia es una persona muy trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar chompas, polos,blusas,pantalones y casacas. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Asociación Arariwa member Agripina continues to make a living selling clothes. She is a very hardworking person, who through this business enables her family to get ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy sweaters, polo shirts, blouses, pants and jackets.

She is happy for the loan and promises to meet her payment due dates.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, polo shirts, blouses, pants and jackets.

loans.name: Damiana

texts.en:
Damiana has a wide experience in rice farming. She has mastered all aspects of farming activities, from growing, tending, and harvesting crops to managing earned income. Damiana is able to assist her husband in supporting the family by doing this type of work.  

Just as she nurtures her farm, Damiana has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows that she can always turn to the Cooperative to help meet her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan in order to purchase superior rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.  

Damiana hopes someday to purchase another piece of land on which to cultivate rice, so that she can bring in more income to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase superior rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Ramón Jesús

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América, en este lugar se reúnen cada 15 días el  Grupo De Crédito Los Radicales.
En este lugar vive el señor Ramón, tiene 19 años de edad, está soltero y vive en casa de sus padres, este es su segundo ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le agrada porque gracias a los créditos él puede salir adelante su negocio el cual le permite ganarse la vida. 
Don Ramón es un joven muy trabajador que le gusta a base de esfuerzo y trabajo salir adelante y así irse forjando un mejor porvenir para cuando le toque forma sus familia, el se  dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y sale casi todos los días a recorrer la ciudad por donde tienen sus clientes, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, esto le ha permitido ir aumentando su clientela.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas y otras prendas. Sus sueños es tener un carro para salir a vender.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered to be the most important, popular and visited spa of Ecuador because of its beautiful and inviting beaches. It is the first deep water port of Ecuador and South America.

The Los Radicales group meets in this place every 15 days. Ramón, age 19, lives here. He is single, and he lives in his parents' house. This is his second cycle in the group. He is pleased because, thanks to the loans, he is able to get his business ahead, which allows him to earn a living.

Ramón is a hard-working young man who likes to get ahead from his effort and his work. This way he is forging a better future for when he has a family.

He devotes himself to commerce by selling all types of clothes. He makes his sales door to door. He goes out almost every day to travel around the city where he has his customers. He sells on credit and collects every eight days. This has allowed him to increase his clientele.

This loan is to buy pants, T-shirts, blouses, and other garments.

His dream is to have a car to use to go out and sell.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, blouses, and other garments.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables to sell, such as tomatoes, peppers, onions and others.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Myrna has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Myrna wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is engaged in running a fish vending business. She has been operating her business for 7 years and earns a monthly net income of 5,000 PHP. Milagros is 44 years old, married and has school-aged kids. She is from the village of Larena, Siquijor. In 2004, Milagros joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. MIlagros has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Milagros is requesting her 12th loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used  for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more kilos of fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of fish to sell.

loans.name: Welma

texts.en: Welma is 54 years old residing at Polangyuta, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is married and blessed only with 1 child who is of adult age. She joined PMPC on April 17, 2009 in order to access the programs and services of the said coop. Recently, she's accessing her 2nd loan in the amount of PHP 12,000 for additional working capital of her existing business to buy variety of commodities which is selling a variety of food products in the local community.

loans.use: to buy variety of commodities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her horticultural farm.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a buko juice (coconut water) manufacturer, retailer, and wholesaler in Pagadian City in Zamboanga del Sur. She has customers throughout the area, and she reports that demand is increasing.

She receives financial assistance from Paglaum MPC, where she is a MIGS member. Recently, she requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 in order to purchase synthetic plastic containers for the production of buko juice.

loans.use: to purchase synthetic plastic containers for the production of buko juice

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, age 56, is a baker. She owns and operates a bakery in her home in Pagadian City in Zamboanga del Sur, where she lives with her husband. She reports that she is earning good profits from her business. 

Nenita is in need of additional capital for her business, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum MPC in the amount of PhP 40,000. She will use her loan funds to purchase bakery items such as sugar, margarine, butter, cheese, milk, shortening, leavening, and bags of flour.

loans.use: to purchase bakery items such as sugar, margarine, butter, cheese, milk, shortening, leavening, and bags of flour

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is getting ready for the next cropping season. She wants to to be well-prepared, especially in terms of doing much-needed land and seedbed preparations. Her goal is to have enough of a supply of corn fertilizer to raise her yield. To assure that this goal is met, she applied for a loan from the Cooperative. 

Filomena hopes to save enough money to ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer to raise her yield

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Romie Fe

texts.en: Romie Fe is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired to support for her family. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meatshop in nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is a strong willed woman who will do anything for her family. She is 62 years old, married and lives in Kiamandagan, Lazi, Siquijor. She operates a hog raising business which is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC that gives her quarterly income of approximately PHP 4,500.00 that sufficiently provides the needs of her family. Recently, she avails another loan to buy heads of piglets & purchase bags of animal feeds.

loans.use: to buy heads of piglets & purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Silveriana

texts.en: Silveriana has mastered her hog raising business in Kinamandagan, Lazi, Siquijor. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail of credit to fully support her business. Just as how she takes care her hog raising business and so with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always run for any financing needs. Now, the loan of Php 5,000 will help her build a concrete pig pens that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to buy materials in building a concrete pig pens

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Rosalina has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Rosalina wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio is a pensioner. He is a member of Paglaum MPC, and he is glad to enjoy the benefits of membership. He has availed various loan products, whether for personal use or for business capitalization purposes. 

Recently, he requested a loan in the amount of PhP 50,000 to pay for a medical check-up and to purchase maintenance prescription medicines.

loans.use: to pay for a medical check-up and to purchase maintenance prescription medicines

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita has signed up her membership with PMPC and availed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time loaner like her. Anecita is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she availed a loan to restock store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to mount a descent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a smallholder farmer and lives in the Siongiroi area of Kenya, where she has been practicing farming for the past ten years. At her age that is not that common, but she knows that it doesn’t come with an age limit. She is committed, honest, responsible, and works really hard to see her farming business become successful. Siongiroi has good weather patterns that favor crop and dairy farming.

Catherine is a very hardworking woman who enjoys farming. Through all the years she has been farming, she has gained much experience and is one of the most respected farmers in her village. Because of the immense knowledge that she has of farming, Catherine offers extension services to other farmers who are new in the business. Being a caring and loving mother, Catherine has been able to take care of her family and support them through the profits she has earned from farming.

Although Catherine reaps much profit from farming, one challenge that she is facing is lack of enough land to farm. For this reason, Catherine is seeking a loan of KES 60,000 to be able to buy a piece of land and expand her farming activities. Having so much experience in farming, Catherine is sure that she will make good use of the land and double her profit levels. Through the profits, she would be able to repay the loan and improve her living conditions.

Catherine is sure that if you invest in her, she will be able to realize her dream of having a good quality life and securing her children's future. Catherine has gone through the repayment schedule and amount and is comfortable with the plan.
Support the project of an enterprising Kenyan woman!

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a young farmer from Mosop a remote village in Kapsowar Kenya who has defied the common thinking about most Kenyans that agriculture is for the older generation. Rose is happily married and together with her husband they are blessed with four children. Her primary source of income is milk and also she plants maize on her farm.

Although she earns handsome profits from farming she faces one big challenge and that is high prices in fertilizers, seedlings and inputs and this is a result of the monopoly that is enjoyed by the only agro vet shop in her area. She is requesting a loan to start an agro vet shop. Mosop area has only one agro dealer who is catering for thousands of smallholder farmers who solely depend on him for agricultural inputs. The agro dealer has been making a big profit from farmers by charging them extra amounts since he is the only agro dealer and enjoys monopoly.

Rose wants to change this and seize the business opportunity and through your loan she will start an agro vet shop and tap into the potential agricultural market. Rose will also help the smallholder farmers in his area who for a long time have been having a serious problem accessing affordable farm inputs. Through your loan Rose will change from the peasant farmer she is right now, to a certified agro dealer who will be depended on by nearly one thousand smallholder farmers in her area both for input, knowledge and information about improved inputs. Through increased income from the loan she will improve her living conditions and her future plans are to purchase a truck which will be used to engage farmers in output marketing activities. Rose believes that there is no doubt that youths like her can find rewarding employment in farming.
You can be part of this dream. Go for it, make a loan.

loans.use: to start an agro vet shop.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: Vanna’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Vanna makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La señora Guillermina es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, tiene 55 años, vive con su esposo y también con su hijo quien ya es mayor y al que pudieron criar con su trabajo.
Hace más de 20 años se dedica a los trabajos de peluquería y manicura, al principio lo realizaba domicilio, luego fue juntando un capital y gracias al mismo pudo construir en su propia casa su peluquería.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para poder surtir su peluquería, como ser tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues y otros. Está contenta por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Guillermina is from the city of Ybycui. She is 55 years old, lives with her husband and also their son who is an adult and who she could bring to work.

For more than twenty years, she has been dedicated to the work of a hair stylist and manicurist. At first, she performed her work at home. Then she put together some capital and, thanks to this, was able to build a salon in her own house.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies to be able to stock her salon, such as dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses, and other items. She is happy for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to improve her living conditions and that of her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy supplies for dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses and other items.

loans.name: Mutiara Group

texts.en:
Several months passed and the Mutiara group was able to pay off the last loan on time. In the journey of its business, the group members are progressing quite rapidly. They can raise pigs in a good way so that they gets a satisfactory result.

After calculated and evaluated the last period, the Mutiara group decides to continue their loan. The loans use for increasing their pig businesses by purchase new piglets or quality feed. The group received the same loan amount, each of them get 2.500.000 IDR.
Ni Nengah use her loan to purchase 2 super quality piglets for fattening. With her own money, she purchased feed and renovate the cage. She plan to sell the pigs near the holiday to gets good price. She hopes her plan runs well. She and the Mutiara group still need advice and loan support for their business until they ready and have enough capital to continue the business by themselves.

loans.use: to purchase 2 super quality piglets

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia landed at a right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business failed. PMPC came as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she availed another loan for the next cropping season. She loaned an amount for land and seedbed preparation. Cecilia perseveres and always believe to reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Annabelle is a businesswoman from Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 39 years old, married and has the expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Annabelle is a full fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied a loan to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Annabelle continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

location.town: Sindangan - Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Anelia

texts.en: Anelia signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Anelia is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

location.town: Sindangan - Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida is 55 years old residing at Piao, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and blessed only with 1 child who is of adult age. She joined PMPC on April 17, 2006 in order to access the programs and services of the said coop. Recently, she's accessing her 16th loan in the amount of PHP 8,000 for additional working capital of her existing business to buy variety of commodities which is selling a variety of food products in the local community.

loans.use: to buy variety of commodities

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en: Gilda learned Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Lagag, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to jump start her corn production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Gilda feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money she used to her business. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Gilda wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

location.town: SINDANGAN - LAGAG, SINDANGAN, ZAMBOANGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Jergen

texts.en: Jergen manages a computer shop in her house. She started with two computer units and has gradually expanded to thirty-one units. As she recalls, she says that everything has been made possible due to the financial assistance extended to her by Paglaum MPC. Jergen is now asking for a loan to buy additional computer units.

loans.use: to buy additional computer units

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a gasoline retailer in a remote barangay in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is supported by his loans from Paglaum MPC. In need of additional capital, he asks for a loan to buy gallons of gasoline for retail.

loans.use: to buy gallons of gasoline for retail

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Grace is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is 44 years old residing at Oroquieta City, Mis.Occ. She is married and blessed with school age children. She joined PMPC on April 17, 2006 in order to access the programs and services of the coop. Recently, she's accessing her 9th loan in the amount of PHP 3,000 for additional working capital of her existing business to buy a variety of commodities so she can sell a variety of food products in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is an active member of Paglaum MPC's microfinance program. She was given the chance to venture into business, and she choose to retail various merchandise commonly used in a simple household.

She finds managing this business easy because she has increasing demand for various goods. To respond to the demand, she asks the cooperative for an amount for her business expansion. The amount shall be used to restock her store with merchandise goods such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, detergents, shampoo, soap and others.

loans.use: to restock her store with merchandise goods such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, detergents, shampoo, soap and others.

loans.name: Yoniefe

texts.en: Yoniefe finds pleasure in doing her hog raising business activities. Not only that she is doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 53 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits to the cooperative her capital in supporting her hog raising business activities. Recently, she applied a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins. In the future, Yoniefe wishes to become the supplier of pork in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, who is 53 years old, is a charismatic young woman and a strong example of hard work.

She is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm she keeps goats and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Mary makes a commission on sales for which she helps arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work.

Given that Mary can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit. Your loan will help Mary’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood.

Support her dream by giving Mary a loan!

loans.use: To buy cereals from farmers to resell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 38 years old and has three children. She resides in Chuka, Kenya. She has been practicing farming for 10 years on her small plot, where she does dairy and crop farming. Juliet enjoys farming very much, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide them with their basic needs.

Juliet has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is requesting a loan for 50,000 KES, which she will use to start the shop. With the loan, Juliet will be able to improve her income level and to take care of her family.

Her projections are that, by the end of the first year, she would be able to open another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and husband

loans.use: To start a cereal selling shop

loans.name: Toàn

texts.en:
Toàn is 55 years old and he is married with 2 children.
Mr. Toàn has had a retail business selling dry food and general things for 3 years.
Toàn lives in Dong Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
His family is a low income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is not high enough to do what he really needs to comfort his life.
The main hardship that Toàn faces is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build a new toilet and bath-room.
This is Toàn first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. He hopes that this loan could make his little dream come true.
In the future, Toàn hopes for his business to do well, for his family to be healthy and happy, and for his children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build a new toilet and bath-room.

loans.name: Buntheng

texts.en:
Buntheng, age 26, is an experienced and industrious farmer from the district of Phnum Sruoch in the province of Kampong Speu. By operating a farming business on a small rice field, she can earn about USD 3.00 per day to support her family's daily needs. She is the lovely mother of two children, both of whom are enrolled in the primary school. 

To accelerate her farming process, Buntheng would like to buy a hand tractor to help her in plowing her farmland. She cannot afford this purchase. Due to this shortage of money, she would like to request a Kiva loan, since it has a low interest rate.  

She offers her thanks to all her Kiva lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy a hand tractor to help her in plowing her farmlan

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
Chita hails from the town of Sierra Bullones, Bohol. She is 66-year-old married woman with three grown children. She has been operating a sari-sari(variety) store for for 20 years now. She sells items like biscuits, coffee, powdered milk, seasonings, candies, canned goods and soft drinks.

She is in need of capital to support her on-going business. She decided to avail a loan to buy stocks like beverages, seasonings, toiletries and feeds. These will keep the content of her store full and enables her to improve her earnings. She could now start to expand and manage her finances.

She aims to have higher capital in order to open up another store.

loans.use: to buy stocks like beverages, seasonings, toiletries and feeds for her store.

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana is 52 years old. She is married and is from Gusa, Calatunan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She cultivates her own land and started growing various vegetables upon having capital from Paglaum MPC.

She never gets tired of cultivating and tilling her land and selling her crops to her local market.

This is the time that she is on her way to the next planting season. She asks for a loan from the cooperative to purchase bags of fertilizers and high yielding vegetable seeds.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and high yielding vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is juggling managing her retailing store and constructing her house. She is glad that she receives support from Paglaum MPC, whether it is for her business or housing needs.

Currently, she asks for a loan to purchase bags of cement for the finishing touch of her house.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement for the finishing touch of her house.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Annabelle has signed up her membership with PMPC and availed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time loaner like her. Annabelle is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she availed a loan to restock the store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to mount a descent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock the store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma, 38, is married with three school-age children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 2 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already availed loans previously to purchase for additional stocks and now she is re-applying a loan for her store

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en: Lanie is 30 years old, married with 2 school age children. She owns and runs a rice milling business in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. Last August 30, 2007, Lanie with her husband decided to sign up for membership to Paglaum MPC and access all its services offered to members. Recently, she avails a loan to buy bulks of "palay" (rice grains) for milling.

loans.use: to buy bulks of "palay" (rice grains) for milling

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma has been providing motor transport in her locality for almost 20 years, with her husband as one of the drivers. She is making good proceeds and earns approximately PHP 1,200 in income per day.

She asks for a loan from PMPC to purchase oil, sprockets and labor for maintenance.

loans.use: to purchase oil, sprockets and labor for maintenance.

loans.name: Nesil

texts.en: Nesil is a businesswoman in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. She is known for her palay buying and rice trading business. She also owns and operates a rice milling business. She is making good proceeds through this type of business. Nesil said that everything was made possible because of the supports that Paglaum MPC had extended to her. Recently, she avails a loan to purchase more palay (rice grains) for rice milling and grains production.

loans.use: to purchase more palay (rice grains) for rice milling and grains production

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is a 38-year-old single mother with one child of school age. She runs and manage a sari-sari (convenience store) in Migcanaway, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Mildred is making enough good fortune in her business that she has been able to venture into another business, providing local transport. Mildred is asking for a loan from Paglaum MPC, where she is an active member, for her store expansion. The loan shall be used to restock her store with consumable items such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee, milk and others.

loans.use: to restock her store with consumable items such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee, milk and others.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en: Zosima, 29 years old, is married and has a school-aged child. She and her husband manage a piggery business in Maloro, Tangub City, Mismais Occidental. Zosima is making good fortune from this type of business, which she has gradually expanded. Zosima has asked for a loan from Paglaum MPC as she needs additional capital to buy more heads of piglets and bags of animal feed and vitamins.

loans.use: to buy additional heads of piglets and bags of animal feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 28-year-old woman with one child and with her whole life ahead of her. Catherine farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kitale, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. For the past 10 years she has been involved in mixed farming and her main source of income has been growing maize, vegetables and tomatoes.

Although she has made profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with the challenge of timely delivery of produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up; “I have to do something for my family,“ she said. Catherine mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that helps aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike.

Catherine is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to market has been a challenge, which is why she has suffered so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price and through this loan Catherine is going to achieve her dream and goals.

The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Catherine will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market and also, she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. She is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, she will improve her living conditions and assure her family of a secure future.
Make a loan now and be part of her dreams.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for fast transport of her farm products to market

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 55-year-old shosho (grand-mother) who is so humble, honest and a very hardworking granny on this planet Earth. Mary has a lovely family that she really adores very much.

Mary never had the opportunity to advance her education but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life. Mary started farming and has been doing farming for the past six years. Throughout those years, she has gathered much experience and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips. Mary practices mixed farming on her farm and through the profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs and give her children a good education because she believes that education is the only “key to success”.

She is seeking a loan of KES 100,000 to buy seeds and start horticulture farming on her farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Mary wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits.

Mary hopes that through the loan, she will improve her living conditions. Mary's dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year, she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this, she will be able to assure her children and grandchildren a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time. She will employ people to work for her on her horticulture farm, hence having an impact on society.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn is a 42-year old college undergraduate who lives in Silay City. She is married to Ruben who has a small business which is fish fence. They have a 5-year old child. Their total monthly family income is only Php9,000.00 ($196). Emelyn wants to help her husband but didn't have the means until she learned about the 2-month training program of Bagosphere that could lead to a call center job. Now that she has passed Bagosphere's selection process, she needs your help to finance her tuition. Emelyn dreams to have an adequate income and to become successful in her career. Once Emelyn starts earning, she can provide for her family's basic needs and then save some money for her child's education. Your assistance in funding her loan will help Emelyn reach her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Sarith's Group

texts.en:
Sarith is aged 47 years and a married father of three children, one of his children is in school while another two are two small for school. He and his wife earn a living through raising chickens and sometimes working as a paid worker in his village to earn additional income for supporting his family. Having been in this business for 12 years, Sarith can manage to earn about 40,000KHR per day.

Sarith’s group consists of two male members who live in the same village. And this is the second loan for him with VisionFund. Now he is leading his new group to access a loan. As the leader, he will use his portion to buy more chickens and chicken feeds for nourishing them. He hopes to grow to earn a large income from his business so as to improve his family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and chicken feeds for nourishing them

loans.name: Kimchai's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Battambang province’s Sangke district, Kimchai is a 31-year-old married mother of four children. She and her husband have earned a living through raising children and working for others for a fee for 7 years. The current business earns her about KHR 30,000 per day and she manages to save about 12,000KHR each day for the future needs. 
This is group loan for Kimchai’s group with VisionFund and she is the fourth cycled client. The past loans have helped Kimchai to better support her family and increase the business. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Kimchai, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy more chickens to raise and use some portion of it to spend on chicken feeds. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more chicken feeds and more chickens to raise

loans.name: Chantey's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Chantey is aged 37 years and married. She has four children, who are all dependents and in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for 17 years and they supplement family’s income by working for other for a fee. The current business earns them about 50,000KHR per day and manages them to save about 25,000KHR each day for the future needs. 
This is the second micro loan for Chantey with VisionFund. She completely repaid the past first loan, which has helped her make her living better. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy materials for renovating her old house such as zincs, woods etc. She hopes to have a decent house for living.

loans.use: to buy materials for renovating her old house

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 32-year-old, married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living. 

So, Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas).  Mohammad family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes.  Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Saron

texts.en:
Saron, 40, lives in Phnum Sruoch District, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has two unmarried children and one married child. To make a living, she works as a farmer in small rice field which was located near her house. So far, it is more than ten years that she has been involved in this farming business which can earn net profit of USD 5 per day.

Because her farm land is so small, it provides little income. For more profit, Saron wants to buy more farm land to operate her farming business. Now she is borrowing a loan from HKL to pay for farm land. She would like to thank lenders for their financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy more farm land to operate her farming business.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng is 31 years old, married, and has three children. He is a farmer in Baray district, Kampong Thom Province. His wife is also a farmer on the potato farmland. This couple earns approximately $10 a day.

Heng requested a loan from HKL, which he will use to hire a worker to purify potato grass and transplant rice in his potato field.

loans.use: to hire a worker to purify potato grass and transplant rice

loans.name: Boboshoh

texts.en:
Boboshoh was born in 1973 year. He is married and has 4 children. Boboshoh’s wife is a cleaning-woman. Boboshoh works in a state organization. Boboshoh and his wife always try to offer good living condition for his children. Boboshoh’s children were born in 1994, 1997, 2000, 2004 years.

His second son studies at the university. Boboshoh must pay for university tuition of his son and that’s why he is asking for a loan. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition .

loans.name: Chek

texts.en:
Chek, who is 55 years old, is a farmer who lives in Baray district, Kampong Thom Province. She is a hardworking mother of six children, four of whom are married. Her husband is also a farmer on the potato farmland. This couple can make a net profit of approximately $8 (USD) a day.

During this time, Chek is faced with a financial issue in her family. She needs some money to hire a worker to purify potato grass and transplant rice, but she can’t afford to do this.

After getting to know that HKL provides Kiva loans with a lower interest rate than its normal loan, Chek has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to hire a worker for the potato field. She would like to thank to all lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to hire a worker to purify potato grass and transplant rice.

loans.name: Thêu

texts.en:
Mrs Thêu is 35 years old and she is married.
She has been operating a food stall selling eggs for 4 years.
Thêu lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to comfort her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.
This is Thêu first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.
In the future, Thêu hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine owns and operates a sari-sari(variety) store.  She sold basic house hold commodities like cooking oil, seasonings, soft drinks, powdered soap,biscuits, mosquito repellent and assorted goods.
Aside from running a sari-sari(variety) store,she also engages in food vending business. She sold home meals to the local in her place.
She is married woman with 20-year old son, and still attending school. Her husband is a barangay councilor.
 
She decide to apply for a loan to buy stocks like canned goods, noodles, and supplies like meat, vegetables and seasonings. With the additional capital, Josephine could balance her earnings  and able to settle her finances.
 
In the future, she is doing her best to improve her livelihood to continue support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks like canned goods, noodles, and supplies like meat, vegetables and seasonings

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is a sari-sari store owner. She is a married woman and has two children; her youngest child is 12 years old. Carmelita has been doing this sari-sari store business for 10 years. She is asking for a loan to buy assorted goods such as soft drinks and drinking liquor, food seasoning, noodles, canned goods, chips, biscuits, bread, candies, toiletries, sugar, coffee, powdered milk and chocolate drink. In the future, she wishes to improve his business to have enough money to send her child to college and finish a degree.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and drinking liquor, food seasoning, noodles, canned goods, chips, biscuits, bread, candies, toiletries, sugar, coffee, powdered milk and chocolate drink

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad has started her small time business and became a boss with her sari-sari store. She has manage to have enough inventories and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Everyday she made good sales since she is the only store in their barangay. Recently she approached Paglaum for her much needed capital to restock store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Derlinda

texts.en: Derlinda is 65 years old, married with 4 adult age children. She runs and operates a convenience store and a food stall in their local public terminal. She has been into this business for 16 years and earns enough profit to send all her children to school until they finished college. Recently, she avails a loan to purchase inventories like banana, brown sugar, cassava wrapper, and groceries.

loans.use: to purchase inventories like banana, brown sugar, cassava wrapper, and groceries

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 44 years old, married with 3 adult age children. She runs and operates a bakery located in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. She is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC in her operations. Recently, she avails a loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar, leavening, shortening, cheese, butter, milk, cooking oil and others.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar, leavening, shortening, cheese, butter, milk, cooking oil and others

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Maria Joy

texts.en: Maria Joy, 40 years old, is a strong-willed woman who will do anything for her family. She is married and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Maria Joy operates a hog raising business which is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC. The business gives her a quarterly income of approximately PHP 15,000, which sufficiently provides for her family's needs. Maria Joy recently borrowed another loan to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed

loans.name: Miriam Del Carmen

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América, en este lugar se reúnen cada 15 días el  Grupo De Crédito Los Radicales.
En este lugar vive la señora Miriam, tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, 2 de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Miriam es una mujer muy trabajadora que al ver las grandes necesidades en su hogar opto por dedicarse al comercio ya así poder ayudar en algo con los gastos que genera el hogar, ella vende productos de Yanbal  (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella sale a vender casi todos los  días cuando esta mas desocupada y también vende en su casa, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva más de 10 años en esta actividad la cual le ayuda a salir adelante,. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas entre otros, ella aprovecha los productos de oferta los mismos que luego vende al precio normal y así se gana algo más al vender. Lleva dos ciclos en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y se ayudan entre sí. Sus sueños es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important, most popular and most visited spa in Ecuador due to its beautiful and cozy beaches, the first deep water port of Ecuador and South America. Here, in this place, the Loan Group "Los Radicales" (the Radicals) meets every 15 days.

Miriam lives here. She is 43 years old, married and, from this relationship, she has three adult children. Two of them still live in her house. Her husband is a driver.

Miriam is a very hard working woman who, upon seeing a great need at home, opted to dedicate herself to trade since she could thus help a little with the bills her family generated. She sells products from Yanbal (beauty items, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She goes out and sells almost every day when she is least busy and also sells from her house. She leaves on credit and comes every eight days. She has more than ten years experience with this work which helps her get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics, creams, among other items. She takes advantage of products on sale which she then sells at normal prices and thus earns something more by selling. She has two cycles with the loan group and she likes it because the group is very united and they help each other. Her dreams are to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics, creams, etc.

loans.name: Azezah

texts.en:
Azezeh, age 33, is a conservative women who prefers to have her husband appear in her photo. She earns an income by running a small grocery business, which she established many years ago. She is an admirable and hard-working woman. She and her husband have four children. Her husband assists her in running the grocery.

Azezeh enjoys her business, and she reports that the grocery is thriving and that she is increasing her income. She is an example of a strong person who has the ambition and willpower to succeed.
 
She is applying for a loan in order to buy grocery items as well as candies and soft drinks to sell in her store. 

She dreams of expanding her grocery and to continue to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items as well as candies and soft drinks to sell in her store

loans.name: Mol's Group

texts.en:
Mol is 29 years old and married with three children, two of whom in school while another one is too young for schooling. She lives in a rural village of the Dambae district where crop farming a common way to make a living. Like other villagers, Soybean and cassava growing have been her family’s main source of income for 11 years. 
This is Mol’s third loan with VisionFund and completely paid back the loans. The past loans have helped her family with sufficient food and better support the business. Currently, she can earn about 40,000KHR per day from the business. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her agribusiness. She hopes to grow her soybean and cassava fruitfully and healthily so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her agribusiness

loans.name: Sanh

texts.en:
Sanh, a farmer and also a business man, lives in Taing Khlai village with a child. Sanh gets up early to prepare farming equipment and comes back home late to prepare his charcoal stock to retail to customers. He wants to get up early morning and go late to spend more time on work; however, it is a challenge for him because his house doesn’t have enough energy to generate light.

He has to get up when the sun raises high enough to see thing clearly and go back home early before the road is too dark to go. As a result, he decided to apply for Kiva to buy solar home systems. He believes he will have enough energy for his family usage and also improve his working hours.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system

location.town: Taing Khlai Village, Svay Chirj commune, Samaki Me

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is the age of 35 and a mother of five children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She engages in embroidery to earn an income. She started her embroidery business 10 years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses.

Shazia buys materials such as hand-embroidery kits, ribbon, needles and embroidery machine from market. Another person handles her transactions with her customers. She has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn better profit for her family. She has become an expert in embroidery business. So, Shazia demanded a loan so she will be able to buy raw materials from the market.

Shazia will be thankful to KIVA and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials for business.

loans.name: Chuob's Group

texts.en:
Chuob’s group lives in a rural village in the Kandal province in Cambodia. Chuob makes a living cultivating rice to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: He Muong 12 Group

texts.en:
Mr. Ang is 57 years old and lives with his wife and grown-up son. They live happily in a small old Thai traditional house and mainly rely on agricultural production for a living. Indeed, Mr. Ang, despite being at the advanced age, works very hard at farming and animal husbandry such as cultivating rice, raising buffalo, pig, duck... To provide better for the family, Mr. Ang has continuously expanded production, especially raising pigs because it has brought him good income, especially after he started to join in Anh Chi Em Program and received financial support from the Program.

This is the second time he has taken out a loan from Anh Chi Em and he will use the loan to buy piglets and food for the pigs. He believes that along with the advice and counseling of agricultural worker of the Program, and with his good experience in pig raising, his investment will go well and help him reap good benefit.

Mr. Ang dreams his family will have a more abundant life and his son will have a brighter future. In the picture, he stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets and food for the pigs

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es:
El señor  Cristino tiene 56 años, vive en la ciudad de Itá, es comerciante, se dedica a la compra-venta de animales hace más de 10 años.
Cristino es padre de 5 hijos, todos trabajan y estudian a la vez. El Señor Cristino además de la compra y engorde de animales posee plantación de hortalizas en su propia propiedad. Él es una persona humilde, muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de balanceados para animales y semillas y abonos para la plantación. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo en lo que hace.
texts.en:
Cristino is 56 years old, lives in the city of Itá and is a trader. He has been dedicated to buying and selling animals for more than ten years.

Cristino is father to five children. All work and study at the same time. Cristino, along with buying and fattening animals, owns a vegetable plantation on his own property. He is a humble, very hard working person with a desire to succeed.

He is requesting this loan to buy feed for animals and seeds and fertilizer for his plantation. He is thankful for the opportunity he is receiving to be able to keep growing in what he does.

loans.use: to buy animals, seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma, 55 years old, is a businesswoman from Tudela. She is married and has expertise in selling. Vilma runs a little sari-sari (convenience store), earning a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Vilma is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken out several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Vilma has now applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Vilma continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Zohirjon

texts.en:
Zohirjon is young and hardworking man. He was born in 1997 year. Zohirjon is smart and graduated school with good and excellent marks. Zohirjon always wanted to get higher education. So, this year he has applied to the National University of Tajikistan.

Zohirjon studies at the faculty of Geography. He dreams to be a perfect specialist in future. His parents work in a factory. They have no opportunity to pay for his tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition for a BA in Geography

loans.name: Reyad

texts.en:
Reyad 42 year’s old women live in southern of Jordan. married woman and caring mother of three children, she is working hard to help her husband who is working as a driver with low income.
She is doing home business with old beauty tools trying to improve her technique in beauty business which is required new tools that fit her vision and stay with unique touches.
She applies for a loan to buy all the requirements that needs for her saloon, and to expand and develop it to increase her quality of work to attack more customers.
She will be so thankful if you will help her.

loans.use: To buy new tools and requirements for her salon.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen, age 44, lives with her husband and their seven children in Lahore. She has been very worried about obtaining sufficient money to support her family. Her husband has grown old and does not have the ability to earn the income he could bring in when he was younger, and her eldest son is now grown but has no occupation with which to generate money. Shaheen therefore decided for the sake of the family income that she should purchase a new auto rickshaw, a vehicle she knows is available at a low cost, and give it to her son, who can then earn an income by driving it.

Shaheen has been putting money into savings for a long time in order to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son, and she has requested a loan for the rest of the needed funds so that her son can obtain the vehicle and start his business.
 
She is hopeful that her son will be able to generate some income through this new business and help his family. She is very happy to receive this loan. 

Shaheen offers her thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to provide a source of family income by purchasing a rickshaw for her son

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 44-year-old married woman. She lives with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore. Her husband is a wholesaler of onions; he buys onions from harvesters for a low price and sells them in Lahore city to the greengrocers. He has been doing this business for many years and has many reputable retailers who like to buy onions from him in large quantities. He has built positive relationships with his customers, who speak highly of him.

With an increase in new customers and demand, he wants to buy onions in bulk so that he can easily cope with the rapid increase in demand. He would be able to increase his monthly income and his savings, as well as improve the standard of living for his family.

Nusrat requested a loan for her husband's wholesale business so he can buy sacks of onions from the fields. She is grateful for this opportunity and thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of onions from the field for her husband's wholesale business.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is 45 years old and single. She dedicated her life to saving money to open her beauty salon in the countryside of Jarash, which is considered one of the poorest countryside areas in Jordan.

She has applied for a loan to buy a new hair dryer and new tools for her salon. She wants to expand it so she can follow the new trends in the beauty business.

She will be very thankful if she can get that chance to expand her business and see herself in a new way.

loans.use: to buy a new hair dryer and new tools for her salon.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 37-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children.
Her husband provides whitewash and oil paint services to his customers in the community. Sometimes he has to go out of city also.
He has gotten a new contract for whitewash and oil paint of newly constructed house but he has no paint brush or rollers for providing services.

Abida has requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene oil etc.
His savings are very poor that is why he is unable to buy new tools for providing whitewash services. She wants to change this condition of her family and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her husband.
She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new paint brushes, rollers, distemper and kerosene oil for her husband's whitewash services.

loans.name: Lilik

texts.en:
Mrs. Lilik has a family of two and lives in Kepanjen, a town in Malang Regency in Java, Indonesia's mains island. In Indonesia, you cannot drink tap water, and most people don't even have a tap. For that reason, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water.

Mrs. Lilik learnt about a new way for obtaining drinking water when the sales team from Nazava water filters held a Safe Water training in her village. Nazava Water Filters purify well, rain, and tap water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, this means without using gas or electricity. Mrs. Lilik, who is also a health-worker in her sub district, seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. Mrs. Lilik will use this loan to buy about 35 filters to sell them to her neighbors on credit, making safe drinking water available to 100 people.

loans.use: to buy water filters in order to provide her neighbors with safe drinking water.

loans.name: Adib

texts.en: Adib is a young and kind man from South Tajikistan. Born in 1997, Adib lives with his mother, who is a dressmaker. Adib’s father died some years ago. Adib always wanted to be a higher educated person so, this year after graduating school, he applied to the Polytechnic University of Tajikistan. He is a successful student. Adib reads a lot of books and often goes to the library. He is asking for a loan because his mother earns a low income and doesn't have the money to pay for Adib’s university tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en: Shahnoza is a very smart and hardworking young woman. She is single and lives with her parents. They live together in the southern part of Tajikistan. She graduated from school this year and has applied to the Pedagogical University. Shahnoza dreams to be a good teacher in the future and teach Tajik children. She reads a lot of books. Shahnoza always gets good and excellent marks. Shahnoza is asking for a loan to pay for her university tuition and she awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Yum

texts.en:
Yum, 43 years old, is a farmer who lives in Baray district, Kampong Thom Province. She is a hard-working mother of four children, two married. Her husband is also a farmer on the potato farmland. This couple can make a net profit approximately USD 9 a day.

During this time, Yum is facing with a financial issue in her family. She needs some money to hire workers. After getting to know that HKL provides Kiva loan with the lower interest rate than its normal loan, she has decided to apply for a Kiva loan for them to hire workers in the potato fields. She would like to thank to all lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to hire workers for her potato crop

loans.name: Sarange

texts.en:
Sarange, at the age of 72, is a charismatic and helpful woman who works on her own small farm. She began her farm due to the need to generate income to support her family. In spite of all the obstacles, she had the strength and determination to pick herself up and keep on going. Thanks to this she's been doing farming for the past seven years. She works every day for 10 hours by herself.

Sarange is seeking a loan to construct a dairy shed. This will provide shelter for her favorite animal. Your loan will help Sarange construct a cowshed that will help very much with dairy management. The shelter will enable her to prepare feed rations and feed the cow. The shed will also ensure the cow is always in a clean and hygienic environment.

Your loan will bring untold benefits to Sarange. She is projecting a significant increase in milk production. The extra money will go to loan repayment and her children’s education. Her dream is for her children to live a better life with fulfilled basic needs.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador¡ por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América, en este lugar se reúnen cada 15 días el  Grupo De Crédito Los Radicales.
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 7  y 4 años de edad, ambos estudian en escuela. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.
