Doña Matha es una mujer que le gusta ganarse lo suyo y con esto contribuir con los gastos que demandan el hogar y la crianza de sus pequeños, al ver que a su marido no le alcanza con lo que el gana se decidió a emprender un negocio, ella  vende ropa, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa,  ella sale a recorrer en las mañanas ya que a esta hora es más fresco y sus hijos están en la escuela, al dejar a  sus hijos en la escuela aprovecha para vender a las madres de familia. Lleva más de 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad, la cual le permite ganarse lo suyo.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisas, ropa de niños entre otras prendas que ella vende. Lleva 2 ciclos en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan a financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important, most popular and most visited spa in Ecuador due to its beautiful and cozy beaches and the first deepwater port in Ecuador and in South America. Here, in this place, the loan group "Los Radicales" (The Radicals) meet every 15 days.

Martha lives in this place. She is 26 years old, married and, from this relationship, has two children who are 7 and 4 years old. Both are in school. Her husband is a security guard.

Martha is a woman who likes to earn her own money and, with it, contribute to her family's bills and to raising her children. Upon seeing that her husband was unable to make ends meet with what he earns, she decided to start a business. She sells clothing. Her way of selling is door-to-door and she also sells from her house. She goes out selling in the mornings since it is cooler at this time and her children are in school. Upon dropping off her kids at school, she takes advantage of selling to the other mothers. She has been dedicated to this work for more than two years, which allows her to earn for herself.

This loan is to buy pants, blouses, shirts, children's clothing, among other clothing that she sells. She has been with the loan group for two cycles and she likes it because the loans help her to finance her business. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, children's clothing and other clothing.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
When you look at Esther, she is the true definition of a hard worker. She is a farmer in Nkubu. Esther is involved in maize, poultry, and dairy farming. She engages in milk and egg production for commercial purposes, as opposed to many rural farmers who produce for subsistence. Esther also grows maize for food and sales.

Esther is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to construct a cow shed. This will help significantly in managing the animals’ health and hygiene. She has no plans to quit in the future, as she finds farming to be not only fulfilling, but also lucrative. However, her biggest challenges are the poor road network and the lack of market.

With your loan, Esther will construct a cow shed, which will later come in handy when she scales up and introduces zero-grazing. The long-term impact is an increase in productivity and improved animal health. The additional income from this development will go to her children’s education. Kindly lend to a Kenyan farmer with great dreams!

loans.use: to build a modern dairy shed.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is a 40-year-old woman from Catigbian, Bohol. She is married and has three children ages 12, nine and one months old. She is engaged in basket making (basket waiving) to earn a living while her husband works hard as a mechanic. (Baskets typically used for storage and transport. Some baskets are ceremonial that is religious, in nature.) Thus, Elma is asking a loan to buy rattan (is the name for the roughly 600 species of palms) used in making basket. In the future, she wishes to fully pay her motorcycle to be able to increase their livelihood. Perhaps, this motorcycle can be used in transporting their basket products easily.

loans.use: to buy rattan

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a hardworking woman. She is 37 years old and lives in Wihdat with her four children and her husband, who appears in the photo instead of her because she is a conservative woman.

Muna wants to provide a good life and good education for her children. Muna`s husband has a rare art which is painting on wood by fire. Because Muna is a helpful woman, and she believed that her husband will be known in this field, she decided to help him to achieve his dreams.

Muna took the first loan to help her husband take classes in this field and improve his skills, and then she took an educational loan to pay for her daughter's university fees.

Now Muna is working hard to help her husband improve the standard of living for her family. She is now applying for a loan to buy tools and wood to increase the number of his products so as to increase his income.

loans.use: for a loan to buy tools and wood to increase the number of her husband's products.

loans.name: Sun's Group

texts.en:
Aged 52 years, Sun is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of three children, only one of whom is still dependent on her. Sun has farmed rice for forty-one years and her husband sometimes works for others for a fee. Sun and her husband earn about US $9 per day from their current business and are able to save about US $4 each day for the future. Sun's main business challenge is drought.

This is Sun's third loan with VisionFund. She has used her past loans wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan. Sun will use her portion to buy rice seeds and insecticide for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland to increase her production and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and insecticide for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Erni

texts.en:
Mrs. Erni lives in Donomulyo a subdistrict of Malang Regency on Java, Indonesia's most important Island.

On Java and in Indonesia in general you cannot drink the water from your tap, and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians have to buy water which is expensive or boil water which is a hassle. 

Mrs. Erni heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava Water Filters held a safe-water training in her vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity. 

Mrs Erni started selling water filters to her community members during events in which she also trains her community on household water treatment and safe storage of water. With this loan she can buy 70 water filters and sell them again. 70 filters will provide approximately 350 people with safe drinking water.

loans.use: to buy water filters in order to provide her neighbors with safe drinking water.

loans.name: Serason Indah Group

texts.en:
After undergoing a period of loan, Ni Wayan repaid their loans on time.

Now Ni Wayan has a new activity. Besides as a breeder, she also busied herself with a new business, small kiosk. In this way Ni Wayan has a higher income than before.

Having succeeded in the previous period, the Serason Indah group proceed to the next loan. Based on the assessment of MUK, the group received 21.000.000 IDR for group lending and individual persons got 3.500.000 IDR. Because most have been able to increase the number of pig population, the current loan used to buy food and fix the cage. Ni Wayan use the loan to buy superior feed, build new cages and buy some merchandises for her kiosk. Ni Wayan already has 2 sows. She’s very happy with the effort can be developed. She hopes to become a big pigs seller at her village and all the profits will use to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy superior feed, build new  cages and buy some merchandises for her kiosk

loans.name: Waldemar

texts.es:
Waldemar es un joven hombre de 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 1 año, y su negocio es el servicio funerario.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad caracterizada por el comercio manufacturero en todas las áreas. 
Waldemar es de piel morena, baja estatura y cabello corto. Su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio y con su hijo que está aprendiendo a caminar, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicio básicos. Su negocio es el servicio de funeraria; él se encarga de recoger el difunto en su carro fúnebre y transportarlo hasta su negocio para  maquillarlo y cambiarlo antes del entierro, “prestamos servicios de inhumación y cremación para los fallecidos y servicios funerales como la velación para sus familiares…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que es constante, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de capillas ardientes. Su sueño es tener su propia tienda para dejar de pagar alquiler, él desea comprar capillas ardientes que son instrumentos de iluminación para honrar al fallecido. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Waldemar solicita un préstamo para la compra de capillas ardientes para honrar a los fallecidos.
texts.en:
Waldemar, 31, lives with his partner.  Together they have a one year-old child.  He has a mortuary business.

Waldemar is a good father, and he is enterprising and very hardworking.  His business is located in the southern part of the city.  The city is known for its manufacturing activities.

Waldemar has a dark complexion, short stature, and short hair.  His native language is Guarani, and he also speaks Spanish.  He shares his life with his partner, who works in the same business, and with his son, who is just learning to walk.  They live in a house that is a family property.  It is made of bricks, and has all of the basic utilities.  Waldemar has a mortuary business.  He is in charge of collecting the deceased in his hearse and transporting them to his business so that he can dress them and apply makeup before the burial.  "We provide burial and cremation services for the dead, and funeral services such as wakes for their families,"  he comments.

The advantage of his business is that it is reliable; the disadvantage is that he lacks capital to buy equipment.  His dream is to have his own mortuary facility so that he could stop paying rent.  He wants to buy mobile illuminated funeral chapels, which are used to provide light for wakes that honor the dead.  This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the 8 years he has been working in this business.  

It is for these reasons that Waldemar is requesting a loan to buy mobile illuminated funeral chapels to honor the dead.

loans.use: to buy mobile illuminated funeral chapels to honor the dead

loans.name: Jefreda

texts.en:
Jefreda runs a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells commodities ranging from coffee, sugar, biscuits,candies, lollipops, powdered soap, noodles and assorted canned goods.
She is married with two young dependents ages 8 and 10 year old respectively. She is thirty-four years of age and a resident in the town of Talibon, Bohol. 
Her husband has an income that could help defray the family's daily expenses.

She is asking for a loan to buy stocks like  canned goods, soft drinks, and noodles. These will filled the content of her store and maintain the flow of merchandise. She could continue provide her family with good food and able to finance the schooling of her children.

Jefreda would like to expand her sari-sari (variety) store to a grocery store someday.

loans.use: to buy stocks like  canned goods, soft drinks, and noodles

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Annabelle is a 35-year-old woman from Catigbian, Bohol. She is married with six young children. The oldest child is 13 years old while the youngest child is two years old. Her husband works hard as a carpenter while Annabelle is engaged in various businesses to help her husband in their daily expenses. She does buying and selling personal collection products (such as beauty, fit and trendy products; home care products). She also helps her husband in doing their farming business and she also plan to do hog raising business. Annabelle wishes to improve their business for sustainability. Thus, she is requesting an amount to help her upturn their livelihood. She also plans to buy piglets and feed out from the money she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy personal collection stocks (such as beauty, fit and trendy products; home care products), piglets and feed

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is from Catigbian, Bohol. She is 39 years old woman, married and has two children ages 11 and two years old. Her husband works hard as a construction worker while Angelina is engaged in selling food to earn a living. Aside from this, she is starting up a hog raising business in order to upturn their earnings. Thus, she is asking a loan to buy ingredients for her food selling business such as banana fruit, cassava, cooking oil, sugar and flour. She also buys piglets to raised and feed as well. In the future, she wishes to increase their livelihood to have better means of living.

loans.use: to buy ingredients (banana fruit, cassava, cooking oil, sugar and flour), piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy banana fruit, cooking oil, flour and sugar

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en: Bonifacio is engaged in buying, raising and selling pigs business. He has been doing this for almost 30 years to earn a living. Bonifacio is a married man from Catigbian, Bohol. He is a father of three adult children and two school aged children ages 17 and 13 years old. He works hard to provide their needs. Thus, he is asking a loan to buy pigs to sell and piglets to raised. He also buys feed for his piglets as well.

loans.use: to buy pigs, piglets and feed

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is aged 29 years and married with three children who all live in Bundibugyo, Uganda.

She trades in charcoal, mainly buying and selling to the local people in her area. She gets additional income from selling cocoa and palm oil in the markets. She started the business to raise income for the family and pay school fees for the children, being their only provider.

Her main challenges are high transport costs and taxes levied on charcoal businesses. She hopes to expand the business, educate her children and support the family in getting their basic needs.

Jennifer has asked for a loan to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana has hog raising business in Pari-an, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. This is her primary source of income for her family. Ana makes it a point to have enough inventories of animal feeds and vitamins to have good income. Recently, she needed an amount to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins that she loaned from Paglaum MPC. Ana wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply pork in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en: From Tulapos, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Lanie earns a living through her clothing sales. She sees to have enough inventories to continuously provide for her family. For her capital needs, PMPC stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she applied a loan to purchase more clothing inventories to sell. Lanie hopes to live comfortably with her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing inventories to sell

loans.name: Youn's Group

texts.en:
Youn is aged 37 years and married with two dependent children. She is a farmer who has been growing various kinds of vegetables for 10 years while her husband is working as a construction worker in the village. With the current business, she can earn about 50,000KHR per day to meet family’s needs and is able to save about 20,000KHR each day for the future needs. 
This is Youn’s first loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy supplies for renovating her old house. She hopes that this loan will enable her to have a decent house for her family living in.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as zinc and woods, etc for renovating her old house

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: ٍsahar

texts.en:
A 39-year-old lady helping her husband who works in junk yards with a full time job, Sahar is working hard to help her kids with educational payments and feed them.

Sahar started buying fabrics from wholesalers at the lowest price, then take them back home to redesign them with unique drawings. She is a model of a hard worker, and she doesn’t believe in luck in the business world. Now she is applying for a loan to help her buy more fabric and dyes to sell and increase her income.

She will be happy if she has the chance to buy more so that she can get low prices from the wholesalers.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and dyes to sell and increase her income.

loans.name: Khaldyeh's Group

texts.en:
Sulaiman and Khaldyeh are a senior couple who have four children. They appreciate what life has given them but, with four children to provide for and feed, they need more support to cover all their expenses.

Sulaiman and Khaldyeh started working with carpets. Their vision is to enlarge their business and give their children and people an example of not giving up, no matter your age or life situation. They want to expand and develop their business and buy more products and blankets to sell to increase their income and improve their standard of living. They will be so very happy and thankful if they get the chance to show others and youth what seniors can do.

loans.use: to buy new blankets to sell

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a hard working mother from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She caters manicure and pedicure services to the local in the community where she lives.
She is 47 years old  married woman with two  children. One of her children is still attending school.  She has been engaged in cosmetology services for for than 10 years now.

She has requested a loan to purchase  manicure kit and pay for her child's tuition fee. With these, she could provide quality services and it can increase her purchasing power. She could able to settle her obligation and start to save for the future.

She is doing her best to improve her main source of livelihood to become financially stable in years to come.

loans.use: to purchase  manicure kit and pay for her child's tuition fee

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en: Gregoria is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of their home. Gregoria hopes to live comfortably with a house of good roofing supported by her loan of Php 10,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with good repayment record. Matter that Gregoria has given a priority as a Microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for when all her financing needs on her retailing business where supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for house renovation

loans.name: Potenciana

texts.en: Potenciana heads up for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well especially the much needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer of which she applied a loan from the Cooperative. Potenciana hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn has switched from selling snacks to selling "longganisa" (processed meat). Her business is doing well when she doubles her time perfecting her own "longganisa" recipe. With her husband's help, she has maximized her profits and keep pursuing her goals for the good of her family. Reason why she availed another loan from PMPC, to buy more kilos of meat for her "longganisa" business. Today, Marilyn is able to help others do retailing business on her "longganisa" and they as well earned for their own family.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of meat for her "longganisa" business

loans.name: Velsie

texts.en: Velsie is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired to support for her family. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meatshop in nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en: Isidra was given the opportunity to partake into rearing her family when she was assisted to become an agripreneur. She was empowered by Paglaum MPC through its microfinance program. Now, Isidra actively cultivates her farm and grows various vegetables that supplies their local market. Just this very recently that she asks for a loan to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase high quality seeds & bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase high quality seeds & bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 39 years old. She is known in the Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte area for her sari-sari store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

location.town: Sindangan - Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Ermilinda

texts.en: Ermilinda is a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC for almost 10 years. She and her husband has been tilling their own land for farming activity that primarily provides the needs of her family. Ermilinda found out that their income in farming is insufficient for the family needs especially on times when their eldest child enters college. As a hardworking farmer, she had also nurtures and work hard to repay her loans from the cooperative. One time, she decided to expand her farm and ask for financial support from Paglaum MPC. Ermilinda is grateful of the trust the coop had extended to her and able to buy the neighboring parcel of land. She successfully repaid the loan and this cropping season, she ask for another loan to augment her production. The amount of PHP 3,000.00 is intended to purchase bags of fertilizers and bottles of insecticides. Ermilinda is hopeful that she can have good harvest this season so that she can repay ahead of schedule her loan with the cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and bottles of insecticides

loans.name: Ramona Katherine

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América, en este lugar se reúnen cada 15 días el  Grupo De Crédito Los Radicales.
En este lugar vive la señora Ramona, tiene 28 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 6,  3 y 2 años  de edad, la mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es cocinero en un bar.
Doña Ramona es una ama de casa que le gusta ganarse la vida realizando una labor que le encanta, ella se dedica al comercio, vende productos Belcorp y Yanbal (perfumes, cremas, bisutería, etc.), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa, ella espera utilizar este crédito para comprar ropa y empezar a vender este tipo de prendas pues sus clientes le piden y espera con este nuevo negocio incrementar sus ganancias, deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 1 año dedicada a esta actividad la cual le permite ganar lo suyo y así contribuir con los gastos del hogar.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa,  perfumes, cremas, bisuterías y todo lo que ella vende. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten ir mejorando su vida. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a su  familia.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important, popular and visited spa resort in Ecuador because of its beautiful and welcoming beaches. It is the most important deep water port in Ecuador and South America. This is where the Los Radicales credit group meet every fortnight.

This is also where Ramona lives. She is 28 and is in a common law marriage. She and her partner have three children who are six, three and two. The eldest is in school. Her husband is a cook in a bar.

Ramona is a housewife who loves making a living through doing a job that she loves. She works as a tradeswoman, selling Belcorp and Yanbal products (perfumes, creams, costume jewellery, etc.). She sells door-to-door and she also sells from her home. She hopes to use this loan to buy clothing and start selling the type of garments that her customers are asking for. She also hopes that this new business will increase her earnings. She sells on credit and collects payment every week. She has been doing this for over a year and it has allowed her to earn her own money and contribute to the household costs.

This loan will be used to buy clothing, perfumes, creams, costume jewellery and all the other items that she sells. She has been with this credit group from the start and she likes it because the loans allow her to improve her life. She dreams of giving her family the best.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, creams and costume jewellery, etc.

loans.name: Mohareb

texts.en:
Forty-four-year-old Mohareb is the father of five children, and actually, Mohareb is working very hard to provide a living for his kids. He wants to ensure them a better life and educate them in the best schools.

He is working as a sound engineer with a low income, and because of the high standards of living, he decided to open his own business, which is a hookah shop (shisha), and now he is trying to apply for a loan to buy requirements and products to sell to increase his income and capital, so he can enlarge his business.

He wishes his sound can reach everyone and his business card is in everyone's wallet.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Saing Eng's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Saing Eng is aged 30 years and married with two children; one is too young for school, while another one is in school.

For more than 12 years, she and her husband have been growing cassava and raising pigs. Low crop yields resulting from insect pests are still the main challenge for her business.

Saing Eng has been a member of VisionFund for three loan cycles already, and she wisely and successfully used the past loans to make her living conditions better. Now she is leading her group to request another loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for supporting her cassava farm, and will use some portions of her loan to buy school supplies for her kid.

With this loan, she hopes to extend her farmland to increase her cassava farming production to make more cassava to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for supporting her cassava farm.

loans.name: Sreyneang's Group

texts.en: Sreyneang’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sreyneang makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 25-year-old, married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living. 

So, Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas).  Mohammad family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes.  Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Evangelyn

texts.en:
Thirty-nine years old Evangelyn earns a living by catering photography services when there are events like parties  and special occasion like weddings. 
She hails in the town of Dauis, Bohol. She is married with six children. Her eldest child is 22 while the youngest is 10. She has been engaged in that kind of livelihood for 5 years now.
Her husband is a fisherman.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 4,000 PHP to buy materials like film and hard board. These are essential tools that would enable Evangeline improve her earnings. These will cause her to provide her family with nutritious diets and better shelter to live. 

Evangelyn is full of hope that someday she would expand her business to improve to family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy materials like film and hard board

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, is a 47-year-old married woman with five dependents. Two of her children still attend school. She lives in the town of Dauis, Bohol.

Alice sells home meals like spaghetti, stewed vegetables, pork soup, and pancit (very thin rice noodles that are fried with soy sauce, some citrus, possibly with patis, and some variation of sliced meat and chopped vegetables).

Alice is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for food vending like vegetables, meat, seasonings, and cooking oil. These will improve Alice's earnings, and allow her to continue to serve a variety of meals to locals in her place. Slowly, her income will improve, and she will be able her to pay her obligation.

Alice would like to handle her food-vending business properly in order to finance the schooling of her children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business like vegetables, meat, seasonings, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Beboie

texts.en:
He is a fish vendor for more than 5 years now. His name is Beboie. He is a father of two young dependents ages 1 and 3 years old respectively. He also sold sea shells as supplemental income.
He lives in the town of Dauis, Bohol.

Beboie would like to make use of the resources available to maximize and improve his main source of income.  With that, he could also continue provide the needs of his family and able to do start settle his obligation and manage his finances as well. He decided to to buy variety of fish, shells, weighing scale, cellophane and ice(preservative).

He is hoping that someday his livelihood will become productive.

loans.use: to buy variety of fish, shells, weighing scale, cellophane and ice(preservative)

loans.name: Ziporah

texts.en:
Ziporah is a mixed small-scale farmer based in the remote village of Mwaita, Kitale. She has been practicing agribusiness for the past six years and has never looked back. For a living, Ziporah sells milk and food products from her farm into the local market. Although Ziporah has been making profits through farming, she has always wanted to do poultry farming.

The main challenge she has encountered is a lack of funds to get her business off the ground. Ziporah is seeking a loan to buy quality breeds of poultry. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in Kitale and is a business that can be done on a part-time basis to earn extra income. Ziporah does not worry too much about competition because the market for poultry products is good - chicken is a popular meal for many people and this can be seen if you visit any fast food joint.

With this loan, Ziporah is confident that her income will increase and this will allow a permanent change in her life. She plans to buy different breeds of broilers and layers and will be selling eggs and meat to the local market and other major markets in Kenya. She also plans to start breeding, which will help increase the number of poultry on her farm. Ziporah will also benefit from using the poultry manure, which is an excellent source of nutrients for her farm. Through this loan, she will assure her large family a secure future and improved living conditions.

Her positive attitude and her desire to make progress demonstrate in this smallholder woman farmer an immense urge to improve herself and, of course, a favorable answer to her request. Be inspired loan to her today to keep her big smile!

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest, reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a densely populated place and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to open more business outlets within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en: Eleuteria is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 57, married in Piao, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, she runs a store that primarily supports for their family. Everyday she never get tired tending her store. Eleuteria is a full fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. Now, she borrowed another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles to sell. Having enough inventories would mean income opportunities.In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles to sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Twenty-five-year-old Faith is happily married and together with her husband, they are blessed with 5 children. For the past 5 years she has been involved in mixed farming and because of the immense knowledge she has in farming, farmers from their village and neighboring villages troop to her home to seek technical advice on the best farming techniques. Faith has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow.

Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and milk prices in the recent past have been going up, so Faith, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she knows that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure, and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling her milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also be selling to big dairy processing firms.

She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from this training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Faith hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children. It is clear that this smallholder farmer is determined to reach her goal, and her request should be considered. Her positive attitude and desire to get ahead reveal the immense desire in this mum to better herself and get a favorable response to his request.

loans.use: to buy another quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Saora's Group

texts.en: Saora’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Saora makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Refea's Group

texts.en:
As husband and wife, Refea and Mahmmoud started their own business to provide a living for their children. They have six children and they need a lot of care.

Refea and Mahmmoud are working as farmers and earn low incomes. They cannot cover all their family`s needs, and because of the high cost of living, they decided to open their own business to provide a good life for their children and ensure their education.

Refea and Mahmmoud started selling cleaning materials to increase their incomes and improve the standard of living for their family. Now, they are applying for a loan to help them expand their work and buy a larger quantity of products to sell. They need your support to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of cleaning materials.

loans.name: Saroeun Group

texts.en:
Saroeun is a 51-year-old married rice farmer with two children whom is a rice farmer and a factory work. In the picture, Saroeun took this photo with his group members. Saroeun is pictured 1st from the right, and he has been a farmer since 1984. His wife is 54 years old a rice farmer as well. All of them lives in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodian. Together, they can earn approximately $ 7.5 per day.

Saroeun, a group leader, would like to request a loan as a group of four members and he will use his portion to buy fertilizer for farming. With this loan, he will be able to help him to increase his family incomes and for living standard. In the future, he wants to buy more cows and piglets to fatten to earn additional income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Lang Him

texts.en:
Lang Him, 42 years old, is a farmer who lives in Baray district, Kampong Thom Province. She is a hard-working mother of three children, one married. Her husband is also a farmer on the rice field. This couple can make a net profit approximately USD 10 a day.
During this time, Lang Him is facing with a financial issue in her family.

She needs some money to hire workers for transplanting rice but yet she can’t afford. After getting to know that HKL provides KIVA loan with the lower interest rate than its normal loan, she has decided to apply for a KIVA loan for them to rent worker in the rice field. She would like to thank to all lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to hire workers for transplanting rice.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a resident of Catigbian, Bohol. She is married and has nine children. Two of these are still school aged children ages 20 and 19 years old. She is 53 years old and is engaged in direct selling business such as beauty products, home care products, accessories and shirts, under wears, sandals and shoes from Natasha, Avon, and Personal Collection. Thus, she is asking a loan to buy more items to sell. In the future, she dreams to increase her earnings and become profitable.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, home care products, accessories and shirts, under wears, sandals and shoes (from Natasha, Avon, and Personal Collection products)

loans.name: Nadeen

texts.en:
Nadeen 28 year’s old young married lady without kids, and lives in one of the poorest area in Jordan.
She became professional handicrafts and candles after her life experience in all crafts and traditional designing. And start her business making the crafts by order. As she is good what if she is doing her vision is to apply for a loan to buy tools and requirement for making candles  expand her business to produce larger quantity of products.  
This is going to help her with that business in her near future.

loans.use: to buy tools, candles and what she needs to produce more products and increase her incomes.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.en: Maricela is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be responsible. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to own several business outlets within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is 49 years old, and lives with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Musarat's son owns an electrical shop where he sells electrical goods and provides services for repairing electrical components, such as ceiling fans and washing machines. He also troubleshoots the underground electrical supply. From his shop, he sells electrical components as well, such as bulbs, switches, sockets, etc.

Musarat's son wants to buy more electrical goods for his shop but does not have cash in hand to buy new inventory. Therefore, Musarat requested a loan from Kiva’s Field Partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her son can be empowered to buy his desired inventory.

Musarat thanks Kiva and Field Partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more electrical goods for her son's electrical shop.

loans.name: Sokhoern's Group

texts.en:
Sokhoern, 35, lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district, Cambodia. She is married and has two dependent children and they are in school. For the last 10 years, Sokhoern has been selling grocery items while her husband works as a motor-taxi driver in the village in order to earn additional income for the family. Together, they can manage to earn about 58,000KHR per day to meet the family’s need.  
Sokhoern has never been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund before. Now she is forming a group of four female members to apply for a loan. Sokhoern, a group leader, will use her portion to buy more grocery items to resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to better off her family’s living’s condition and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to resale

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sarana

texts.en:
Sarana is 42 year old,married woman. She is an IDP and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Sarana has been breeding cattle and cows for the past 12 years. She was a housewife, but her husband is unemployed, and her business helps to cover family needs.

She usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then resells them for a profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 220 AZN, and this business is the only source of financial income in her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday dishes, like pilau and dolma. She also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling milk to neighbors.

She wants to expand her business and improve the life conditions of her family. She applied for a loan of 1500 AZN. She plans to purchase one milking cow with her loan funds. This will be her fourth loan. Please support her.

loans.use: to purchase one milking cow.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is a 51-year-old woman from Catigbian, Bohol. She is married with seven children. Three of her children are still in school, and are 20, 17 and 10 years old.

Jovita's husband is a farmer while she is engaged in selling coconut wine, known as “tuba” in the Visayas region. Aside from this, she also buys and sells charcoal, which is called “oling”. Jovita has been buying and selling tuba for almost 18 years.

In the future, Jovita wishes to grow her business to have a sustainable means of living. Lastly, she is asking for a loan to buy more tuba and oling to sell in order to improve her family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy tuba (coconut wine) and oling (charcoal).

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is in her late 30s and is married with five children. Four of them are in school and one of them is a grown up. She has been running two projects, running a genge business and poultry business for eight years now.  She works from 08am to 08pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Rukia's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start the genge business and to buy chicks to raise and sale as chicken.  She is doing great and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan, bought a tricycle, bought a farm and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase on the genge stock and to buy chicks and chicken feeds. She dreams of becoming an international business woman.

Rukia will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on the genge stock and to buy chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Sun Chine Group

texts.en:
Mira is the featured borrower for sun chine Group. She got joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Mira is a 32-year-old widowed mother of one child. She opened, four months ago, a clothes shop to cover the needs and expenses of her child. After her husband passed away, she became the only breadwinner of her family. She is working hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new collection of fashionable clothes to satisfy her customers' special requests. Mira is the first lady on the left of the photo.
With respect to the other group members, Rabiha is the lady standing in the middle, and Khaleda is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new collection of fashionable clothes to satisfy her customers' special requests

loans.name: Uwezesho Group

texts.en:
Saade who is in her mid 50s is  married with six children, three of them are in school and the other three are grown up.  She has been running several products, selling charcoal, perfumes and sarong for fifteen years now.  She works from 08am to 07pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Saade’s  5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on charcoal stock, started selling sarong and perfumes and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.  She is so grateful with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.  She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a land, loan repayment, bought a motorcycle and covered household expenses.   She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal, sarong and perfumes to resale.  She dreams of being an international business woman.

Saade  will share this loan  with her loan group Uwezesho which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal, sarong and perfumes to resale.

loans.name: Sret's Group

texts.en:
Sret lives in a rural village of the Ou Reang Ov district of Tbaung Khmum province, Cambodia. She is 50 years old and married with six children. Two of her children are in school, while one is too young for school, so she has three dependents.

To support the family, Sret has been growing rice, corn, and soybeans for more than 32 years. The current business earns her about 50,000 KHR per day to make a living, and she can afford to save 25,000 KHR each day after expenses. Low crop yield resulting from drought and insect pests have been a challenge for her business.

This is Sret’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She and another member are just members of VisionFund in this cycle. Sret is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her plantation. With this loan, she hopes to make healthier crop yields to increase her family’s income. She hopes to make a living better and be able to afford buying household necessities for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en:
Ghadeer is a nice young lady in her 33 years old. She is married and has four kids. Her husband retired and his pension is not enough to cover all the household expenses.
Ghadeer wanted to do something in her free time at home, so she started a year ago a small retail business selling clothes. At first she got small quantity of clothes and she got good feedback of the quality she chose, and decided to go on with the business.

It has been two years now since she started, but she is looking for other sources of clothes to get from, to help her provide her clients with a variety of products.
Now Ghadeer is applying for a loan to bring a larger quantity of clothes with more variety to increase her incomes and improve the standards of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and expand her business.

loans.name: Ismete

texts.en:
Ismete wants to buy second hand clothing items to resell at the Roma market in their city. She has been reselling such items together with her husband,for the past six years. They generate a gross income in an amount of approximately $7000 a year and her husband receives a retirement pension of $106/month.

Isemte has been photographed in her one-room-house and you can tell from the interior of it, how poor they are and how unhealthy is the condition in which her family lives.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to resell

loans.name: Las Residentas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Residentas está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty, una zona rural, de difícil acceso, donde todas están poniendo su esfuerzo para poder acceder a una buena educación para sus familias.
La Sra. Blanca es una de las integrantes, ella es docente, y también tiene su pequeño negocio de crías de animales y ventas de productos agrícolas. Integra el comité con el propósito de  mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia, es una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada que quiere ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de productos agrícolas para la venta y balanceados para sus animales. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The "Las Residentas" loan group is on its first loan cycle as part of the women's committee programme. The group is from the city of Curuguaty, a rural area that is difficult to access. Here all of the women are working hard to provide their families with a good education.

Blanca is one member of the group. She is a teacher, and has a small business raising animals and selling farming products. She is joining the loan group with a view to improving her and her family's living conditions. Blanca is very hard-working and dedicated. She wants to be somebody in life.

Blanca is applying for this loan in order to buy farming products to sell, and feed for her animals. She is grateful for this opportunity to improve her and her loved ones living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farming products to sell, and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is 34 years old. He is the caring father of three children and he lives in a sector of Jordan called Wehdat.

Ismael works in the sewing field and he is the sole breadwinner in his family. Because of that, Ismael decided to start his own business to increase his income and improve the standard of living for his family.

Ismael opened his own small sewing shop. He wants to buy fabrics and yarns and to promote his shop, so he applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and yarns and to promote his shop.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is a married mother of three children. Asmaa`s husband has worked in the upholstered furniture business for 25 years. He operates his own shop and is the sole breadwinner for the family.

Asmaa is working hard to help him. Asmaa is a very ambitious and strong-willed lady. She wants to improve the living standard of her family so she is helping her husband by applying for a loan to buy yarn, fabric, padding, and machines for his work.

This loan will help Asmaa and her husband develop their small business. They will be thankful if they receive the loan.

loans.use: to buy more yarn, fabric and padding.

loans.name: White Rose Group

texts.en:
Veronica who is in her mid 30s is single with two children who are still at school.  She has been selling clothes for five years now.  She works from 08am to 09pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Veronica’s 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to keep on increasing the clothes stock, started selling fabrics and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayments, reinvest in business and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy the up to date style clothes to meet her customers' requirement.  She dreams of expanding her business.

Veronica will share this loan with her loan group White Rose which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the up to date style clothes to meet her customers' requirement.

loans.name: Mum

texts.en:
From Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Mom, 49, is an experienced and industrious farmer. By operating a farming business on a small rice field, she can earn around 7 USD a day to support her family's daily needs. She is a lovely mother of three: a married child and two unmarried children enrolled in primary school.

To expand her farming business, Mom would like to get cows to help her plow her farmland, yet she can’t afford them. Due to her shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan because it has a low interest rate. She thanks all the lenders for their generous behavior.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a fish vendor for more that 10 years now. She sold fresh fish to the local in her place. 
She is 37 year old  married woman with five children.  Her eldest child is 20 while the youngest is 10.
Her husband is a fisherman. Her catch could be a great help as this could be for consumption or a source of income.

She  is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing net and additional capital for fish vending. These are vital in improving her livelihood. She could roll-out her capital and try to expand her business. 

With these, she is doing her best to improve her fish vending business for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net and additional capital for fish vending

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children, one in school. She has been selling fish for one year working from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily and earning a fair monthly profit.

This will be Anne’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her fish stock and she has managed to pay back her loan successfully. She is so grateful for the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of her group.

Anne used the profit to pay school fees, for loan repayment and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase the fish stock and rent a shop for selling fish. She dreams of expanding her business into a restaurant.

Anne will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan schedule time.

loans.use: to increase the fish stock and to rent a shop for selling fish.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil is a tricycle driver for almost 14 years. He is a resident of Clarin, Bohol, married and has six children. Her oldest child is 15 years old while her youngest child is two years old. Aside from driving, Ramil also do fish selling to have additional income. He works hard to provide the needs of his children. Thus, he dreams in the future to improve his business to have enough savings for his children’s education. He wants them to finish their studies to have better life in the future. Ramil is asking a loan of PHP4000 for motorcycle maintenance and to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: for motorcycle maintenance and to buy more fish

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Tbaung Khmum province, Horn is 26 years old and married with one son who is in school. The primary sources of her family’s income are from rice farming. To better support the family, her husband sometimes works for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 8 years, she can earn about 60,000KHR per day and manage to save about 40,000KHR each day after the expenses. The main challenge for her family’s business is the drop of cassava’s price and unhealthy rice crops. 
Horn has never been a member of VisionFund before. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and rice seeds for supporting her farmland. She hopes to make more healthy rice so as to increase her family’s income to better off her living condition and keep her son in school.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and rice seeds for supporting her farmland

location.town: Tbaung Khmum District, Tbaung Khmum Province

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria has been selling fresh fish for quite a period of time. She is a mother of six grown children.

She lives in the town of Dauis, Bohol. She is in need of additional funds to support her livelihood.

She has requested a loan to buy materials like a cooler for fish storage, additional fish and a weighing scale. These purchases will improve her fish vending business. Thus, she could start to save and expand her business as well.

Gloria is hopeful that someday, she will become productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy materials like a cooler for fish storage, additional fish and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Viviana Marisela

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América, en este lugar se reúnen cada 15 días el  Grupo De Crédito Los Radicales.
En este lugar vive la señora Viviana, tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera de una hija de 2 años de edad, ella vive en casa de sus padres.
Doña Viviana es una mujer que le siempre le ha gustado trabajar y así lograr sus propios recursos para que no le falte lo necesario a su hija, ella es directora de productos  Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), ella tiene a su cargo más de 30 vendedoras por las cuales gana algo por las ventas que ellas realicen, pero a su vez ella tiene que trabajar muy duro visitando a sus socias, tomando pedidos y entregando los productos a tiempo ya que de esto dependen sus ganancias, ella también invierte su dinero en productos razón por lo cual necesita de los créditos, lleva más de 3 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, accesorios  entre otras cosas que vende. Es fundadora del  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan  los créditos. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su pequeña la cual es su vida.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered one of the most important, most popular and most visited coastal cities in Ecuador due to its beautiful and inviting beaches. It has the first deepwater port in Ecuador and South America. The Los Radicales community bank meets every two weeks in this city.

Viviana is 26 years old. She is a single mother of a two-year-old daughter. She lives in her parents' house. Viviana is a woman who has always liked to work. She's been able to obtain her own resources so that she can take care of her daughter. She is a Yanbal product director (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories). She is in charge of more than 30 vendors. She earns money from the sales they make. At the same time, she has to work very hard, visiting her vendors, taking orders and delivering products. She also invests her money in products. For this reason, she needs the loan. She has put more than three years into this business and earns a living through it.

This loan will be used to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, accessories and other products. She is the founder of the community bank. She likes the aid given by the loans. Her dream is to give the best to her daughter who is her life.

loans.use: purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, accesories, etc.

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.en:
Guljahon was born in 1976. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Guljahon works in a library. She is a hardworking woman. She works hard to earn a living and provide her children with all they need.

Guljahon has always wanted to see her children receive higher education. Now, her daughter is a student in her first course at the National University of Tajikistan. Her name is Bibigul. Bibigul studies well. Guljahon must pay for her daughter’s university tuition. She is asking for a loan with this aim. Guljahon and Bibigul await your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 52 años de edad está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. El marido es chofer. 
Doña Carmen  tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, carnes, artículos de bazar y papelería, ropa, zapatos, entre otras cosas, de a poco ella ha ido surtiendo su tienda para que  sus clientes encuentren todo en su local, parte de este crédito lo va a utilizar en ampliar su local para tener más productos y mejorar sus ventas, tiene dos años en su negocio el cual lo mejora cada vez más con los créditos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres y materiales de construcción. Lleva 5 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la institución. Sus sueños son tener un gran local y su casa completamente terminada.
texts.en:
The "1 de Diciembre" communal bank meets in the seaside resort of San Clemente every fortnight. This place is known for it's beautiful beaches and receives many national and international tourists. It offers a diversity of beautiful spots and a rich variety of regional foods.

Carmen lives in this place. She is 52 years old, married and has four adult children as fruit of her relationship. Two of them still live at home. Her husband is a driver.

Carmen has a food store in her house where she sells products like rice, sugar, oil, detergent, vegetables, meat, housewares and stationary, clothing, and shoes amongst other things. Little by little she has been stocking her store so her customers find everything in her store.

She will use this loan to buy food and construction materials. She has been in the communal bank for five loan cycles and she likes it because of the support provided by the institution. Her dream is to have large store and her house completely finished.

loans.use: to buy food and construction materials.

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo is requesting for a loan to buy building materials like timber and bricks to build his family a house. He is now 50 years old, living in Bundibugyo in Uganda. He is married and has ten children.

He deals in the buying and selling of cocoa, but also has a cocoa garden of his own. He started this business in 2004. He has managed it well and is proud of it. The profits he earns have enabled him pay back the previous loan, which he used to buy cocoa for resale.

He hopes to pay school fees for his children and complete building his permanent house.

loans.use: To buy building materials like timber and bricks to build his family house.

loans.name: Fayza

texts.en:
Fayzah is 29-year-old married mother of five children. Fayzah and her husband want to live a comfortable life and provide the best education for their children. It was difficult for them to improve their standard of living so Fayzah decided to start her own small business.She started breeding livestock near her house.

The business has gone well but as her children grow up, their needs are increasing. Fayzah thought about expanding her market. So, Fayzah asked for a loan to help her buy more products and feed for her livestock to provide proper nutrition to increase productivity and Fayza`s profits. She needs your support to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy more products and feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Mission Group

texts.en:
Staney is in his early 30s and is single with no children. He has been selling second-hand clothes since 2010. He works from 10 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Stanley's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his second-hand clothes stock and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully.

Stanley used the profit to repay the loans, buy a television set, a radio, sofa sets and a decoder. He will use this loan to buy stock for his second-hand clothing store to meet his customers' requirements. He dreams of buying bales of second hand clothes.

Stanley will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock for his second-hand clothing business.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
La Sra. Agustina es de la ciudad de Pilar, es comerciante, comenta que es separada y tiene 2 hijos, gracias a su esfuerzo y su sacrificio está saliendo adelante.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropería en general, lencería, calzados y otros, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que pone todo de sí para poder crecer y mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de ropas variadas, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus ventas y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Agustina is a merchant from the city of Pilar. She says that she is separated and has two children. It is through her hard work and sacrifices that she is getting ahead.

She earns a living selling clothing, lingerie, footwear, and other items. She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman, who does everything she can to grow and better herself.

She is requesting this loan to purchase a variety of garments so that she can continue with her sales and fulfill her customers' orders.

loans.use: to purchase different articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Neag

texts.en:
Neag, 55 years old, is a farmer who lives in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham Province. She is a hard-working mother of eight children, three married. Her husband, Soeun, 57, is a farmer on the cassava farmland. This couple can make a net profit approximately USD 5 a day.

During this time, Neag is facing with a financial issue in her family. She needs some money to buy some farming materials for her husband but yet she can’t afford. After getting to know that HKL provides Kiva loan with the lower interest rate than its normal loan, she has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and others related farming materials for her husband to use in the cassava field. She would like to thank to all lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and others related farming materials

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam is a 43 years old who has been married for many years and she is caring mother of six kids. To avoid thinking of it Ibtisam insisted on starting a small home business selling accessories, toys, and cleaning materials, etc. Having this business helped in filling her times instead of keep standing up front of the financial crisis that faced her husband.

Also she helped in improving their living conditions by adding another source of income to the family. Ibtisam is now applying for a loan to increase the quantity of accessories she is selling to prepare for the upcoming Adha holiday season.

loans.use: to buy more souvenirs and accessories for sale.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a 55 year’s old married man and is the father for four children. Although he was not able to reach high school, he made sure that his children are all going to school to get the education he couldn’t have because of family financial situation. Now his eldest son is in university and the others are still going to elementary and high school.

Since he left school early, Saleh used to go to work with his father and other furniture shop and gained a lot of experience in the market, and then he decided to take over his father’s business running his furniture shop. He is applying for a loan to do some renovations to the shop to attract more customers to it and buy more products to sell.

loans.use: to do some renovations to the family's furniture shop to attract more customers to it and buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chor district, Saret is 32-year-old mother of four children, two of whom are too small for school. She is a rice farmer in the local area and supplements her family’s income by working as a garment worker. Having been in the business for 12 years, she can make daily income from her current business of 70,000KHR and is able to save about 20,000KHR per day after expenses for the future needs.
This is the second loan for Saret with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes that this loan will enable her to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Nua Ngam 15 Group

texts.en:
Mai, 28, is married and the mother of a 6-year-old boy. She lives with her husband and her child in a Thai ethnic traditional house in a small remote village. She and her husband work very hard at agricultural production to provide for the family. Mai has been a farmer since she was a young girl and has good experience in farming and animal husbandry.

Mai is also a hard-working person and has always tried hard to diversify the farm's production. Her family cultivates rice and raises bees, buffaloes, ducks, musk ducks, chicken and goats. This is the fifth time Mai has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program. She will use the loan to buy goats and expand her goat farming. She hopes that her investment will go well and generate good income for her family.

Mai dreams that her family will have an improved life and that her child will grow up healthy, study well, enter a good college, have a good job and avoid poverty. In the picture, she is wearing a green shirt and stands at the far right.

loans.use: to buy goats and expand goat farming

loans.name: Rasmiyya

texts.en:
Rasmiyya is 49 years old, married and has four children. Currently she lives in the Fuzuli region with her family, but they are IDP (internally displaced persons) from the city of Fuzuli. Her children are getting older, and her husband’s salary is not enough to cover their increasing expenses. Previously she took a loan from Kiva, and with this loan she successfully developed her business of raising cattle.

Now she has changed her business to poultry, for which she needs her second loan in the amount of 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat). Rasmiyya has been in the poultry business for two years. She wants to buy ducks and chickens. She is thankful to Kiva and lenders for help.

Rasmiyya wants to give a good future to her children.

loans.use: to buy ducks and chickens

loans.name: Battsend

texts.en: Mr. Battsend, 74 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Darkhan, second largest city of Mongolia. He and his wife have retired from work and get state pension. Before his retirement, he used to be tractor driver at agricultural firm for many years. He is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to buy shingles in order to repair house roof as last spring's heavy rain ruined it.

loans.use: to buy shingles in order to repair his house roof

loans.name: Baraka

texts.en:
Baraka who is in his early 30's is married with two children one of them is in school and other one is still  small. He has been selling charcoal for three years now. He works from 06am to 04pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Baraka's 9th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to keep on increasing  on the charcoal stock and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He is happy with the loan and appreciate Kiva for the support of their group. He used the profit to pay school fees, covered house hold expenses,loan repayment and has built a house for renting. He will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and start selling at whole price as well as retail price. He dreams of owning a car.

Baraka will make sure he pays  his loan within the loan scheduled time.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and start selling at whole price as well as retail price.

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
At the age of 49 years old, Nat is working very hard as a garment worker in a location that is far from her house in Prey Chhor District of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. The daily profit for her house is USD $6 a day. So far, Nat has been a worker for about 6 years.

Currently, Nat would like to request her first loan through Kiva to buy a motorbike to ride to her work place. Nat thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to ride to her work place

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en: Zosima is from Calape, Bohol. She is 57 years old married woman and has four adult children. Together with his husband, Zosima is engaged in vegetable gardening business. They have been doing this kind of business for almost 16 years. They work together to earn a living. Zosima is asking a loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings to continue their livelihood. She dreams to improve their harvest in the future to increase their earnings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a 31-year-old married mother of two young dependents. She is engaged in a fish vending business. She sells fresh fish to the community where she lives. Her husband is a fisherman.

Janeth is in need of additional funds to support her husband's fishing business. She has requested a loan to buy a fishing net, battery, foam for fish storage and fuel for the motorboat. These purchases would maximize their income.

Profit from the fishing business will enable Janeth to provide her young children with proper food and better shelter.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, battery, foam for fish storage and fuel for the motorboat.

loans.name: Ma. Nona

texts.en: Ma. Nona is 54 years old, married with 3 children of adult age and lives in motibot, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She wish is to send her children to school until they finish college and landed a good job. She doesn't want to see her children doing back breaking work in tilling and cultivating land like what she's doing to provide their needs. Ma. Nona is a hardworking farmer and a loving mother to her children. This time, Ma. Nona had seen that her hard work had paid off as she sees her children finished college. As she recalls, everything has been made possible with the financial support extended by Paglaum MPC to farmers like her. To head start for the next cropping season, she avails a loan of PHP 3,000.00 to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase of good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more produce.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase of good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more produce

loans.name: Siria Jasmin

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.
En este lugar vive la señora Siria, tiene 40 años de edad esta casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 11, 6 y 3 años de edad, todos  estudian en escuela y jardín de infantes. El marido se dedica  a la pesca. 
Doña Siria es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo tenga los recursos necesarios para poder realizar un gran trabajo, su esposo se dedica a la pesca, el junto a otra persona se van a alta mar  en su pequeña embarcación a realizar sus faenas de pesca, ellos salen en la mañana y regresan a la tarde y en ocasiones hasta el otro día con los productos que el mar les da, actualmente ella espera utilizar la mitad del crédito para comprar colas, aguas, jugos y cervezas ya que se avecinan las fiestas del lugar y son tres días de fiesta, días en los cuales vende mucho de estos productos que le permiten ganarse algo extra que les ayude a salir  adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, combustible, colas, jugos y cervezas. Lleva más de 17  años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la institución. Sus sueños son tener un gran barco para que su esposo realice sus faenas de pesca.
texts.en:
In the seaside resort of San Clemente, the "1 de diciembre" communal bank meets every fortnight. San Clemente is known for its beautiful beaches that are much visited by many national and international tourists. The town offers a variety of beautiful places to visit, and a rich selection of typical dishes from the region.

And it is here that 40-year-old Siria lives. She is married and has three children, ages eleven, six and three years old respectively. All three attend school or nursery. Siria's husband is a fisherman.
