Siria is a great housewife who is taking out this loan so that her husband may buy the necessary resources to do a great job. Siria's husband works as a fisherman; he goes out to the high seas and fishes with one colleague. The two go out in the morning and come back in the afternoon; sometimes they stay out until the next day with the goods that they collect from the sea.

Siria hopes to use half of this loan in order to buy cola drinks, water juices and beers as three days of local festivals are approaching and these products sell very well during this time. This will allow Siria to earn a little money to help her family to move forward.

This loan will be used in order to buy nets, petrol, rope, fly lines, juices and beers. Siria has been a member of the loan group for 17 years old and likes it because of the help that she receives from the organisation. Siria's dream is to have a big boat for her husband to go out fishing in.

loans.use: to buy nets, petrol, rope, fly lines, juices and beers.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he grows coffee and also keeps dairy cows. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in weather. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is involved in farming mainly cocoa growing and running a retail shop selling items like sugar, salt, match box, cooking oil, soap and biscuits to add on his incomes. This helps him to generate extra income for his children and three dependents under his care. He is faced with challenges of low capital and defaulters that hinder progress of his business. However, he has a vision of increasing his family income by selling directly to cocoa companies who offer better prices than through agents. He has hopes of owning a permanent house in future and has now asked for a loan to buy building materials like cement, sand, bricks and nails to construct his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement, sand, bricks and nails to construct his house.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en: Zainabu is 48 years, married with four children; and lives in Bundibugyo Uganda. She deals in cocoa business mainly growing, buying and selling to cocoa companies plus selling food stuffs on retail basis for extra income. She started the business 4 years ago to raise income for the family and have a source of income which can enable her pay school fees for the children, including 8 dependents under her care as relatives. Her main challenges include seasonality changes, limited funds to attain hopes of expanding the business, educate children up to University and support family members. Zainabu has asked for a loan to buy cassava flour for selling.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour for selling.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is doing it! He is growing his business season by season and his hard work is paying off.  Two weeks ago, Jean Bosco became AEC's first 5-time successful borrower. He started with a $10,000 loan, increased to $25,000, and just paid off his $50,000 loan.

With each successive loan, Jean Bosco has been able to generate more profits and grow his business. He is now operating above 75% capacity. We expect that within two more seasons, he will be able to operate his existing business fully without the need to take on debt.

Last week, Jean Bosco was given the opportunity to grow even more. Three additional rice cooperatives, working with about 2,000 small holder farmers, signed an agreement to supply Jean Bosco with more paddy rice. These cooperatives previously supplied one of his competitors, but the cooperatives were so impressed with the technical agronomy support that Jean Bosco provides that they switched to him.

To work with these new suppliers, Jean Bosco needs a short-term loan of $40,000 to finish out the remainder of the year.  Like his previous loans, we expect that he will repay his loan fully and on-time, if not early. Jean Bosco is so confident in his ability to repay, that he has already submitted a check in the full amount dated November 30, 2015.

Again, we are so pleased to support this amazing entrepreneur, and we are so thankful for your support of this loan. Jean Bosco is an exemplar in Rwanda. He is pushing his country forward, and we are honored to be with him every step of the way.

loans.use: To work with 2000 additional small holder farmers for the October harvest

loans.name: Erdenebayar

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenebayar, 30 years old, lives with his parents in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running a hospital on his own since 2004.

His parents have both retired from work and get state pension. Using his previous loan, he renovated his house, creating a comfortable living environment for his parents.

This time he is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD to buy equipment for his hospital. It is urgent because his equipment became outdated. As a doctor who oversees people's health, it is very responsible of him to change outdated equipment.

loans.use: to update hospital equipment

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en: Han is a 44-year-old widowed rice farmer with two children who resides in a Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Han is pictured 1st from the left and cultivated rice since 1991. Her two children are the factory workers. Han and her children can make approximately USD 7.5 per day. Han a group leader, would like to request a loan as a group of four members and Han is now requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for rice farming. With this loan, she will be able to gain better rice crops to sell, thereby improving the family’s finances. In the future, she is going to save money to buy more farmland to cultivate rice, so she will be able to have enough money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for rice farming

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Horn, 43 years old, is a farmer who lives in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham Province. She is a hard-working mother of five children, one married. Her husband, Vorn, 48, is a farmer on the cassava farmland. This couple can make a net profit approximately USD 7 a day.
During this time, Horn is facing with a financial issue in her family. She needs some money to buy some farming materials for her husband but yet she can’t afford.  After getting to know that HKL provides KIVA loan with the lower interest rate than its normal loan, she has decided to apply for a KIVA loan to buy fertilizers and others related farming materials for her husband to use in the cassava field. She would like to thank to all lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and others related farming materials

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 53 year old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and two children, all of them are still studying. Her husband is the main income provider, and as for her she don’t work, she cares only for home and family.

Currently, with the aim to pay her children study fees, she is requesting a loan from kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She is a permanent customers and she insist that she will always ask for Kiva’s support to ensure a good educational path for her children and this is their only target.

loans.use: to pay her children study fees

loans.name: Lidia Alexandra

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días el Grupo De Crédito 4 De Noviembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Lidia, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 13, 12 y 6 años de edad, los  mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante. 
Doña Lidia es una mujer muy trabajadora que realiza lo necesario para salir adelante, ella tiene una pequeña fábrica de botones, trabaja con la ayuda de otra persona a quien le paga por su trabajo, ellas elaboran los botone y luego los entregan a comerciantes que llevan a la ciudad de Manta para que sean exportados a otros países. Ella siempre utiliza los créditos para ir mejorando su negocio ya sea para comprar materia prima o para ir comprando herramientas y maquinas que le permitan mejorar su trabajo, por esta razón ella está muy agradecida con la fundación y con las personas que le ayudan con los créditos ya que es así como ella puede salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar una máquina cortadora para realizar los cortes de la tagua. Lleva  10  años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los servicios médicos que les brinda la institución. Sus sueños son ir mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its large diversity of typical items such as the woven straw hats known within the country and abroad, is where the credit group 4 De Noviembre (4th of November) meets every 15 days.

This is where Lidia lives. She is 36 years old, married and has three children who are 13, 12 and 6 years old. The elder ones go to secondary school, and the youngest to primary. Her husband is a merchant.

Lidia is a very hard-working woman who does what's necessary to get ahead. She has a small button factory and she is helped by another person whom she pays. They make the buttons and then deliver them to merchants who take them to the city of Manta for export to other countries.

She always uses the loans to improve her business, whether to buy raw materials, or tools and machines that allow her to improve her work. This is why she is very grateful to the foundation and to the people who help with the loans, because this is how she is able to get ahead.

This loan is so she can buy a machine for cutting the tagua [native nut resembling ivory, used for handicrafts]. She has been with the credit group for ten years and she likes it because of the medical services it provides. Her dream is to continue to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy a cutting machine.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 44-year-old woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is married and a mother of five children ages 18, 16, 14, 12, and 10 years old. She is engaged in a sari-sari store business while her husband works hard as a driver abroad.

Cecilia has been in the business of sari-sari store for almost 15 years. Aside from this, she also engaged in direct selling business such as beauty and home care products from PC (Personal Collection). Thus, she is asking a loan to buy soft drinks, food seasoning, chips, biscuits, candies, coffee, sugar, noodles, canned goods, toiletries, powdered chocolate drink and milk. She also buys stocks from PC (Personal Collection) mention above. In the future, Cecilia wishes to improve and expand her business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, food seasoning, chips, biscuits, candies, coffee, sugar, noodles, canned goods, toiletries, powdered chocolate drink and milk; products from PC

loans.name: Los Jazmines  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocido por su clima cálido y  agradable se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Los Jazmines, este grupo está formado por 10 mujeres y 1 hombre los mismos que gracias a los créditos han podido mejorar sus negocios. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Betsy, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa.  El esposo trabaja en un hospital local. Ella hace varios años atrás  estudio corte y confección en un Academia de la ciudad. 
Doña Betsy es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante, ella tiene un taller de costura en su casa, allí ella  confecciona todo tipo de ropa aunque lo que más le gusta es  hacer es ropa de  mujer y ropa deportiva, siempre tiene contratos con grupos o personas particulares que siempre le piden sus trabajos ya que ella realiza un buen trabajo y es cumplida con las fechas de entrega, trabaja todos los días y cuando hay bastante trabajo casi todo el día, lleva más de 30 años con su taller el cual le permite salir delante de una manera honrada y haciendo algo que le encanta.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar telas, hilos, botones  y otros materiales de costura. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando con el paso de los días.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi, known for it's hot and agreeable climate, the "Los Jazmines" communal bank meets. This group is made up of ten women and one man who thanks to the loans have been able to improve their businesses. They work in a variety of businesses.

One of the members is Betsy. She is 54 years old, married and from this relationship has four adult children. Three of them still live at home. Her husband works in a local hospital. A number of years ago she studied cutting and sewing in an Academy in the city.

Betsy is a fighter who likes to get ahead on her own. She has a sewing shop in her home where she sews all types of clothing. She likes to make women's clothing and sportswear the most. She always has contracts with groups or individual people who request her work as she produces good work and complies with the delivery dates. She works every day and when there is enough work she works almost the whole day. She has operated her shop for more than 30 years which has allowed her to get ahead in an honest way doing something that she loves.

She will use this loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing materials. She has been in the communal bank for three years and she likes it because of the support the loans provide. Her dream is to continue to improve with the passing of the days.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Samoun's Group

texts.en: Samoun’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Samoun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller and factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sak's Group

texts.en: Sak’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sak makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Hina

texts.en:
Hina is a 25-year-old married woman who has three children. She lives in a populated area and her husband knows about people's needs in this area. He is a market vendor who sells seasonal fruits from his place in a central bazaar and also from his home. He has a few years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers.

Hina's husband chose this business because it is profitable and brings in a stable income. People use fresh fruits every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of fruits. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he could sell the maximum amount of fruits till evening and get maximum reward for his efforts.

Hina applied for a loan so her husband can purchase more fruits and thus increase his monthly turnover. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fruits for her husband's fruit selling business.

loans.name: Ipung

texts.en:
Mrs Ipung is the mother of 3 child and lives in Donomulyo Malang Regency on Java Island in Indonesia one of the most populous places in the world.
In Indonesia, like in many other developing nations, you need to treat water before you can drink it. In Indonesia, like in many other developing nations, you need to treat water before you can drink it. Unsurprisingly, most Indonesians boil the water before they drink it. Some people also buy water from refill stations which is not always safe.

Mrs Ipung heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava water filters held a safe water training in her vicinity Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity.

Mrs Ipung who is also a health worker took the opportunity and became the reseller of Nazava water filter in her community. This is the third time Mrs Ipung applied for a loan. She has an excellent record in repaying her loans.
This loan will allow Mrs Ipung to buy 220 filters and sell them on consignment to her community making safe drinking water available to 1100 people.

loans.use: to buy water filters in order to provide her neighbors with safe drinking water.

loans.name: Badamsambuu

texts.en:
Mr. Badamsambuu, 45 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a driver since 2010. His wife is bookkeeper. Their eldest son renders taxi service to local people. Their second son studies at university while youngest one goes to high school. Using his previous loan, he has renovated his house, creating comfortable and warm place for his family.

Now he is requesting a loan of 2200 USD to connect to city's main sanitation system. By doing so, his family's living standard will greatly improve.

loans.use: to connect to the city's sanitation system.

loans.name: Giyosiddin

texts.en: Giyosiddin lives with his family in Tajikistan. He was born in 1997 in to a large family. They are 6 members in his family. His father works in a factory. Giyosiddin this year graduated school and now he is a student at the university. He studies well and plans to graduate from university successfully. He is asking for a loan of 4000 Somoni to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your mercy and generosity.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition .

loans.name: Washington

texts.en: Washington is a married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 14 years. He describes himself to be innovative. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in season. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. His business goal is to be a supplier of cereals to schools within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Kadriye

texts.en:
Kadriye crafts strings of prayer beads called paternosters out of meerschaum stone. She sells these to local stores to earn an income. She urgently needs to increase this income, as both of her children attend university, and one of them needs her financial help in order to continue studies.

One of Kadriye's friends told her about microcredit, and she decided to apply for a loan. She will use her loan funds to buy meerschaum stone in bulk. This will allow her to make greater quantities of paternosters and other jewelry. She hopes to increase her sales and improve her business. With the expected profit, she will help pay for her child to continue with university study.

loans.use: to buy meerschaum stone with which to make paternosters and jewelry

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal, 48 years old, is a seller and her husband is a water distributor who has a long commute to work. They live in the Prey Chhor District of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. The daily profit for this couple is (USD) $13 a day.

Currently, Sophal would like to request her second loan through Kiva to buy a motorbike for her husband to ride to his work place. Sophal thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to ride to his work place.

loans.name: Saen's Group

texts.en: Saen’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Saen makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and driver to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Phon works as village chief in Kraing Doung Village. Beside paper works as village chief, Phon and wife (both in the picture standing in-front of their house) do farming  to support his only child. Phon and wife get up early morning to feed the pig and prepare to go to farm. Phon is not happy with his current energy since it is a time and money consuming source. He needs to go to charge battery every 2 or 3 days and spend 0.5$ every time. Moreover, before using device with car battery he has to prepare the plug and battery correctly or else accident may happens. After getting good recommendation from neighbor village chief, Phon decided to apply for KIVA loan to buy solar home systems. With solar home systems, he can reduce utility fee and  doesn’t have to concern about sudden power off anymore.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system

location.town: Kraing Doung Village, Peam Commune, Samaki Meanchh

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en: Chanthy’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chanthy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine was a appraised as an individual client from Lwajja Kitigi with a business of a piggery project that she started in 2002 and besides she operates a retail shop. The client is aged 35, married with four children who are in school. She rears pigs from which she earns income to take care of his family's financial obligations.  She is acquiring a loan of five hundred thousand shillings only to buy her animal feeds. This will help her to increase production and therefore sales and income.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Sour's Group

texts.en: Sour’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sour makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of them to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Roman

texts.es:
El Sr. Roman es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ybycuí, tiene una hija, se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos ya que tiene una olería y también se dedica a la ganadería, hace ya 10 años.
Él empezó trabajando son su padre, ya con el tiempo y por la edad avanzada de su padre se quedo con el negocio y le resultó muy bien ya que contaban con clientela formada. 
El préstamo que pide es para la compra de dos bueyes para usar en trapiche de olería y de esa forma acelerar la cantidad de la producción de sus ladrillos. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Roman is not married and lives in the city of Ybycui. He has a daughter and he is a brick-maker. He has a mill for making the bricks [used to mix the mud], and he also has been raising livestock for ten years.

He started by working with his father, but as time passed and with his father's advancing age, he was left with the business. This worked out very well for him since there was already a customer base.

The loan he is applying for is for the purchase of two oxen that he will use with the brick-making mill, thus increasing his output of bricks.

He is grateful for the opportunity he is receiving which will allow him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy oxen to be used in the brick-making mill.

loans.name: Hanady

texts.en: Hanady is a 21 year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents. Her father represents the income source in the family in order to fulfil their family needs and improve their lifestyle. And as per her, she doesn’t work as she is only focusing on her study. Today, she is in need for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her technical study fees what make her very happy that she will able to pursue her education suitably and secure a brilliant future.

loans.use: to pay her technical study fees

loans.name: Maria Lyn

texts.en:
Maria Lyn is a 23-year-old married mother of two children, ages 3 and 1, from Tubigon, Bohol. Her husband works hard as a carpenter while she sells tamarind candy known as sampaloc candy in the Philippines. She has been doing this for almost five years to earn a living.

She also owns a small sari-sari (variety) store. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as tamarind, sugar, and cellophane. She also wants to buy stock for her small sari-sari such as chips, biscuits, candies, bread, coffee, sugar, toiletries and canned goods. In the future, she wishes to buy a machine for her sampaloc candy production.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for sampaloc (tamarind candy), and store supplies such as chips, biscuits, candies, bread, coffee, sugar, toiletries and canned goods.

loans.name: Chheorn

texts.en:
CHHEORN, 63 years old, is a farmer who lives in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham Province. He is a hard-working father of four children, three married. His wife,62, is also a farmer on the cassava farmland. This couple can make a net profit approximately USD 10 a day.

During this time, Chheorn is facing a financial issue in his family. He needs some money to buy some farming materials but yet he can’t afford. After getting to know that HKL provides Kiva loan with the lower interest rate than its normal loan, he has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and others related farming materials to use in the cassava field. He would like to thank to all lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and others related farming materials

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en:
Roeun, 44, lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two children. To make a living, she works as a farmer is small rice field which was located just behind her house.  So far, it is nearly 20 years that she has been involving in this farming business which can earn net profit of USD 7 per day.

Roeun wants to promote her family income more, that is raising baby pigs and sell to local dealers when they are getting older. Now she is borrowing a loan from HKL to buy pig feed for all pigs. Roeun would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is a resident of Calape, Bohol. He is 37 years old man and engaged in “habal-habal” (a motorcycle with extended seat to accommodate more passengers) business. He has been doing this for seven years to earn a living. Aside from this, he also buys and sells scrap to have additional earnings. Thus, he is asking a loan for his “habal-habal” maintenance and to buy more scrap to sell. In the future, he aims for business improvement to have sustainable earnings in the future.

loans.use: for “habal-habal” maintenance and to buy more scrap to sell

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en:
Phylis is a married mother of three children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she sells milk and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for six years.

Phylis' business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman. She has 12 children. She describes herself to be God fearing. She operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. She hopes that in the future, she will buy land. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Hakime

texts.en:
Hakime is married and a mother of two.  She is making paternosters from meerschaum and selling them to stores and thus making contribution to the family budget.  With the help of the loan she is planning to buy bulks of meerschaum stone, make paternosters and sell them, make money and improve her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Hakime hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Lületaşından tesbih yapıyor ve dükkanlara toptan satış yaparak aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor.  Aldığı mikro kredi ile lületaşını ham olarak alacak ve işleyerek üretip satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy meerschaum stone

loans.name: Nilüfer

texts.en:
Nilüfer is married and a mother of two. She is selling cosmetics and beauty products via a network system. With the help of the loan she is planning to buy bulks of cosmetics and beauty products, sell them, make money and improve her business.



Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nilüfer hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Nilüfer hanım network işi ile kozmetik ve güzellik ürünleri satıyor. Aldığı mikro kredi ile toptan kozmetik ürünleri ve güzellik ürünleri alarak ve satarak para kazanmak ve işini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 55-year old lady; her residence is in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
She is the mother of two sons and three daughters and her husband owns a furniture shop in which he makes items such as sofas, tables and beds. He has been making furniture for many years and teaching his arts to his son as well.

Now, one of her sons has become a fine carpenter and can easily run a separate business; so he set up a new shop. Now he wants to buy his all tools and raw material for making furniture.

Therefore, Yasmeen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son will be able to buy raw material for his newly set up carpenter shop for making furniture. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy wooden raw material for her son's new set up carpentering shop.

loans.name: Isdianto

texts.en:
Mr Isdianto is the father of 3 children and lives in Dampit, Malang Regency on The Island of Java, the main island of Indonesia.
In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water and most people don't even have access to piped water. Unsurprisingly, most Indonesians boil the water before they drink it. Some people also buy water from refill stations which is not always safe.

At a community gathering, where the outreach team from Nazava was invited, Mr Isdianto learnt about an easier and better way of getting safe drinking water. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity.

Mr Isdianto who fulfills a leading function in his neighborhood seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in his area. This is the second time Mr Isdianto applies for a loan. He has an excellent record in repaying his loans.
This loan will allow Mr Isdianto to buy 120 filters and sell them on consignment to his community making safe drinking water available to 600 people.

loans.use: to obtain 120 water purifiers to sell to his community members providing them with safe drinking water.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 29-year-old married mother of two children who has been working since three years ago at her house selling homemade foods such as pickles, thyme, and oil… to help her family to meet the needs of life. She is obtaining a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to ameliorate her business merchandise and to buy food provisions to give the best product to its clients. She is very certain that she will sell all products and expanding her business area. She hopes that in the future, she might open her own store to be able to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy food provisions

loans.name: Dianilyn

texts.en:
Dianilyn has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earn as well for her family.

As a Microfinance member of PMPC, Dianilyn wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is a married woman. She has 7 children. She describes herself to be dedicated. She operates a retail business where she sells cups,clothes, shoes and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of products. She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of cups, shoes, clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cups, shoes, clothes

loans.name: Tawfa

texts.en:
Tawfa, age 63 and widowed, lives in a poor governorate with her young son. She earns an income in a number of ways in order to support herself and her son: she makes and sells soap; she offers accessories for sale; and she keeps bees in her garden so that she can sell honey. She manages these enterprises without the benefit of any transportation, requiring her to walk in extreme heat and in bad weather to get to her point of sale. She works throughout the day without a break. 

Her husband's death left her without any means of survival, but she chose not to give up, instead becoming a stronger woman and an ambitious entrepreneur. She is a leader in her society association, after having proven her merit and showing her fellow association members that seniors can work as hard as anyone else. She is proud to be making enough of a living to feed her child and pay her bills.

She applied for a loan in order to buy the necessary ingredients for making soap, as well as to purchase more accessories to offer for sale. Her goal is to grow her business so that she can earn more income.
 
She is grateful for this chance to expand her business, and she offers her thanks to her lenders.

loans.use: to buy the necessary ingredients for making soap, as well as to purchase more accessories to offer for sale

loans.name: Kuña Aty Atyra Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Aty Atyra está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres. Está ubicado en la ciudad de Caacupé, es un grupo nuevo que tiene muchas expectativas de poder trabajar y mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través del comité de mujeres.
La señora Fermina, ayuda al Sostenimiento de su familia con la venta de plantas, ella tiene todo tipo de plantas y es lo que más atrae a sus clientes. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que lucha por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos, y es por eso que decidió unirse a este grupo para poder mejorar.
Fermina pide este préstamo para la compra de abono y el mejoramiento del sistema de riego de sus plantas. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called Kuna Aty Atyra is in its 1st cycle of the women's committee programme.
It is a new group, based in the city of Caacupe, which has many expectations related to being able to work and improve their living conditions through the women's committee.

Fermina helps support her family by selling plants and has many types which is what attracts her customers. She is a very selfless woman who struggles to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones. Being able to do this is why she decided to join the group.

Fermina has applied for this loan in order to buy fertilizer and improve the irrigation system for her plants. She is thankful for the opportunity to be able to improve her life and help her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and improve an irrigation system.

loans.name: Jovenes Valientes Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Jovenes Valientes está dentro del programa de comité de jóvenes, está en su ciclo uno, son jóvenes que quieren aprender un oficio o mejorar el que tienen, y por medio de el poder sentirse útiles y poder ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es Acela quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de ropas que hace, se esfuerza para poder ayudar a su familia con los ingresos.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de ropas, para poder venderlas después. Agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder mejorar.
texts.en:
The group named Jovenes Valientes (Brave Young People) is in its first loan cycle with the young people's committee program. The members are young people who want to learn a trade or improve the one they already follow, so they can feel useful and help their families through their occupations.

One of its members is Acela. Through her efforts and ongoing work selling clothing, she strives to help with her household income.

She is requesting this loan to buy clothing to sell.

The group's members are grateful for the opportunity given to them to better themselves.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Urfat

texts.en:
Urfat was born in 1962 and is living in the Fuzuli region with his lovely family. Urfat’s family consists of four people: his wife, who is housewife, and two children, a girl, who is studying in the tenth class, and a boy, who is studying in the second course at music college. The family members are IDP (internally displaced persons) from Fuzuli city.

Urfat and his wife have an animal breeding business. Urfat has applied to Komak company, and he needs a loan in the amount of 1,500 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this amount, he is planning to buy two calves to improve his business.

Urfat is thankful for the help from Kiva and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy two calves to improve his business.

loans.name: Claudensiana

texts.en:
Claudensiana has signed up for her membership with PMPC and availed herself of the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital PMPC extends to a small-time borrower like her.

Claudensiana is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she accessed a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, 33 years old, lives in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte with her husband and two children. Her husband is a construction worker. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through snack and food vending.

It began with selling a small amount of viands and snacks to their neighbors. She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2004. She became a MIGS (member in good standing) member, which is why she has received loans several times already.

Now, she is applying for 30,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ushirikiano Kiburugwa Group

texts.en:
Ssi is in his early 30s and is single. He has one kid who is in school. He has been running a photographing business for five years now. He works from 07am to 08pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sai's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to buy a digital camera in order to attract customers. He dreams of buying an even more up to date cameras.

Sai will be accountable for paying back his loan.

loans.use: to buy a digital camera in order to attract customers'.

loans.name: Pelin

texts.en:
Pelin is married and has one child.  She is making scarfs, bags and souvenirs from felt.  It has been a year since she opened her store.  Her scarfs are specially designed and she received awards in many local contests.  With the help of the loan from MAYA she is planning to buy bulks of felt fabrics and accesories, make more sales and develop her business. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Pelin hanım evli bir çocuk annesi.  Keçe işi ile uğraşıyor, keçeden şal, çanta, hediyelik eşyalar yapıyor.  Bir yıl olmuş dükkan açmış, yaptığı şallar özel tasarım zaman zaman yörede elişi ile ilgili yarışmalar oluyor katılmış ödül almış. Aldığı mikro kredi ile toptan keçe malzemesi ve aksesuarları alarak ve üreterek satış yapmayı ve işini geliştirmeyi hedefliyor

loans.use: to buy felt fabrics and accesories

loans.name: Ningrum

texts.en:
Mrs Ningrum is the mother of 3 child and lives in Gedangan Malang Regency on Java, Indonesia's largest Island in terms of population.

In Indonesia, like in many other developing nations, you need to treat water before you can drink it. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. At a community gathering, where the outreach team from Nazava was invited, Mrs Ningrum learnt about an easier and better way of getting safe drinking water. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity.

Mrs Ningrum who fulfills a leading function in her neighborhood seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. This is the second time Mrs Ningrum applies for a loan. She has an excellent record in repaying her loans.
This loan will allow Mrs Ningrum to buy 90 filters and sell them on consignment to her community making safe drinking water available to 450 people.

loans.use: To purchase water purifiers to sell to her fellow villagers providing them with safe drinking water.

loans.name: Karomatullo

texts.en:
Karomatullo is a student in his first semester. He is single and lives with his parents. He likes his family much and he dreams to be a good specialist in future. Karomatullo’s mother works in a school. His ather works in a state organization. Karomatullo’s parents have not opportunity to pay for his university tuition.

Karomatullo is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to pay for the university tuition. He await your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Sokchea

texts.en:
Sokchea, 36, lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is single.

To make a living, she works as a farmer in a small rice field that is located near her house. So far, it is more than ten years that she has been involved in this farming business, which can earn a net profit of USD 3 per day.

During this time of the rainy season, Yan wants to buy fertilizers and farming materials to operate her farming business. So, she decided to borrow a loan from HKL. She would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming materials.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha, 43 years old, lives in a rural area of Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been working as a farmer in a small rice field near her house for nearly twenty years. In total, She can make USD 2 per day from her farming operation.

She is borrowing a loan from HKL to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. Through this loan, she hopes that it will help her to promote her healthy and living condition. She thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson used the previous loan to pay workers who are weeding his garden and to buy sprays for his crops.He is a farmer who grows mainly maize, bananas, rice,beans and ground nuts. He started this business way back in 1995 and had a goal of earning income for his family. He supplies to the nearby market in his town council and his clients describe him as a hardworking person. He faces challenges of price changes that hinder him to expand his business and in the end gets low profits. However, Wilson has future hopes of diversifying his sources of income to include dairy farming, and also educate all his children to higher levels of learning. Wilson has asked for a loan to buy maize and ground nut seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy maize and ground nut seeds for planting.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is a fisherman. He catches and sells fish to the local in his place. Fishing is his main source of living for almost 15 years now.
He is married man with two grown children. He lives in the town of Dauis, Bohol.

He is asking for a loan to purchase fishing nets. These will improve his on-going catch and enables him to sold more volume of fish. Slowly, he could pay his obligations and able to balance his finances. In the long run, he could also expand his fishing livelihood to become more sustainable.

He is hoping that someday, he could build a better shelter for the whole family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is an individual client from Mpigi town council with a salon business and besides operating a mobile money business which she commenced in the year 2012. The client is aged 25 years old married with four children She’s looking forward to acquiring a loan one million five hundred thousand to buy a plot of land that she will use to build a family house in the near future.
She so appreciates the Kiva support and partnership.
Pictured is Juliet with the UGAFODE Credit officer(left to right)

loans.use: to top up on a plot of land.

loans.name: Saulo

texts.en:
Saulo is a retailer and at the same time, is employed by a cocoa trading company that adds more to his income. He is faced with challenges of inadequate capital that hinders progress of his retail business, and seasonal changes, since the cocoa business depends on seasons. However, he has hopes of expanding his business and developing it into a wholesale store.

Saulo has asked for a loan to add capital in his business by buying sugar, soap, cooking oil, rice, and wheat flour for sale.

loans.use: to add capital in his business by buying sugar, soap, cooking oil, rice, and wheat flour for sale.

loans.name: Socrates

texts.en:
Clean drinking water is hard to get in the isolated but gigantic tropical island of Papua. Because of that, many people get ill from drinking water. Socrates sells Nazava water filters that enable papuans to filter their well, river and rain water so it becomes safe to drink.

Mr Socrates, who sells Nazava Water filters in Papua noticed the impact of water filters directly: “The results of the use of Nazava Water Filters has been remarkable - people who had stomach ache now experience much better health. Almost every week there is a very touching story of the people in the interior who are not sick anymore because of wear water filter. There are many stories about people walking for a whole day so that they could drink from a water filter that is in another village. Anyway, we are grateful that we can run this service in West Papua.”

Mr Socrates will use this loan to purchase around 150 water filters that he will sell on to network of kiosks so that together they can tackle the lack of safe drinking water in Papua. This is the third loan that Mr Socrates has taken. He normally repays loans before schedule and always keeps in close contact with Nazava.

loans.use: to provide filters for his network of kiosks that provide safe drinking water to remote villages in West Papua, Indonesia.

loans.name: Equity Group

texts.en:
Vitalis is in his mid 40s and is single with two children. Both of them are still in school. He has been selling chips for two years now. He works from 7am to 11pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Vitalis' second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase his stock and has managed to pay back his loan successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to purchase Irish potatoes, a bucket of cooking oil and a sack of charcoal for cooking the chips. He dreams of opening another chips place in a different area.

Vitalis will share this loan with his loan group Equity, which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase Irish potatoes, a bucket of cooking oil and a sack of charcoal for cooking chips.

loans.name: Charity Ann

texts.en: Charity Ann is a 31-year-old woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is married and blessed with seven years old daughter. Her husband is a security guard while Charity Ann is engaged in selling frozen foods such as hotdogs, ham, pork and chicken tocino (sweetened pork/ sweetened chicken). She has been doing this for a year to help her husband in their daily expenses. Charity Ann plans to improve her business to have better means of living in the future. She is asking to lend money to buy frozen foods (mention above) and rice. Perhaps, part of her loan is for their daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy frozen foods such as hotdogs, ham, pork and chicken tocino (sweetened pork/ sweetened chicken); rice

loans.name: Saed

texts.en:
Saed lives with his parents in Jarash; he is example of ambitious and positive guy. Ahmad is 23 years old, university student majoring in Civil Engineering, and he did not find a suitable work beside his education.

He wishes to graduate to find good work to help his family in the household expenses and to carry responsible from his parents. Lately his father faced financial problems and he could not cover Saed`s university fees, therefore he decided to apply for an educational loan to pay for his university fees and achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees for a BSc. in Civil Engineering and thus achieve his goals.

loans.name: Bircan

texts.en:
Bircan is married and a mother of two. She is making trousseau such as table cloths and fabric bundles to put the trousseau in. She gets orders and produces from home. With the help of the loan she is planning to buy bulks of threads, cords and fabrics, produce more, sell more and develop her business.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Bircan hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Çeyiz işinden masa örtüsü, bohça gibi işler yapıyor. Yaptığı işleri evden sipariş alarak satıyor. Aldığı mikro kredi ile toptan kumaş ip alarak onları üreterek satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor

loans.use: to buy threads, cords and fabrics for her embroidery.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is an individual client from Buwama town board. She is 36 years old, married, with six children. Harriet deals in buying and selling of bananas which she started 1991. She works seven hours a day and faces a challenge of competition in the area of operation. Harriet is therefore looking forward to acquire a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to increase her working capital.

Harriet is pictured with the UGAFODE Credit staff(left to right)

loans.use: To boost her matooke trade business

loans.name: Noong Luong 31 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Panh is 49 years old, lives in a big family with four generations, including her mother-in-law, her husband, her son and daughter, her daughter-in-law and her grandchild. She is a very hard-working farmer and works very diligently at agricultural production to provide for the crowded family with several activities such as cultivating rice, raising buffalo, pig, chicken, fish... This is the fifth time she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy baby fish to expand fish farming. She hopes that the fish will grow fast and healthily, then help her reap good profit. 

Mrs. Panh dreams that her family will have better living conditions and will gradually escape from poverty. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy baby fish to expand fish farming

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is 50-years old lady; she is living with her husband and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. With very little experience her son began to start his manufacturing job. He was not a skillful person to work with a lathe machine. He has been learning the techniques for the lathe machine from professionals and now he came to know how to operate a lathe machine, so that he can carry on his newly started business. Due to his lack of experience the lathe machine got damage and needed maintenance.

Therefore, SHAHIDA has requested a loan for her son so that he can fulfill the deficiencies of lathe machine and can buy additional tools, dies, spare parts etc. Shahida is tension free now because she hopes that her son will be an expert soon and get reasonable income as an expert turner.
She is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to fix the deficiencies with her son's lathe machine and to buy tools, dies and spare parts.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity has a small farm in the village of Kinoru in central province of Kenya. This area is a primary milk and maize producing area. Charity is involved in both milk and maize production to provide for her family. She has also invested in poultry farming and other side-businesses to earn additional income.

Charity has improved the half an acre farm tremendously and employs someone to help her run the farm. She has a strategy in place that involves leveraging the business to ensure continuous growth of the farm into the future. She requests a loan to buy seeds and promote crop production. She will be able to secure more land space and farm supplies once the loan request is granted. Come next year when the season is over, she will be able to sell the harvest and make enough money to pay for farm costs for the subsequent seasons. She will also benefit from the proximity to an airport which will assist her in transporting her products to other markets both internationally and domestically.

This investment will raise her family's living standards. Kindly help her out!

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: G.s Group

texts.en:
Najla is the featured borrower of GS group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been close neighbors and friends, and they work hard to develop their families' living.

Najla is a hardworking lady. She is a 58-year-old married mother of one child. She has been working in Mouneh production and sales since 1998. Najla is an important source of income for her family since her husband can't work because of a certain medical situation.

Najla is well known in her region for the special quality of Mouneh she produces. Thus she is working hard on developing it as much as she can.

An acquired loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua will help Najla to buy the necessary Mouneh raw materials to increase her production and selling in addition to developing her family's living.

Najla is the first lady on the far left side of the picture. As for the other group members, Abir is the second from the left, Doua is the second from the right, while Loubna is the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy the necessary Mouneh raw materials to increase her production and selling in addition to developing her family's living.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
This is Cristina, 57, from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ernesto, a farmer, and they have four children, of which three are already married and their youngest is in High School. Her family may not have luxuries in life but the couple is happy that they have raised their children well. They have a tricycle and buy and sell fruits.

Cristina has been operating a tricycle for five years already. A tricycle is a motorcycle with a side car that carries around four passengers. It is a common means of transportation in the Philippines and serves as a kind of taxi for short distance travel.

Proper and regular maintenance of her tricycle is necessary to ensure efficient and safe service. In view of this, she is humbly seeking your help in the amount of 19,000 PHP to pay for new tires, tune up, change oil, and fuel for her tricycle. This will allow for good performance of her unit and result in a steady income for her family's needs and in sending her child to school.

She aims to buy more tricycle units to increase her income. Just like any loving mother she dreams of buying her children a house and lot. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for new tires, tune up, change oil, and fuel for her tricycle.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a woman eager to get ahead. She is 54 years old and lives with her husband in the Nkubu area of Kenya. She is blessed with three children. She perseveres because she wants to provide a better future for them. Mary was unable to study to have a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past ten years.

Mary has always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in her blood. Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows and goats, which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Her dairy goats produce between 5-10 liters a day; this helps her support her family. Mary also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs.

That is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, she will be able to purchase high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels.

Mary is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production over the previous year. Mary believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Mary's way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a university student majoring in civil engineering. He decided to study this major because he dreams of being responsible for building his own house and he hopes to be a successful manager of big projects in the Middle East. He believes that his success in the work stems from loving his work.

Mohammad needs financial support to achieve his dreams. Therefore, he applied for an educational loan to help him cover his university fees and complete his road.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Iroda

texts.en:
Iroda is a kind young woman. She is single and lives with her parents. Iroda is a student at the Pedagogical University of Tajikistan. She is a student of the faculty of foreign languages. She knows English well and dreams to be a good teacher in future.

Now, she needs financial support because her parents have no money. She is asking for a loan of 4500 Somoni to pay for the university tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition to graduate with a BA in English.

loans.name: Fakhry

texts.en:
Fakhry is a 42-year-old, married man living with his wife and three young children, who are still attending school. He is the main source of income for the family.

He has his business. He owns a hardware store in his town to fulfill his family's needs.

Due to the hard financial situation, Fakhry is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., to pay his children’s school fees.

Fakhry's only purpose is to help them attain high educational levels, to help them to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to pay his children’s school fees

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, who is 33 years old, is a charismatic young woman and a strong example of hard work. Agnes is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm she keeps cows and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Agnes makes a commission on sales for which she helps arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships, because reputation is everything in her line of work.

Given that Agnes can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to buy cereals from farmers to resell at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit. Your loan will help Agnes’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood. Support her dream by giving Agnes a loan!

loans.use: to buy cereals from farmers to resell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 38 years old woman with two children ages 9 and 11 years old respectively. She is married to a fisherman. She helps her husband by selling fresh fish and it serve as the family's main source of income.
She is need of capital to sustain her fishing livelihood.

She has requested a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing net and weights. These are essentials  tools in need for  the improvement on the yield of her husband. Thus, slowly it augment her income and able to support the needs of her family.
 
Judith is determined that she could expand existing business to become sustainable for her to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net and weights

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a man dedicated to his work. At age 27, he spends every day of the week on his mixed farm, tirelessly working. He is one of the most hardworking and dedicated men on planet Earth. He is based in Kamwimbi, a remote village in the Chuka area of Kenya. He is happily married to Mukami, who adds additional income to support their family. They have two children.

For the past ten years, he has been engaged in mixed farming, and through selling milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops, he has earned a decent income. Like many farmers in his village, he also plants trees on his farm to complement the region's natural forests.

Although Charles makes profits selling his farm produce at the market, the biggest challenge he faces is lack of water to irrigate his farm and water for home consumption. Charles comes from an area where there is no water connection, and he is always forced to walk for a long distance for this “precious commodity". Charles faces challenges carrying water on his back because of his failing health.

Charles is seeking a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes. Most of the farmers in Kenya depend on rain-fed agriculture, but Charles wants to change that notion and start irrigation farming. Through the loan, he intends to harvest rain water (which always goes to waste) and store it in the tank. He intends to buy pipes that will be used to pump water from the river directly to his farm. With your loan, Charles will be saved the trouble of walking a long distance in search of water, and he will have enough water for home consumption. Irrigating his farm will boost productivity, since water is an important requirement in the germination of crops.

Charles is very excited about this project and hopes his dream will be achieved through the loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders. Increased productivity means increased income, and this will translate to improved living standards. He will use the additional income to improve and secure the future of his children. Charles’ hope for the future is to live a fulfilling life.

Kindly make a loan to him!

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and water pipes.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en: Rami is an example of an ambitious guy. He is 23 years old and lives in West Irbid with his family that contains 7 members. Rami is studying in his third year to tack his bachelor's degree in civil engineering. Lately his family could not cover his semester fees therefore he is applying for an education loan to help him to cover the rest of the semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for his next semester fees

loans.name: Tropical S. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Hope. She is an administrator at Tropical S. School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Bwizibwera in Mbarara with 500 students. Tropical S. School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Tropical S. School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Hope ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Desline

texts.en:
Desline is a progressive mother of one child who practices mixed-farming in Marima village in Chuka, Kenya. She keeps dairy animals and poultry, and grows vegetables and fodder. She has been doing this for 3 years.

Desline is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed and to buy a chaff cutter. The cow shed that will facilitate zero-grazing in her farm. In a bid to grow her farm and produce more milk, Desline is shifting from the traditional ways and introducing zero-grazing into her farm. The mistake she is trying to avoid is creating a sketchy shelter as an excuse to avoid incurring expenses related to the construction of a proper dairy unit. With your loan, Desline is planning to build a dairy shed that will keep her animals in ways which allow them to move freely. It is important to her that the dairy shed allows her animals to assume natural postures and movements such as standing naturally, lying down easily, turning around freely, and stretching. With the byre in place, Desline will provide fresh water and feed to satisfy the nutritional needs of the cattle. Fresh air, natural sunlight, clean floor and hygienic surroundings within the shed will also be observed. In short, the shed will provide a conducive environment for milk production.

A chaff cutter is a mechanical device that is used in cutting hay into smaller pieces. Through the loan she will have a humble time feeding her cow because the cow will never reject any part of the food because they will be in smaller pieces hence increasing milk production.
Returns from this investment will help Desline to improve her livelihood and grow her rural agribusiness enterprise.
With your contribution, this woman will be able to make her dreams come true. Come on, make a loan!

loans.use: to construct a zero-grazing unit and to buy a chaffcutter

loans.name: Lylian

texts.en:
Lylian, 32 years old, is very clear about what she wants in life and determined to get ahead and have a good life. She is a smallholder farmer from Kitale in the Central region of Kenya. She owns a 2-acre farm where she practices mixed farming. This mother keeps dairy animals and grows maize and vegetables. She has 7 years of experience in farming.

Lylian is seeking a loan to expand her horticulture farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers with little irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations, such as Juhudi Kilimo, support farmers like Lylian. Through Juhudi Kilimo, Lylian has access to income-generating asset loans. According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. Lylian is kindly seeking for a loan to expand her horticulture farming. Because of the favorable weather and road conditions she will have an easy time transporting her horticulture products to the market. In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Lylian because the institution believes that women too are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry. Her main dream is to buy a house and pay for the education of her children.
You can help Lylian to accomplish all these dreams and more. A loan can do a lot to get her close to that.

loans.use: To expand her horticulture farming

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en:
Kwabena is 45 years old. He is married and has two children. His business is photographing. He has been in this business for 26 years.

He earns a good monthly income from this job. This is his second loan with Kiva and his seventh with ID-Ghana. He will use the loan to buy photo accessories in order to serve his customers. He has a wide range of customers and he sometimes serves them at his studio or goes to their homes.

He will use the profits to expand his business and pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy photo accessories in order to serve his customers.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima, 31, is a married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. Her whole family is fully dependent upon her husband; he is only single source of income.

Her husband owns a workshop in which he provides services to troubleshoot and assemble the bodies of auto rickshaws. He fixes the engines, removes the dents over the rickshaw’s body and paints for renewal.

His repairing tools have been wearing out over time and he wants to replace them with new ones but he does not have enough cash to buy these tools to continue his services.

Saima's husband has already spent his savings upon the maintenance of his workshop.

Therefore, Saima has requested a loan for her husband so that he could buy new repairing tools and some additional spare parts.

loans.use: to buy new repairing tools and some additional spare parts for her husband's rickshaw repairing workshop.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is an individual client from Bboza village in Mpigi town. She is an agriculturalist majoring in eggplant growing. She also has a project of brick laying as an income supplement. The client is 40 years old and married with six children who go to school. She also takes care of two dependents. She’s looking forward to acquiring a loan of 500,000 shillings to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers for her eggplant garden. She has a steady customer flow but is challenged by heavy rains and sometimes by drought. She appreciates that through the loans, she has been able to sustain her business and also improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Rosemeria

texts.en:
Rosemeria’s objective is to improve her quality of life and live a dignified life. These objectives prompted Rosemeria to begin mixed farming. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her family, she has been selling different varieties of food crops from her farmland, dairy goat milk and cow milk.

To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Chuka area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry and build poultry structures.

Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved. She will be able to buy more poultry and her poultry will have a comfortable place to stay in. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Kindly help her out!

loans.use: to buy poultry and build poultry structures.

loans.name: Basel

texts.en: Basel is a 22-year-old single man living in a sector in Jordan called Ramtha. He is studying to get his Bachelor's degree in electrical power engineering, and he is now in his third year. His father could not cover Basel's university fees because of the financial crises that he is facing. Therefore, he is applying for an educational loan to help him cover his semester fees. Basel's future plan is to work in the same field.

loans.use: To pay his education bills

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, 29, lives in Irbid and is studying to get his master`s degree in psychology. He lives in Ajloun with his family that consists of five members, including his parents, and his retired father.

Mohammad is hard working and always spends his free time studying and searching for new information. He is currently working as a teacher.

He would like to request a loan because he does not have enough finances to pay for his university fees. This loan will help him 0cover his university fees and graduate successfully.

After graduation, Mohammad hopes to have a proper job and then he will be able to save enough money to help his big family, and complete his advanced education.

loans.use: to pay tuition for university

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar’s husband has been driving a rickshaw over unpaved roads, which become the cause of its depreciation. Now the rickshaw is fully damaged and rattles when it is driven. This rickshaw does not pick up passengers's load; this is the reason her husband is unable to generate a single penny to cherish his beloved family. He wants to buy a new rickshaw but due to the lack of availability of funds, he is unable to buy a new rickshaw.

Therefore, Anwar has requested a loan so that her husband can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings.

Anwar is a 43-year-old woman living with her five children and her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income. She is very happy after receiving this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of her savings for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy second hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mayram

texts.ru: Майрам жительница района Бохтар. Ей 42 года и она замужем. Муж Майрам находится в Российской Федерации на заработках. Сама Майрам работает медсестрой в местной больнице. К сожалению, дом, в котором проживают Майрам со своей семьей, нуждается в срочном ремонте. Одной заработной платы Майрам не достаточно что бы сделать ремонт. Поэтому Майрам обратилась за кредитом. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку и надеется, что со средствами, который выслал ей муж, она сможет отремонтировать дом до наступления холодов.
texts.en: Mayram is a resident of the Bohtar region. She is 42 years old and married. Mayram's husband is away working in the Russian Federation. Mayram herself works as a nurse in the local hospital. Unfortunately, the house where Mayram and her family live needs to be renovated urgently. Mayram's wages alone are not sufficient to do the repairs, so Mayram has applied for a loan. She hopes for your support and hopes that, together with the funds that her husband has sent her, she will be able to renovate her house before the cold weather starts.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Dora Group

texts.en:
Kifah is the featured borrower for Dora Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and life at the same time.

Kifah is a 38-year-old married mother of three. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, she started 13 years ago working as a hairdresser from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. Kifah is a hardworking woman who is trying hard to develop her business.
